[I]0-i pointed in that direction with a smile , and presently [Neil]192-neil leaped into [the garden]1091-the garden . [His]192-neil eyes burned , and [he]192-neil had a black knife as [they]1098-they call it on the Highland side naked in [his]192-neil hand ; but , seeing [me]0-i beside [[his]192-neil mistress]1099-his mistress , stood like [a man struck]1100-a man struck .

" [He]192-neil has come to [your]1099-his mistress call , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " judge how near [he]192-neil was to [Edinburgh]10-edinburgh , or what was the nature of [[your]1099-his mistress father]3247-your father s errands . "[0-i]

[She]1099-his mistress addressed [him]192-neil tremulously in the Gaelic . Remembering [Alan]185-alan s anxious civility in that particular , [I]0-i could have laughed out loud for bitterness ; here , sure , in the midst of these suspicions , was the hour [she]1099-his mistress should have stuck by English .

Twice or thrice [they]1101-they spoke together , and [I]0-i could make out that [Neil]192-neil for all [his]192-neil obsequiousness was [an angry man]1102-an angry man .

Then [she]1099-his mistress turned to [me]0-i . " [He]192-neil swears it is not , "[1099-his mistress] [she]1099-his mistress said .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " do [you]189-catriona believe [the man]3029-the man [yourself]189-catriona ? "[0-i]

" But [I]0-i must find some means to know , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]0-i can not continue to go dovering round in the black night with [two men]3750-two men s lives at [my]0-i girdle ! [Catriona]189-catriona , try to put [yourself]189-catriona in [my]0-i place , as [I]0-i vow to [God]223-god [I]0-i try hard to put [myself]0-i in [yours]189-catriona . [They]1103-they spoke together once more in the Gaelic .

" [He]3762-him says [he]3762-him has [James]181-james More [[my]1104-she father]417-my father s errand , "[1104-she] said [she]1104-she . [She]1104-she was whiter than ever , and [her]1104-she voice faltered as [she]1104-she said it .

" It is pretty plain now , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and may [God]223-god forgive [the wicked]3764-the wicked ! "[0-i]

[She]1104-she said never anything to that , but continued gazing at [me]0-i with the same white face .

" This is a fine business , "[0-i] said [I]0-i again . " Am [I]0-i to fall , then , and those two along with [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" O , what am [I]1104-she to do ? "[1104-she] [she]1104-she cried . " Could [I]1104-she go against [[my]1104-she father]417-my father s orders , [him]417-my father in [prison]2988-prison , in the danger of [his]417-my father life ! "[1104-she]

" But perhaps [we]1062-the pair of us go too fast , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " This may be a lie too . [He]417-my father may have no right orders ; all may be contrived by [Simon]240-mr. simon , and [[your]0-i father]3247-your father knowing nothing . "[0-i]

[She]1104-she burst out weeping between [the pair of [us]1062-the pair of us]1062-the pair of us ; and [my]0-i heart smote [me]0-i hard , for [I]0-i thought [this girl]1106-this girl was in a dreadful situation .

" Here , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " keep [him]417-my father but the one hour ; and [I]0-i ll chance it , and may [God]223-god bless [you]1106-this girl . "[0-i]

[She]1104-she put out [her]1104-she hand to [me]0-i , " [I]1104-she will [he]417-my father needing one good word , "[1104-she] [she]1104-she sobbed .

" The full hour , then ? "[0-i] said [I]0-i , keeping [her]1104-she hand in [mine]0-i . " Three lives of it , [[my]0-i lass]3768-my lass ! "[0-i]

" The full hour ! "[1104-she] [she]1104-she said , and cried aloud on [her]1104-she Redeemer to forgive [her]1104-she .

[I]0-i thought it no fit place for [me]0-i , and fled .

CHAPTER XI [THE WOOD BY SILVERMILLS]1107-the wood by silvermills

[I]0-i lost no time , but down through [the valley]1086-the valley and by [Stockbridge]63-stockbridge and [Silvermills]1-silvermills as hard as [I]0-i could stave . It was [Alan]185-alan s tryst to be every night between twelve and two " in a bit scrog of wood by [east of Silvermills]3769-east of silvermills and by south [the south mill - lade]3770-the south mill - lade . "[185-alan] This [I]0-i found easy enough , where [it]1109-it grew on [a steep brae]1110-a steep brae , with [the mill - lade]1111-the mill - lade flowing swift and deep along the foot of [it]1110-a steep brae ; and here [I]0-i began to walk slower and to reflect more reasonably on [my]0-i employment . [I]0-i saw [I]0-i had made but a fool s bargain with [Catriona]189-catriona . It was not to be supposed that [Neil]192-neil was sent alone upon [his]192-neil errand , but perhaps [he]192-neil was [the only man belonging to [James More]181-james]1112-the only man belonging to james more ; in which case [I]0-i should have done all [I]0-i could to hang [[Catriona]189-catriona s father]1113-catriona s father , and nothing the least material to help [myself]0-i . To tell the truth , [I]0-i fancied neither one of these ideas . Suppose by holding back [Neil]192-neil , [the girl]517-the girl should have helped to hang [[her]517-the girl father]760-her father , [I]0-i thought [she]517-the girl would never forgive [herself]517-the girl this side of time . And suppose there were others pursuing [me]0-i that moment , what kind of a gift was [I]0-i come bringing to [Alan]185-alan ? and how would [I]0-i like that ?

[I]0-i was up with the west end of [that wood]1116-that wood when these two considerations struck [me]0-i like a cudgel . [My]0-i feet stopped of themselves and [my]0-i heart along with them . " What wild game is this that [I]0-i have been playing ? "[0-i] thought [I]0-i ; and turned instantly upon [my]0-i heels to go elsewhere .

This brought [my]0-i face to [Silvermills]1-silvermills ; the path came past [the village]1117-the village with a crook , but all plainly visible ; and , [Highland]11-highland or [Lowland]65-lowland , there was [nobody stirring]1118-nobody stirring . Here was [my]0-i advantage , [here]3174-here was just such a conjuncture as [Stewart]199-stewart had counselled [me]0-i to profit by , and [I]0-i ran by the side of [the mill - lade]1111-the mill - lade , fetched about beyond [the east corner of [the wood]1122-the wood]1121-the east corner of the wood , threaded through the midst of it , and returned to the west selvage , whence [I]0-i could again command the path , and yet be [myself]0-i unseen . Again it was all empty , and [my]0-i heart began to rise .

For more than an hour [I]0-i sat close in the border of the trees , and no hare or eagle could have kept a more particular watch . When that hour began the sun was already set , but the sky still all golden and the daylight clear ; before the hour was done it had fallen to be half mirk , the images and distances of things were mingled , and observation began to be difficult . All that time [not a foot of man]1123-not a foot of man had come east from [Silvermills]1-silvermills , and [the few that had gone west]1124-the few that had gone west were [honest countryfolk]1125-honest countryfolk and [[their]1125-honest countryfolk wives]1126-their wives upon [the road]971-the road to bed . If [I]0-i were tracked by [the most cunning spies in [Europe]67-europe]1128-the most cunning spies in europe , [I]0-i judged it was beyond the course of nature [they]1128-the most cunning spies in europe could have any jealousy of where [I]0-i was : and going a little further [home]658-home into [the wood]1122-the wood [I]0-i lay down to wait for [Alan]185-alan .

The strain of [my]0-i attention had been great , for [I]0-i had watched not the path only , but every bush and field within [my]0-i vision . That was now at an end . The moon , which was in [her]1131-her first quarter , glinted a little in [the wood]1122-the wood ; all round there was a stillness of [the country]431-the country ; and as [I]0-i lay there on [my]0-i back , the next three or four hours , [I]0-i had a fine occasion to review [my]0-i conduct .

Two things became plain to [me]0-i first : that [I]0-i had no right to go that day to [Dean]14-dean , and having gone there had now no right to be lying where [I]0-i was . This where [Alan]185-alan was to come was just [the one wood in all broad [Scotland]182-prestongrange]1134-the one wood in all broad scotland that was , by every proper feeling , closed against [me]0-i ; [I]0-i admitted that , and yet stayed on , wondering at [myself]0-i . [I]0-i thought of the measure with which [I]0-i had meted to [Catriona]189-catriona that same night ; how [I]0-i had prated of the two lives [I]0-i carried , and had thus forced [her]189-catriona to enjeopardy [[her]189-catriona father]760-her father s ; and how [I]0-i was here exposing [them]1136-them again , it seemed in wantonness . A good conscience is eight parts of courage . No sooner had [I]0-i lost conceit of [my]0-i behaviour , than [I]0-i seemed to stand disarmed amidst [a throng of terrors]1137-a throng of terrors . Of a sudden [I]0-i sat up . How if [I]0-i went now to [Prestongrange]182-prestongrange , caught [him]182-prestongrange as [I]0-i still easily might before [he]182-prestongrange slept , and made a full submission ? Who could blame [me]0-i ? Not [Stewart the Writer]199-stewart ; [I]0-i had but to say that [I]0-i was followed , despaired of getting clear , and so gave in . Not [Catriona]189-catriona : here , too , [I]0-i had [my]0-i answer ready ; that [I]0-i could not bear [she]189-catriona should expose [[her]189-catriona father]760-her father . So , in a moment , [I]0-i could lay all these troubles by , which were after all and truly none of [mine]0-i ; swim clear of the Appin Murder ; get forth out of hand - stroke of all [the Stewarts]205-the stewarts and [Campbells]204-the campbells , [all the Whigs and Tories]1139-all the whigs and tories , in [the land]1140-the land ; and live henceforth to [my]0-i own mind , and be able to enjoy and to improve [my]0-i fortunes , and devote some hours of [my]0-i youth to courting [Catriona]189-catriona , which would be surely a more suitable occupation than to hide and run and be followed like [a hunted thief]1141-a hunted thief , and begin over again the dreadful miseries of [my]0-i escape with [Alan]185-alan .

At first [I]0-i thought no shame of this capitulation ; [I]0-i was only amazed [I]0-i had not thought upon the thing and done it earlier ; and began to inquire into the causes of the change . These [I]0-i traced to [my]0-i lowness of spirits , that back to [my]0-i late recklessness , and that again to the common , old , public , disconsidered sin of self - indulgence . Instantly the text came in [my]0-i head , " How can [Satan]274-satan cast out [Satan]274-satan ? "[0-i] What ? [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had , by self - indulgence ; and the following of pleasant paths , and the lure of [a young maid]1142-a young maid , cast [myself]0-i wholly out of conceit with [my]0-i own character , and jeopardised the lives of [James]181-james and [Alan]185-alan ? And [I]0-i was to seek the way out by [the same road]1143-the same road as [I]0-i had entered in ? No ; the hurt that had been caused by self - indulgence must be cured by self - denial ; the flesh [I]0-i had pampered must be crucified . [I]0-i looked about [me]0-i for that course which [I]0-i least liked to follow : this was to leave [the wood]1122-the wood without waiting to see [Alan]185-alan , and go forth again alone , in the dark and in the midst of [my]0-i perplexed and dangerous fortunes .

[I]0-i have been the more careful to narrate this passage of [my]0-i reflections , because [I]0-i think it is of some utility , and may serve as an example to [young men]1145-young men . But there is reason [they]1145-young men say in planting kale , and even in ethic and religion , room for common sense . It was already close on [Alan]185-alan s hour , and the moon was down . If [I]0-i left as [I]0-i could not very decently whistle to [[my]0-i spies]1146-my spies to follow [me]0-i [they]1146-my spies might miss [me]0-i in the dark and tack [themselves]1146-my spies to [Alan]185-alan by mistake . If [I]0-i stayed , [I]0-i could at the least of it set [[my]0-i friend]3036-my friend upon [his]185-alan guard which might prove [his]185-alan mere salvation . [I]0-i had adventured [other peoples]1148-other peoples safety in a course of self - indulgence ; to have endangered [them]1148-other peoples again , and now on a mere design of penance , would have been scarce rational . Accordingly , [I]0-i had scarce risen from [my]0-i place ere [I]0-i sat down again , but already in a different frame of spirits , and equally marvelling at [my]0-i past weakness and rejoicing in [my]0-i present composure .

Presently after came a crackling in the thicket . Putting [my]0-i mouth near down to the ground , [I]0-i whistled a note or two , of [Alan]185-alan s air ; an answer came in the like guarded tone , and soon [we]1149-we had knocked together in the dark .

" Is this [you]0-i at last , [Davie]222-davie ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan whispered .

" Just [myself]0-i , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [God]223-god , [man]3015-man , but [I]185-alan ve been wearying to see [ye]0-i ! "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan . " [I]185-alan ve had the longest kind of a time . A day , [I]185-alan ve had [my]185-alan dwelling into the inside of a stack of hay , where [I]185-alan couldnae see the nebs of [my]185-alan ten fingers ; and then two hours of it waiting here for [you]0-i , and [you]0-i never coming ! [Dod]275-dod , and [ye]0-i re none too soon the way it is , with [me]185-alan to sail the morn ! The morn ? what am [I]185-alan saying ? the day , [I]185-alan mean . "[185-alan]

" Ay , [Alan]185-alan , [man]3015-man , the day , sure enough , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " It s past twelve now , surely , and [ye]3015-man sail the day . This ll be a long road [you]3015-man have before [you]3015-man . "[0-i]

" [We]3773-we ll have a long crack of it first , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

" Well , indeed , and [I]0-i have a good deal it will be telling [you]185-alan to hear , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

And [I]0-i told [him]185-alan what behooved , making rather a jumble of it , but clear enough when done . [He]185-alan heard [me]0-i out with very few questions , laughing here and there like [a man]519-a man delighted : and the sound of [his]185-alan laughing above all there , in the dark , where neither one of [us]1151-us could see [the other]3003-the other was extraordinary friendly to [my]0-i heart .

" Ay , [Davie]222-davie , [ye]222-davie re [a queer character]3774-a queer character , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , when [I]0-i had done : " [a queer bitch]3775-a queer bitch after a , and [I]1153-i have no mind of meeting with [the like of [ye]222-davie]3776-the like of ye . As for [your]222-davie story , [Prestongrange]182-prestongrange is [a Whig like yoursel]3777-a whig like yoursel , so [I]1153-i ll say the less of [him]182-prestongrange ; and , dod ! [I]1153-i believe [he]182-prestongrange was [the best friend [ye]222-davie had]3778-the best friend ye had , if [ye]222-davie could only trust [him]182-prestongrange . But [Simon Fraser]240-mr. simon and [James More]181-james are [[my]1153-i ain kind of cattle]3779-my ain kind of cattle , and [I]1153-i ll give [them]3779-my ain kind of cattle the name that [they]3779-my ain kind of cattle deserve . [The muckle black deil]3780-the muckle black deil was father to [the Frasers]276-the frasers , a body kens that ; and as for [the Gregara]194-the gregara , [I]1153-i never could abye the reek of [them]3779-my ain kind of cattle since [I]1153-i could stotter on two feet . [I]1153-i bloodied the nose of one , [I]1153-i mind , when [I]1153-i was still so wambly on [my]1153-i legs that [I]1153-i cowped upon the top of [him]182-prestongrange . [A proud man]3781-a proud man was [[my]1153-i father]417-my father that day , [God]223-god rest [him]3781-a proud man ! and [I]1153-i think [he]3781-a proud man had the cause . [I]1153-i ll never can deny but what [Robin]262-robin was something of [a piper]3783-a piper , "[1153-i] [he]1153-i added ; " but as for [James More]181-james , [the deil]3784-the deil guide [him]181-james for [me]1153-i ! "[1153-i]

" One thing [we]3785-we have to consider , "[1154-i.] said [I.]1154-i. " Was [Charles Stewart]199-stewart right or wrong ? Is it only [me]1154-i. [they]3786-they re after , or [the pair of [us]3785-we]1062-the pair of us ? "[1154-i.]

" And what s [your]1154-i. ain opinion , [you]1154-i. that s [a man of so much experience]3788-a man of so much experience ? "[1153-i] said [he]1153-i .

" [It]3789-it passes [me]1154-i. , "[1154-i.] said [I.]1154-i.

" And [me]185-alan too , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan . " Do [ye]1154-i. think [this lass]3790-this lass would keep [her]3790-this lass word to [ye]1154-i. ? "[1153-i] [he]1153-i asked .

" [I]1154-i. do that , "[1154-i.] said [I.]1154-i.

" Well , there s nae telling , "[1153-i] said [he]1153-i . " And anyway , that s over and done : [he]1153-i ll be joined to the rest of [them]3791-they lang syne . "[1153-i]

" How many would [ye]185-alan think there would be of [them]3791-they ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" That depends , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " If it was only [you]0-i , [they]3791-they would likely send [two - three lively , brisk young birkies]3792-two - three lively , brisk young birkies , and if [they]3791-they thought that [I]185-alan was to appear in [the employ]3793-the employ , [I]185-alan daresay ten or twelve , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

It was no use , [I]0-i gave a little crack of laughter .

" And [I]185-alan think [your]0-i own two eyes will have seen [me]185-alan drive that number , or the double of it , nearer hand ! "[185-alan] cries [he]185-alan .

" It matters the less , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " because [I]0-i am well rid of [them]3791-they for this time . "[0-i]

" [Nae]3794-nae doubt that s [your]0-i opinion , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan ; " but [I]185-alan wouldnae be the least surprised if [they]3791-they were hunkering [this wood]3795-this wood . [Ye]0-i see , [David man]3796-david man ; [they]3791-they ll be [Hieland folk]3797-hieland folk . There ll be some [Frasers]276-the frasers , [I]185-alan m thinking , and [some of [the Gregara]194-the gregara]3798-some of the gregara ; and [I]185-alan would never deny but what [the both of [them]3799-the both of them]3799-the both of them , and [the Gregara]194-the gregara in especial , were [clever experienced persons]3800-clever experienced persons . [A man]519-a man kens little till [he]519-a man s driven a spreagh of neat cattle say ten miles through [a throng lowland country]3802-a throng lowland country and [the black soldiers]3803-the black soldiers maybe at [his]519-a man tail . It s there that [I]185-alan learned a great part of [my]185-alan penetration . And [ye]3804-ye need [nae]3805-nae tell [me]185-alan : it s better than war ; which is the next best , however , though generally rather a bauchle of a business . Now [the Gregara]194-the gregara have had grand practice . "[185-alan]

" No doubt that s a branch of education that was left out with [me]1155-me , "[1155-me] said [I.]1155-me

" And [I]185-alan can see the marks of it upon [ye]3804-ye constantly , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " But that s the strange thing about [[you]3804-ye folk of the college learning]3806-you folk of the college learning : [ye]3804-ye re ignorat , and [ye]3804-ye cannae see t. Wae s [me]185-alan for [my]185-alan Greek and Hebrew ; but , [man]3015-man , [I]185-alan ken that [I]185-alan dinnae ken [them]194-the gregara there s the differ of it . Now , here s [you]3804-ye . [Ye]3804-ye lie on [your]3804-ye wame a bittie in the bield of [this wood]3795-this wood , and [ye]3804-ye tell [me]185-alan that [ye]3804-ye ve cuist off these Frasers and [Macgregors]190-the glengyle macgregors . Why ? Because [I]185-alan couldnae see [them]194-the gregara , says [you]3804-ye . [Ye]3804-ye blockhead , that s [their]194-the gregara livelihood . "[185-alan]

" Take the worst of it , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and what are [we]3809-we to do ? "[0-i]

" [I]1156-i am thinking of that same , "[1156-i] said [he]1156-i . " [We]3809-we might twine . It wouldnae be greatly to [my]1156-i taste ; and forbye that , [I]1156-i see reasons against it . First , it s now unco dark , and it s just humanly possible [we]3809-we might give [them]194-the gregara the clean slip . If [we]3809-we keep together , [we]3809-we make but the ae line of it ; if [we]3809-we gang separate , [we]3809-we make twae of [them]194-the gregara : the more likelihood to stave in upon [some of [these gentry of yours]3811-these gentry of yours]3810-some of these gentry of yours . And then , second , if [they]194-the gregara keep the track of [us]3809-we , it may come to a fecht for it yet , [Davie]222-davie ; and then , [I]1156-i ll confess [I]1156-i would be blythe to have [you]222-davie at [[my]1156-i oxter]3812-my oxter , and [I]1156-i think [you]222-davie would be none the worse of having [me]1156-i at [yours]222-davie . So , by [my]1156-i way of it , [we]3809-we should creep out of [this wood]3795-this wood no further gone than just the inside of next minute , and hold away east for [Gillane]47-gillane , where [I]1156-i m to find [[my]1156-i ship]3814-my ship . It ll be like old days while it lasts , [Davie]222-davie ; and come the time [we]3809-we ll have to think what [you]222-davie should be doing . [I]1156-i m wae to leave [ye]222-davie here , wanting [me]1156-i . "[1156-i]

" Have with [ye]222-davie , then ! "[1157-i.] says [I.]1157-i. " Do [ye]222-davie gang back where [you]222-davie were stopping ? "[1157-i.]

" Deil a fear ! "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " [They]3815-they were [good folks to [me]185-alan]3816-good folks to me , but [I]185-alan think [they]3815-they would be a good deal disappointed if [they]3815-they saw [my]185-alan bonny face again . For the way times go [I]185-alan am nae just what [ye]222-davie could call a [Walcome Guest]68-walcome guest . Which makes [me]185-alan the keener for [[your]222-davie company]3817-your company , [Mr. David Balfour of the Shaws]222-davie , and set [ye]222-davie up ! For , leave aside twa cracks here in [the wood]1122-the wood with [Charlie Stewart]199-stewart , [I]185-alan have scarce said black or white since the day [we]1159-we parted at [Corstorphine]69-corstorphine . "[185-alan]

With which [he]1158-he rose from [his]1158-he place , and [we]1159-we began to move quietly eastward through [the wood]1122-the wood .

CHAPTER XII ON THE MARCH AGAIN WITH [ALAN]185-alan

It was likely between one and two ; the moon as [I]0-i have said was down ; a strongish wind , carrying a heavy wrack of cloud , had set in suddenly from the west ; and [we]1159-we began [our]1159-we movement in as black a night as ever [a fugitive]1161-a fugitive or [a murderer]1162-a murderer wanted . The whiteness of the path guided [us]1159-we into [the sleeping town of [Broughton]2-broughton]1163-the sleeping town of broughton , thence through [Picardy]25-picardy , and beside [[my]0-i old acquaintance]1164-my old acquaintance the gibbet of [the two thieves]1165-the two thieves . A little beyond [we]1159-we made a useful beacon , which was a light in an upper window of [Lochend]5-poor old lochend . Steering by this , but a good deal at random , and with some trampling of the harvest , and stumbling and falling down upon [the banks]1166-the banks , [we]1159-we made [our]1159-we way across country , and won forth at last upon [the linky , boggy muirland that [they]1168-they call [the Figgate Whins]71-the figgate whins]1167-the linky , boggy muirland that they call the figgate whins . Here , under [a bush of whin]1169-a bush of whin , [we]1159-we lay down the remainder of that night and slumbered .

The day called [us]1159-we about five . A beautiful morning it was , the high westerly wind still blowing strong , but the clouds all blown away to [Europe]67-europe . [Alan]185-alan was already sitting up and smiling to [himself]185-alan . It was [my]0-i first sight of [[my]0-i friend]3036-my friend since [we]1159-we were parted , and [I]0-i looked upon [him]185-alan with enjoyment . [He]185-alan had still the same big great - coat on [his]185-alan back ; but what was new [he]185-alan had now a pair of knitted boot - hose drawn above the knee . Doubtless these were intended for disguise ; but , as the day promised to be warm , [he]185-alan made a most unseasonable figure .

" Well , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " is this no a bonny morning ? Here is a day that looks the way that a day ought to . This is a great change of it from the belly of [my]185-alan haystack ; and while [you]222-davie were there sottering and sleeping [I]185-alan have done a thing that maybe [I]185-alan do very seldom . "[185-alan]

" And what was that ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" O , just said [my]185-alan prayers , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

" And where are [[my]0-i gentry]3819-my gentry , as [ye]185-alan call [them]3819-my gentry ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Gude kens , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan ; " and the short and the long of it is that [we]1171-we must take [our]1171-we chance of [them]3819-my gentry . Up with [your]185-alan foot - soles , [Davie]222-davie ! Forth , [Fortune]277-fortune , once again of it ! And a bonny walk [we]1171-we are like to have . "[185-alan]

So [we]1171-we went east by [the beach of the sea]1172-the beach of the sea , towards where the salt - pans were smoking in by [the Esk mouth]1173-the esk mouth . No doubt there was a by - ordinary bonny blink of morning sun on [[Arthur]278-arthur s Seat]1174-arthur s seat and [the green Pentlands]72-the green pentlands ; and the pleasantness of the day appeared to set [Alan]185-alan among nettles .

" [I]185-alan feel like [a gomeral]3820-a gomeral , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , " to be leaving [Scotland]182-prestongrange on a day like this . It sticks in [my]185-alan head ; [I]185-alan would maybe like it better to stay here and hing . "[185-alan]

" Ay , but [ye]185-alan wouldnae , [Alan]185-alan , "[1175-i.] said [I.]1175-i.

" No , but what [France]50-france is [a good place]3821-a good place too , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan explained ; " but it s some way no the same . It s brawer [I]185-alan believe , but it s no [Scotland]182-prestongrange . [I]185-alan like it fine when [I]185-alan m there , [man]3015-man ; yet [I]185-alan kind of weary for Scots divots and [the Scots peat - reek]3823-the scots peat - reek . "[185-alan]

" If that s all [you]185-alan have to complain of , [Alan]185-alan , it s no such great affair , "[1175-i.] said [I.]1175-i.

" And it sets [me]185-alan ill to be complaining , whatever , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " and [me]185-alan but new out of yon deil s haystack . "[185-alan]

" And so [you]185-alan were unco weary of [your]185-alan haystack ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Weary s nae word for it , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " [I]185-alan m not just precisely [a man that s easily cast down]3824-a man that s easily cast down ; but [I]185-alan do better with caller air and the lift above [my]185-alan head . [I]185-alan m like the auld Black Douglas wasnae t ? that likit better to hear the laverock sing than the mouse cheep . And [yon place]3825-yon place , [ye]0-i see , [Davie]222-davie whilk was [a very suitable place to hide in , as [I]185-alan m free to own]3826-a very suitable place to hide in , as i m free to own was pit mirk from dawn to gloaming . There were days or nights , for how would [I]185-alan tell one from other ? that seemed to [me]185-alan as long as a long winter . "[185-alan]

" How did [you]185-alan know the hour to bide [your]185-alan tryst ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [The goodman]3827-the goodman brought [me]185-alan [my]185-alan meat and a drop brandy , and a candle - dowp to eat it by , about eleeven , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " So , when [I]185-alan had swallowed a bit , it would [he]3827-the goodman time to be getting to [the wood]1122-the wood . There [I]185-alan lay and wearied for [ye]0-i sore , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , laying [his]185-alan hand on [my]0-i shoulder " and guessed when the two hours would be about by unless [Charlie Stewart]199-stewart would come and tell [me]185-alan on [his]199-stewart watch and then back to [the dooms haystack]3829-the dooms haystack . [Na]279-na , it was a driech employ , and praise [the Lord]3830-the lord that [I]185-alan have warstled through with it ! "[185-alan]

" What did [you]185-alan do with [yourself]185-alan ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Faith , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " the best [I]185-alan could ! Whiles [I]185-alan played at the knucklebones . [I]185-alan m [an extraordinar good hand at the knucklebones]3831-an extraordinar good hand at the knucklebones , but it s a poor piece of business playing with naebody to admire [ye]0-i . And whiles [I]185-alan would make songs . "[185-alan]

" What were they about ? "[0-i] says [I.]0-i

" O , about the deer and the heather , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , " and about [the ancient old chiefs that are all by with it lang syne]3832-the ancient old chiefs that are all by with it lang syne , and just about what songs are about in general . And then whiles [I]185-alan would make believe [I]185-alan had a set of pipes and [I]185-alan was playing . [I]185-alan played some grand springs , and [I]185-alan thought [I]185-alan played them awful bonny ; [I]185-alan vow whiles that [I]185-alan could hear the squeal of them ! But the great affair is that it s done with . "[185-alan]

With that [he]185-alan carried [me]0-i again to [my]0-i adventures , which [he]185-alan heard all over again with more particularity , and extraordinary approval , swearing at intervals that [I]0-i was " a queer character of [a callant]3833-a callant . "[185-alan]

" So [ye]0-i were frich ened of [Sim Fraser]240-mr. simon ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan asked once .

" In troth was [I]0-i ! "[0-i] cried [I.]0-i

" So would [I]185-alan have been , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " And that is indeed [a driedful man]3834-a driedful man . But it is only proper to give [the deil]3784-the deil [his]3784-the deil due : and [I]185-alan can tell [you]0-i [he]3784-the deil is [a most respectable person on the field of war]3836-a most respectable person on the field of war . "[185-alan]

" Is [he]3784-the deil so brave ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Brave ! "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " [He]3784-the deil is as brave as [my]185-alan steel sword . "[185-alan]

The story of [my]0-i duel set [him]185-alan beside [himself]185-alan .

" To think of that ! "[185-alan] [he]185-alan cried . " [I]185-alan showed [ye]0-i the trick in [Corrynakiegh]73-corrynakiegh too . And three times three times disarmed ! It s a disgrace upon [my]185-alan character that learned [ye]0-i ! Here , stand up , out with [your]0-i airn ; [ye]0-i shall walk no step beyond this place upon [the road]971-the road till [ye]0-i can do [yoursel]3838-yoursel and [me]185-alan mair credit . "[185-alan]

" [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " this is midsummer madness . Here is no time for fencing lessons . "[0-i]

" [I]185-alan cannae well say no to that , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan admitted . " But three times , [man]3015-man ! And [you]3015-man standing there like a straw bogle and rinning to fetch [your]3015-man ain sword like a doggie with a pocket - napkin ! [David]222-davie , [this man Duncansby]3840-this man duncansby must be something altogether by - ordinar ! [He]3840-this man duncansby maun be extraordinar skilly . If [I]185-alan had the time , [I]185-alan would gang straight back and try a turn at [him]3840-this man duncansby mysel . [The man]3029-the man must be [a provost]3842-a provost . "[185-alan]

" [[You]185-alan silly fellow]3843-you silly fellow , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [you]185-alan forget it was just [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Na , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " but three times ! "[185-alan]

" When [ye]185-alan ken [yourself]185-alan that [I]0-i am fair incompetent , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

" Well , [I]185-alan never heard tell the equal of it , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

" [I]0-i promise [you]185-alan the one thing , [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " The next time that [we]3844-we forgather , [I]0-i ll be better learned . [You]185-alan shall not continue to bear the disgrace of [a friend that can not strike]3720-a friend that can not strike . "[0-i]

" Ay , the next time ! "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan . " And when will that be , [I]185-alan would like to ken ? "[185-alan]

" Well , [Alan]185-alan , [I]0-i have had some thoughts of that , too , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " and [my]0-i plan is this . It s [my]0-i opinion to be called [an advocate]3846-an advocate . "[0-i]

" That s but a weary trade , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan , " and rather a blagyard one forby . [Ye]222-davie would be better in [a king]2948-a king s coat than that . "[185-alan]

" And no doubt that would be the way to have [us]3844-we meet , "[0-i] cried [I.]0-i " But as [you]222-davie ll be in [King Lewie]212-king lewie s coat , and [I]0-i ll be in [King Geordie]208-king george s , [we]3844-we ll have a dainty meeting of it . "[0-i]

" There s some sense in that , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan admitted .

" [An advocate]3846-an advocate , then , it ll have to be , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " and [I]0-i think it a more suitable trade for [a gentleman that was three times disarmed]3849-a gentleman that was three times disarmed . But the beauty of the thing is this : that one of [the best colleges for that kind of learning]3850-the best colleges for that kind of learning and [the one where [[my]0-i kinsman]476-my kinsman , [Pilrig]180-mr. balfour , made [his]180-mr. balfour studies is [the college of [Leyden]74-leyden in [Holland]75-holland]3853-the college of leyden in holland]3851-the one where my kinsman , pilrig , made his studies is the college of leyden in holland . Now , what say [you]222-davie , [Alan]185-alan ? Could not [a cadet of [Royal Ecossais]3855-royal ecossais]3854-a cadet of royal ecossais get a furlough , slip over [the marches]3856-the marches , and call in upon [a Leyden student]3857-a leyden student ? "[0-i]

" Well , and [I]1176-i would think [he]3857-a leyden student could ! "[1176-i] cried [he]1176-i . " [Ye]3858-ye see , [I]1176-i stand well in with [[my]1176-i colonel]3859-my colonel , [Count Drummond - Melfort]280-count drummond - melfort ; and , what s mair to the purpose [I]1176-i have [a cousin of [mine]1176-i lieutenant - colonel in [a regiment of [the Scots - Dutch]281-the dutch]3861-a regiment of the scots - dutch]3860-a cousin of mine lieutenant - colonel in a regiment of the scots - dutch . "[1176-i]

" Is [Lord Meloort]283-lord meloort [an author]3863-an author , then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , for much as [Alan]185-alan thought of [soldiers]879-soldiers , [I]0-i thought more of [the gentry that write books]1178-the gentry that write books .

" The very same , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " [One]503-one would think [a colonel]3865-a colonel would have something better to attend to . But what can [I]185-alan say that make songs ? "[185-alan]

" Well , then , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " it only remains [you]185-alan should give [me]0-i an address to write [you]185-alan at in [France]50-france ; and as soon as [I]0-i am got to [Leyden]74-leyden [I]0-i will send [you]185-alan [mine]0-i . "[0-i]

" The best will be to write [me]185-alan in the care of [[my]185-alan chieftain]3866-my chieftain , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " [Charles Stewart]199-stewart , of [Ardsheil]211-young ardsheil , [Esquire]77-esquire , at [the town of Melons]3867-the town of melons , in [the Isle of [France]50-france]3868-the isle of france . It might take long , or it might take short , but it would aye get to [my]185-alan hands at the last of it . "[185-alan]

[We]1179-we had a haddock to [our]1179-we breakfast in [Musselburgh]78-musselburgh , where it amused [me]0-i vastly to hear [Alan]185-alan . [His]185-alan great - coat and boot - hose were extremely remarkable this warm morning , and perhaps some hint of an explanation had been wise ; but [Alan]185-alan went into that matter like a business , or [I]0-i should rather say , like a diversion . [He]185-alan engaged [the goodwife of [the house]818-the house]1180-the goodwife of the house with some compliments upon the rizzoring of [[our]1179-we haddocks]1182-our haddocks ; and the whole of the rest of [our]1179-we stay held [her]1180-the goodwife of the house in talk about a cold [he]185-alan had taken on [his]185-alan stomach , gravely relating all manner of symptoms and sufferings , and hearing with a vast show of interest all the old wives remedies [she]1180-the goodwife of the house could supply [him]185-alan with in return .

[We]1179-we left [Musselburgh]78-musselburgh before [the first ninepenny coach]1183-the first ninepenny coach was due from [Edinburgh]10-edinburgh for as [Alan]185-alan said that was a rencounter [we]1179-we might very well avoid . The wind although still high , was very mild , the sun shone strong , and [Alan]185-alan began to suffer in proportion . From [Prestonpans]79-prestonpans [he]185-alan had [me]0-i aside to [the field of [Gladsmuir]80-gladsmuir]1184-the field of gladsmuir , where [he]185-alan exerted [himself]185-alan a great deal more than needful to describe the stages of the battle . Thence , at [his]185-alan old round pace , [we]1179-we travelled to [Cockenzie]81-cockenzie . Though [they]1185-they were building [herring - busses]1186-herring - busses [there]636-there at [Mrs. Cadell s]82-mrs. cadell s , [it]1188-it seemed [a desert - like , [back - going town]1190-back - going town , about half full of [ruined houses]1191-ruined houses]1189-a desert - like , back - going town , about half full of ruined houses ; but [the ale - house]1192-the ale - house was clean , and [Alan]185-alan , who was now in a glowing heat , must indulge [himself]185-alan with a bottle of ale , and carry on to the new luckie with the old story of the cold upon [his]185-alan stomach , only now the symptoms were all different .

[I]0-i sat listening ; and it came in [my]0-i mind that [I]0-i had scarce ever heard [him]185-alan address three serious words to [any woman]1193-any woman , but [he]185-alan was always drolling and fleering and making a private mock of them , and yet brought to that business a remarkable degree of energy and interest . Something to this effect [I]0-i remarked to [him]185-alan , when [the good - wife as chanced]1194-the good - wife as chanced was called away .

" What do [ye]0-i want ? "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan . " [A man]519-a man should aye put [his]519-a man best foot forrit with [the womankind]3870-the womankind ; [he]519-a man should aye give [them]3870-the womankind a bit of a story to divert [them]3870-the womankind , [the poor lambs]3871-the poor lambs ! It s what [ye]0-i should learn to attend to , [David]222-davie ; [ye]0-i should get the principles , it s like a trade . Now , if this had been [a young lassie]3872-a young lassie , or [onyways bonnie]284-onyways bonnie , [she]3872-a young lassie would never have heard tell of [my]185-alan stomach , [Davie]222-davie . But aince [they]3870-the womankind re too old to be seeking joes , [they]3870-the womankind a set up to be apotecaries . Why ? What do [I]185-alan ken ? [They]3870-the womankind ll be just the way [God]223-god made [them]3870-the womankind , [I]185-alan suppose . But [I]185-alan think [a man]519-a man would be a gomeral that didnae give [his]519-a man attention to the same . "[185-alan]

And here , [the luckie]1195-the luckie coming back , [he]1195-the luckie turned from [me]0-i as if with impatience to renew [their]1196-we former conversation . [The lady]510-the lady had branched some while before from [Alan]185-alan s stomach to the case of [a goodbrother of [her]510-the lady own in [Aberlady]83-aberlady , whose last sickness and demise [she]510-the lady was describing at extraordinary length]1198-a goodbrother of her own in aberlady , whose last sickness and demise she was describing at extraordinary length . Sometimes it was merely dull , sometimes both dull and awful , for [she]510-the lady talked with unction . The upshot was that [I]0-i fell in a deep muse , looking forth of the window on [the road]971-the road , and scarce marking what [I]0-i saw . [Presently]285-presently had any been looking [they]1200-they might have seen [me]0-i to start .

" [We]1196-we pit a fomentation to [his]185-alan feet , "[1201-the good - wife] [the good - wife]1201-the good - wife was saying , " and a het stane to [his]185-alan wame , and [we]1196-we gied [him]185-alan hyssop and water of pennyroyal , and fine , clean balsam of sulphur for the hoast . . . "[1201-the good - wife]

" [Sir]3021-sir , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , cutting very quietly in , " there s [a friend of mine]3875-a friend of mine gone by [the house]818-the house . "[0-i]

" Is that e en sae ? "[185-alan] replies [Alan]185-alan , as though it were a thing of small account . And then , " [Ye]1202-the wearyful wife were saying , [mem]3437-mem ? "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan ; and [the wearyful wife]1202-the wearyful wife went on .

" What did [I]185-alan tell [you]0-i in [the wood]1122-the wood ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan cried . " And yet it s strange [he]185-alan should be [here]3174-here too ! Was [he]185-alan [[his]185-alan lane]3880-his lane ? "[185-alan]

" Did [he]185-alan gang by ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan asked .

" Straight by , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and looked neither to the right nor left . "[0-i]

" And that s queerer yet , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " It sticks in [my]185-alan mind , [Davie]222-davie , that [we]3882-we should be stirring . But where to ? deil hae t ! This is like old days fairly , "[185-alan] cries [he]185-alan .

"[185-alan] And [he]185-alan sat thinking hard with a look of [his]185-alan that [I]0-i knew well .

" Then , [sir]3021-sir , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan to [me]0-i , " [I]185-alan think that will be [the shortest road]3887-the shortest road for [us]1204-we . [We]1204-we went out by way of [the woman s kale yard]1205-the woman s kale yard , and up [a lane among fields]1206-a lane among fields . " Now for a council of war , [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " But first of all , a bit lesson to [ye]286-luckie . Just that [we]1204-we had gone out by the back gate . And what does [she]3889-yon old wife mind now ? [A fine , canty , friendly , cracky man , that suffered with the stomach , poor body]3891-a fine , canty , friendly , cracky man , that suffered with the stomach , poor body ! and was real ta en up about [the goodbrother]3892-the goodbrother . " No kind of a hurry about [the man]3029-the man ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan asked .

" Never a sign of it , "[1210-i.] said [I.]1210-i.

" Nhm ! "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan , " it looks queer . [We]1204-we saw nothing of [them]3029-the man this morning on [the Whins]84-the whins ; [he]3029-the man s passed [us]1204-we by , [he]3029-the man doesnae seem to be looking , and yet here [he]3029-the man is on [[our]1204-we road]3895-our road ! [Dod]275-dod , [Davie]222-davie , [I]185-alan begin to take a notion . [I]185-alan think it s no [you]222-davie [they]3029-the man re seeking , [I]185-alan think it s [me]185-alan ; and [I]185-alan think [they]3029-the man ken fine where [they]3029-the man re gaun . "[185-alan]

" [They]3029-the man ken ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]185-alan think [Andie Scougal]213-andie s sold [me]185-alan [him]213-andie or [[his]213-andie mate]3896-his mate wha kent some part of the affair or else [[Charlie]199-stewart s clerk callant]3897-charlie s clerk callant , which would be a pity too , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan ; " and if [you]222-davie askit [me]185-alan for just [my]185-alan inward private conviction , [I]185-alan think there ll be heads cracked on [Gillane sands]3898-gillane sands . "[185-alan]

" [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " if [you]185-alan re at all right there ll be [folk there]3899-folk there and to spare . It ll be small service to crack heads . "[0-i]

" It would aye be a satisfaction though , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan . " But bide a bit ; bide a bit ; [I]185-alan m thinking and thanks to this bonny westland wind , [I]185-alan believe [I]185-alan ve still a chance of it . It s this way , [Davie]222-davie . [I]185-alan m no trysted with [this man Scougal]3900-this man scougal till the gloaming comes . But , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , " if [I]185-alan can get a bit of a wind out of [the west]85-the west [I]185-alan ll be there long or that , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan says , " and lie - to for [ye]0-i behind [the Isle of]86-the isle of [Fidra]87-fidra . Now if [[your]0-i gentry]3901-your gentry kens [the place]490-the place , [they]3901-your gentry ken the time forbye . Do [ye]0-i see [me]185-alan coming , [Davie]222-davie ? Thanks to [Johnnie Cope]287-johnnie cope and [other red - coat gomerals]3903-other red - coat gomerals , [I]185-alan should ken [this country]3042-this country like the back of [my]185-alan hand ; and if [ye]0-i re ready for another bit run with [Alan Breck]185-alan , [we]3905-we ll can cast back [inshore]3906-inshore , and come to [the seaside]3907-the seaside again by [Dirleton]88-dirleton . If [the ship]3120-the ship s there , [we]3905-we ll try and get on board of [her]3120-the ship . If [she]3120-the ship s no there , [I]185-alan ll just have to get back to [[my]185-alan weary haystack]3909-my weary haystack . But either way of it , [I]185-alan think [we]3905-we will leave [[your]0-i gentry]3901-your gentry whistling on [their]3901-your gentry thumbs . "[185-alan]

" [I]1211-i believe there s some chance in it , "[1211-i] said [I.]1211-i " Have on with [ye]185-alan , [Alan]185-alan ! "[1211-i]

CHAPTER XIII GILLANE SANDS

[I]0-i did not profit by [Alan]185-alan s pilotage as [he]185-alan had done by [his]185-alan marchings under [General Cope]288-general cope ; for [I]0-i can scarce tell what way [we]1212-we went . It is [my]0-i excuse that [we]1212-we travelled exceeding fast . Some part [we]1212-we ran , some trotted , and [the rest]1213-the rest walked at a vengeance of a pace . Twice , while [we]1212-we were at top speed , [we]1212-we ran against [country - folk]1214-country - folk ; but though [we]1212-we plumped into the first from round a corner , [Alan]185-alan was as ready as a loaded musket .

" Has [ye]1215-the countryman seen [my]185-alan horse ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan gasped .

" Na , [man]3015-man , [I]1215-the countryman haenae seen [nae]1215-the countryman horse the day , "[1215-the countryman] replied [the countryman]1215-the countryman .

And [Alan]185-alan spared the time to explain to [him]1215-the countryman that [we]1212-we were travelling " ride and tie "[1215-the countryman] ; that [[our]1212-we charger]1216-our charger had escaped , and it was feared [he]1216-our charger had gone [home]658-home to [Linton]89-linton . Not only that , but [he]1216-our charger expended some breath of which [he]1216-our charger had not very much left to curse [his]1216-our charger own misfortune and [my]0-i stupidity which was said to be its cause .

" [Them]3912-them that cannae tell the truth , "[1216-our charger] [he]1216-our charger observed to [myself]0-i as [we]1212-we went on again , " should be aye mindful to leave an honest , handy lee behind [them]3912-them . If [folk]441-folk dinnae ken what [ye]0-i re doing , [Davie]222-davie , [they]441-folk re terrible taken up with it ; but if [they]441-folk think [they]441-folk ken , [they]441-folk care nae mair for it than what [I]1216-our charger do for pease porridge . "[1216-our charger]

As [we]1212-we had first made inland , so [[our]1212-we road]3895-our road came in the end to lie very near due north ; [the old Kirk of [Aberlady]83-aberlady]1219-the old kirk of aberlady for a landmark on the left ; on the right , the top of the Berwick Law ; and it was thus [we]1212-we struck [the shore]1220-the shore again , not far from [Dirleton]88-dirleton . From [north Berwick]90-north berwick west to [Gillane Ness]91-gillane ness there runs a string of [four small islets]1221-four small islets , [Craiglieth]289-craiglieth , the Lamb , [Fidra]87-fidra , and [Eyebrough]290-eyebrough , notable by [their]1221-four small islets diversity of size and shape . [Fidra]87-fidra is the most particular , being [a strange grey islet of two humps]1222-a strange grey islet of two humps , made the more conspicuous by a piece of ruin ; and [I]0-i mind that as [we]1212-we drew closer to [it]87-fidra by some door or window of [these ruins]1223-these ruins [the sea]1224-the sea peeped through like [a man]519-a man s eye . Under the lee of [Fidra]87-fidra there is a good anchorage in westerly winds , and there , from a far way off , [we]1212-we could see the Thistle riding .

[The shore in face of [these islets]1227-these islets]1226-the shore in face of these islets is altogether waste . [Here]3174-here is no dwelling of [man]3015-man , and scarce any passage , or at most of [vagabond children]1230-vagabond children running at [their]1230-vagabond children play . [Gillane]47-gillane is [a small place on [the far side of [the Ness]93-the ness]1232-the far side of the ness]1231-a small place on the far side of the ness , [the folk of [Dirleton]88-dirleton]1233-the folk of dirleton go to [their]1233-the folk of dirleton business in [the inland fields]1234-the inland fields , and those of North Berwick straight to [the sea]1224-the sea - fishing from [[their]1233-the folk of dirleton haven]1236-their haven ; so that [few parts of [the coast]1238-the coast]1237-few parts of the coast are lonelier . But [I]0-i mind , as [we]1239-we crawled upon [our]1239-we bellies into that multiplicity of heights and hollows , keeping a bright eye upon all sides , and [our]1239-we hearts hammering at [our]1239-we ribs , there was such a shining of the sun and [the sea]1224-the sea , such a stir of the wind in the bent grass , and such a bustle of down - popping rabbits and up - flying gulls , that [the desert]1241-the desert seemed to [me]0-i , like [a place alive]1242-a place alive . No doubt it was in all ways well chosen for a secret embarcation , if the secret had been kept ; and even now that it was out , and [the place]490-the place watched , [we]1239-we were able to creep unperceived to the front of [the sandhills]1244-the sandhills , where [they]1244-the sandhills look down immediately on [the beach and sea]1245-the beach and sea .

But here [Alan]185-alan came to a full stop .

" [Davie]222-davie , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " this is [a kittle passage]3914-a kittle passage ! As long as [we]1239-we lie [here]3174-here [we]1239-we re safe ; but [I]185-alan m nane sae muckle nearer to [[my]185-alan ship]3814-my ship or [the coast of [France]50-france]3917-the coast of france . And as soon as [we]1239-we stand up and signal [the brig]1070-the brig , it s another matter . For where will [[your]222-davie gentry]3901-your gentry be , think [ye]222-davie ? "[185-alan]

" Maybe [they]3901-your gentry re no come yet , "[1246-i.] said [I.]1246-i. " And even if [they]3901-your gentry are , there s one clear matter in [our]1239-we favour . [They]3901-your gentry ll be all arranged to take [us]1239-we , that s true . But [they]3901-your gentry ll have arranged for [our]1239-we coming from the east and here [we]1239-we are upon [their]3901-your gentry west . "[1246-i.]

" Ay , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan , " [I]185-alan wish [we]1239-we were in some force , and this was a battle , [we]1239-we would have bonnily out - manouvred [them]3901-your gentry ! But it isnae , [Davit]250-davit balfour ; and the way it is , is a wee thing less inspiring to [Alan Breck]185-alan . [I]185-alan swither , [Davie]222-davie . "[185-alan]

" Time flies , [Alan]185-alan , "[1246-i.] said [I.]1246-i.

" [I]185-alan ken that , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " [I]185-alan ken naething else , as [the French folk]3920-the french folk say . But this is a dreidful case of heids or tails . O ! if [I]185-alan could but ken where [[your]250-davit balfour gentry]3901-your gentry were ! "[185-alan]

" [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " this is no like [you]185-alan . It s got to be now or never . "[0-i]

" This is no [me]185-alan , quo [he]185-alan , "[185-alan]

sang [Alan]185-alan , with a queer face betwixt shame and drollery .

" Neither [you]250-davit balfour nor [me]185-alan , quo [he]185-alan , neither [you]250-davit balfour nor [me]185-alan . Wow , [na]3922-na , [Johnnie man]3923-johnnie man ! neither [you]250-davit balfour nor [me]185-alan . "[185-alan]

And then of a sudden [he]185-alan stood straight up where [he]185-alan was , and with a handkerchief flying in [his]185-alan right hand , marched down upon [the beach]1247-the beach . [I]0-i stood up [myself]0-i , but lingered behind [him]185-alan , scanning [the sand - hills to the east]1248-the sand - hills to the east . [His]185-alan appearance was at first unremarked : [Scougal]213-andie not expecting [him]185-alan so early , and [[my]0-i gentry]3819-my gentry watching on the other side . Then [they]3819-my gentry awoke on board [the Thistle]94-the thistle , and it seemed [they]3819-my gentry had all in readiness , for there was scarce a second s bustle on [the deck]1250-the deck before [we]1251-we saw [a skiff]1252-a skiff put round [her]1252-a skiff stern and begin to pull lively for [the coast]1238-the coast . Almost at the same moment of time , and perhaps half a mile away towards [Gillane Ness]91-gillane ness , the figure of [a man]519-a man appeared for a blink upon [a sandhill]1255-a sandhill , waving with [his]519-a man arms ; and though [he]519-a man was gone again in the same flash , the gulls in that part continued a little longer to fly wild .

[Alan]185-alan had not seen this , looking straight to seaward at [the ship and skiff]1256-the ship and skiff .

" It maun be as it will ! "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , when [I]0-i had told [him]185-alan , " Weel may yon boatie row , or [[my]185-alan craig]3924-my craig ll have to thole a raxing . "[185-alan]

[That part of [the beach]1247-the beach]1257-that part of the beach was long and flat , and excellent walking when the tide was down ; a little cressy burn flowed over [it]1257-that part of the beach in one place to [the sea]1224-the sea ; and [the sandhills]1244-the sandhills ran along the head of [it]1257-that part of the beach like [the rampart of [a town]833-a town]1261-the rampart of a town . [No eye of [ours]1264-us]1263-no eye of ours could spy what was passing behind there in the bents , [no hurry of [ours]1264-us]1265-no hurry of ours could mend the speed of [the boat]1266-the boat s coming : time stood still with [us]1264-us through that uncanny period of waiting .

" There is one thing [I]185-alan would like to ken , "[185-alan] say [Alan]185-alan . " [I]185-alan would like to ken these gentry s orders . [We]1264-us re worth four hunner pound [the pair of [us]1264-us]1062-the pair of us : how if [they]1062-the pair of us took the guns to [us]1264-us , [Davie]222-davie ! [They]1062-the pair of us would get a bonny shot from [the top of [that lang sandy bank]3927-that lang sandy bank]3926-the top of that lang sandy bank . "[185-alan]

" Morally impossible , "[1267-i.] said [I.]1267-i. " The point is that [they]1062-the pair of us can have no guns . This thing has been gone about too secret ; pistols [they]1062-the pair of us may have , but never guns . "[1267-i.]

" [I]185-alan believe [ye]1267-i. ll be in the right , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan . " For all which [I]185-alan am wearing a good deal for [yon boat]3928-yon boat . "[185-alan]

And [he]185-alan snapped [his]185-alan fingers and whistled to it like a dog .

It was now perhaps a third of the way in , and [we]1268-we [ourselves]1268-we already hard on [the margin of [the sea]1224-the sea]1269-the margin of the sea , so that the soft sand rose over [my]0-i shoes . There was no more to do whatever but to wait , to look as much as [we]1268-we were able at the creeping nearer of [the boat]1266-the boat , and as little as [we]1268-we could manage at the long impenetrable front of [the sandhills]1244-the sandhills , over which the gulls twinkled and behind which [[our]1268-we enemies]1273-our enemies were doubtless marshalling .

" [This]3929-this is a fine , bright , caller place to get shot in , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan suddenly ; " and , [man]3015-man , [I]185-alan wish that [I]185-alan had [your]3015-man courage ! "[185-alan]

" [Alan]185-alan ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " what kind of talk is this of it ! [You]185-alan re just made of courage ; it s the character of [the man]3029-the man , as [I]0-i could prove [myself]0-i if there was [nobody else]3932-nobody else . "[0-i]

" And [you]0-i would be the more mistaken , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " What makes the differ with [me]185-alan is just [my]185-alan great penetration and knowledge of affairs . But for [auld]220-auld merren , cauld , dour , deadly courage , [I]185-alan am not fit to hold a candle to [yourself]3015-man . Look at [us]3933-us two here upon [the sands]3934-the sands . Here am [I]185-alan , fair hotching to be off ; here s [you]3015-man for all that [I]185-alan ken in two minds of it whether [you]3015-man ll no stop . Do [you]3015-man think that [I]185-alan could do that , or would ? No [me]185-alan ! Firstly , because [I]185-alan havenae got the courage and wouldnae daur ; and secondly , because [I]185-alan am [a man of so much penetration]3935-a man of so much penetration and would see [ye]3015-man damned first . "[185-alan]

" It s there [ye]3015-man re coming , is it ? "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Ah , [man Alan]3936-man alan , [you]3936-man alan can wile [[your]3936-man alan old wives]3937-your old wives , but [you]3936-man alan never can wile [me]0-i . "[0-i]

Remembrance of [my]0-i temptation in the wood made [me]0-i strong as iron .

" [I]0-i have a tryst to keep , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued . " [I]0-i am trysted with [[your]3936-man alan cousin]3332-your cousin [Charlie]199-stewart ; [I]0-i have passed [my]0-i word . "[0-i]

" Braw trysts that [you]3936-man alan ll can keep , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " [Ye]3936-man alan ll just mistryst aince and for a with [the gentry in the bents]3939-the gentry in the bents . And what for ? "[185-alan] [he]185-alan went on with an extreme threatening gravity . " Just tell [me]185-alan that , [[my]185-alan mannie]3940-my mannie ! Are [they]3941-they to drive a dirk in [your]3936-man alan inside and bury [ye]3936-man alan in [the bents]3942-the bents ? Or is it to be the other way , and are [they]3941-they to bring [ye]3936-man alan in with [James]181-james ? Are [they]3941-they [folk]441-folk to be trustit ?
