" [You]3036-my friend shall never ask twice , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; picked up that bundle , walked a little way forward and cast them as far as possible into [the sea]1224-the sea . For a very little more [I]0-i could have cast [myself]0-i after [them]2207-them .

The rest of the day [I]0-i walked up and down raging . There were few names so ill but what [I]0-i gave [her]3036-my friend them in [my]0-i own mind before the sun went down . All that [I]0-i had ever heard of [Highland]11-highland pride seemed quite outdone ; that [a girl scarce grown]2208-a girl scarce grown should resent so trifling an allusion , and that from [[her]3036-my friend next friend]2209-her next friend , that [she]3036-my friend had near wearied [me]0-i with praising of ! [I]0-i had bitter , sharp , hard thoughts of [her]3036-my friend , like [an angry boy]2210-an angry boy s. If [I]0-i had kissed [her]3036-my friend indeed [I]0-i thought , perhaps [she]3036-my friend would have taken it pretty well ; and only because it had been written down , and with a spice of jocularity , up [she]3036-my friend must fuff in this ridiculous passion . It seemed to [me]0-i there was a want of penetration in the female sex , to make [angels]2211-angels weep over the case of [the poor men]2212-the poor men .

[We]2213-we were side by side again at supper , and what a change was there ! [She]3036-my friend was like curdled milk to [me]0-i ; [her]3036-my friend face was like a wooden doll s ; [I]0-i could have indifferently smitten [her]3036-my friend or grovelled at [her]3036-my friend feet , but [she]3036-my friend gave [me]0-i not the least occasion to do either . No sooner the meal done than [she]3036-my friend betook [herself]3036-my friend to attend on [Mrs. Gebbie]364-mrs. gebbie , which [I]0-i think [she]3036-my friend had a little neglected heretofore . But [she]3036-my friend was to make up for lost time , and in what remained of [the passage]2214-the passage was extraordinary assiduous with [the old lady]864-the old lady , and on [deck]2166-deck began to make a great deal more than [I]0-i thought wise of [Captain Sang]365-captain sang . Not but what [the Captain]3428-the captain seemed [a worthy , fatherly man]2218-a worthy , fatherly man ; but [I]0-i hated to behold [her]3036-my friend in the least familiarity with anyone except [myself]0-i .

Altogether , [she]3036-my friend was so quick to avoid [me]0-i , and so constant to keep [herself]3036-my friend surrounded with [others]1700-others , that [I]0-i must watch a long while before [I]0-i could find [my]0-i opportunity ; and after it was found , [I]0-i made not much of it , as [you]2220-you are now to hear .

" [I]0-i have no guess how [I]0-i have offended , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " it should scarce be beyond pardon , then . O , try if [you]3036-my friend can pardon [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" [I]3036-my friend have no pardon to give , "[3036-my friend] said [she]3036-my friend ; and the words seemed to come out of [her]3036-my friend throat like marbles . " [I]3036-my friend will be very much obliged for all [your]0-i friendships . "[3036-my friend] And [she]3036-my friend made [me]0-i an eighth part of a curtsey .

But [I]0-i had schooled [myself]0-i beforehand to say more , and [I]0-i was going to say it too .

" There is one thing , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " If [I]0-i have shocked [your]3036-my friend particularity by the showing of that letter , it can not touch [Miss Grant]234-miss grant . [She]234-miss grant wrote not to [you]0-i , but to [a poor , common , ordinary lad , who might have had more sense than show it]4457-a poor , common , ordinary lad , who might have had more sense than show it . If [you]3036-my friend are to blame [me]0-i "[0-i]

" [I]189-catriona will advise [you]0-i to say no more about [that girl]4458-that girl , at all events ! "[189-catriona] said [Catriona]189-catriona . " It is [her]4458-that girl [I]189-catriona will never look [the road]971-the road of , not if [she]4458-that girl lay dying . "[189-catriona] [She]189-catriona turned away from [me]0-i , and suddenly back . " Will [you]0-i swear [you]0-i will have no more to deal with [her]4458-that girl ? "[189-catriona] [she]189-catriona cried .

" Indeed , and [I]0-i will never be so unjust then , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " nor yet so ungrateful . "[0-i]

And now it was [I]0-i that turned away .

CHAPTER XXII HELVOETSLUYS

The weather in the end considerably worsened ; the wind sang in the shrouds , [the sea]1224-the sea swelled higher , and [the ship]3120-the ship began to labour and cry out among the billows . The song of [the leadsman in the chains]2223-the leadsman in the chains was now scarce ceasing , for [we]2224-we thrid all the way among shoals . About nine in the morning , in a burst of wintry sun between two squalls of hail , [I]0-i had [my]0-i first look of Holland a line of windmills birling in the breeze . It was besides [my]0-i first knowledge of these daft - like contrivances , which gave [me]0-i a near sense of foreign travel and a new world and life . [We]2224-we came to an anchor about half - past eleven , outside [the harbour of [Helvoetsluys]138-helvoetsluys]2225-the harbour of helvoetsluys , in a place where [the sea sometimes broke and]2226-the sea sometimes broke and [the ship]3120-the ship pitched outrageously . [You]2228-you may be sure [we]2224-we were all on deck save [Mrs. Gebbie]364-mrs. gebbie , some of [us]2224-we in cloaks , others mantled in [the ship]3120-the ship s tarpaulins , all clinging on by ropes , and jesting the most like [old sailor - folk that [we]2224-we could imitate]2230-old sailor - folk that we could imitate .

Presently [a boat]1439-a boat , that was backed like a partancrab , came gingerly alongside , and [the skipper of]2232-the skipper of [it]1439-a boat hailed [[our]2224-we master]2233-our master in [the Dutch]281-the dutch . Thence [Captain Sang]365-captain sang turned , very troubled - like , to [Catriona]189-catriona ; and the rest of [us]2224-we crowding about , the nature of the difficulty was made plain to all . [The Rose]2234-the rose was bound to [the port of [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam]2235-the port of rotterdam , whither [the other passengers]2236-the other passengers were in a great impatience to arrive , in view of a conveyance due to leave that very evening in the direction of [the Upper Germany]147-the upper germany . This , with the present half - gale of wind , [the captain]3428-the captain if no time were lost declared [himself]3428-the captain still capable to save . Now [James More]181-james had trysted in [Helvoet]148-helvoet with [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter , and [the captain]3428-the captain had engaged to call before [the port]2240-the port and place [her]2999-his daughter according to the custom in [a shore boat]2241-a shore boat . There was [the boat]1266-the boat , to be sure , and here was [Catriona]189-catriona ready : but both [[our]2224-we master]2233-our master and [the patroon of [the boat]1266-the boat]2244-the patroon of the boat scrupled at the risk , and [the first]814-the first was in no humour to delay .

" [[Your]189-catriona father]3247-your father , "[181-james] said [he]181-james , " would be [gey]4461-gey an little pleased if [we]2224-we was to break a leg to [ye]189-catriona , [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond , let - a - be drowning of [you]189-catriona . Take [my]181-james way of it , "[181-james] says [he]181-james , " and come on - by with [the rest of [us]2224-we]4462-the rest of us here to [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam . [Ye]189-catriona can get a passage down [the Maes]149-the maes in [a sailing scoot]4463-a sailing scoot as far as to [the Brill]150-the brill , and thence on again , by a place in a rattel - waggon , back to [Helvoet]148-helvoet . "[181-james]

But [Catriona]189-catriona would hear of no change . [She]189-catriona looked white - like as [she]189-catriona beheld the bursting of the sprays , the green seas that sometimes poured upon the fore - castle , and the perpetual bounding and swooping of [the boat]1266-the boat among the billows ; but [she]189-catriona stood firmly by [[her]189-catriona father]760-her father s orders . " [[My]189-catriona father]417-my father , [James More]181-james , will have arranged it so , "[189-catriona] was [her]189-catriona first word and [her]189-catriona last . [I]0-i thought it very idle and indeed wanton in [the girl]517-the girl to be so literal and stand opposite to so much kind advice ; but the fact is [she]189-catriona had a very good reason , if [she]189-catriona would have told [us]2250-us . Sailing scoots and rattel - waggons are excellent things ; only the use of them must first be paid for , and all [she]189-catriona was possessed of in [the world]3073-the world was just two shillings and a penny halfpenny sterling . So it fell out that [captain]2252-captain and [passengers]2123-passengers , not knowing of [her]189-catriona destitution and [she]189-catriona being too proud to tell [them]2123-passengers spoke in vain .

" But [you]0-i ken nae French and nae Dutch neither , "[503-one] said [one]503-one .

" It is very true , "[189-catriona] says [she]189-catriona , " but since the year 46 there are so many of [the honest Scotch abroad]4465-the honest scotch abroad that [I]189-catriona will be doing very well . [I]189-catriona thank [you]0-i . "[189-catriona]

There was a pretty country simplicity in this that made some laugh , [others]1700-others looked the more sorry , and [Mr. Gebbie]369-mr. gebbie fall outright in a passion . [I]0-i believe [he]369-mr. gebbie knew it was [his]369-mr. gebbie duty [[his]369-mr. gebbie wife]2962-his wife having accepted charge of [the girl]517-the girl to have gone ashore with [her]517-the girl and seen [her]517-the girl safe : nothing would have induced [him]369-mr. gebbie to have done so , since it must have involved the lose of [his]369-mr. gebbie conveyance ; and [I]0-i think [he]369-mr. gebbie made it up to [his]369-mr. gebbie conscience by the loudness of [his]369-mr. gebbie voice . At least [he]369-mr. gebbie broke out upon [Captain Sang]365-captain sang , raging and saying the thing was a disgrace ; that it was mere death to try to leave [the ship]3120-the ship , and at any event [we]2259-we could not cast down [an innocent maid]2260-an innocent maid in a boatful of [nasty [Holland]75-holland fishers]2261-nasty holland fishers , and leave [her]2260-an innocent maid to [her]2260-an innocent maid fate . [I]0-i was thinking something of the same ; took [the mate upon one side]2262-the mate upon one side , arranged with [him]369-mr. gebbie to send on [my]0-i chests by track - scoot to an address [I]0-i had in [Leyden]74-leyden , and stood up and signalled to [the fishers]2263-the fishers .

" [I]0-i will go [ashore]4466-ashore with [the young lady]3012-the young lady , [Captain Sang]365-captain sang , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " It is all one what way [I]0-i go to [Leyden]74-leyden ; "[0-i] and leaped at the same time into [the boat]1266-the boat , which [I]0-i managed not so elegantly but what [I]0-i fell with two of [the fishers]2263-the fishers in the bilge .

From [the boat]1266-the boat the business appeared yet more precarious than from [the ship]3120-the ship , [she]2268-she stood so high over [us]2269-us , swung down so swift , and menaced [us]2269-us so perpetually with [her]2268-she plunging and passaging upon the anchor cable . [I]0-i began to think [I]0-i had made a fool s bargain , that it was merely impossible [Catriona]189-catriona should be got on board to [me]0-i , and that [I]0-i stood to be set [ashore]4466-ashore at [Helvoet]148-helvoet all by [myself]0-i and with no hope of any reward but the pleasure of embracing [James More]181-james , if [I]0-i should want to . But this was to reckon without [the lass]3448-the lass s courage . [She]2268-she had seen [me]0-i leap with very little appearance however much reality of hesitation ; to be sure , [she]2268-she was not to be beat by [[her]2268-she discarded friend]2272-her discarded friend . Up [she]2268-she stood on the bulwarks and held by a stay , the wind blowing in [her]2268-she petticoats , which made the enterprise more dangerous , and gave [us]2269-us rather more of a view of [her]2268-she stockings than would be thought genteel in [cities]2273-cities . There was no minute lost , and scarce time given for any to interfere if [they]2274-they had wished the same . [I]0-i stood up on the other side and spread [my]0-i arms ; [the ship]3120-the ship swung down on [us]2269-us , [the patroon]2276-the patroon humoured [[his]2276-the patroon boat]2277-his boat nearer in than was perhaps wholly safe , and [Catriona]189-catriona leaped into the air . [I]0-i was so happy as to catch [her]189-catriona , and [the fishers]2263-the fishers readily supporting [us]2269-us , escaped a fall . [She]189-catriona held to [me]0-i a moment very tight , breathing quick and deep ; thence [she]189-catriona still clinging to [me]0-i with both hands [we]2269-us were passed aft to [our]2269-us places by [the steersman]1384-the steersman ; and [Captain]2252-captain Sang and [all the crew]2281-all the crew and [passengers]2123-passengers cheering and crying farewell , [the boat]1266-the boat was put about for [shore]2284-shore .

As soon as [Catriona]189-catriona came a little to [herself]189-catriona [she]189-catriona unhanded [me]0-i suddenly , but said no word . No more did [I]0-i ; and indeed the whistling of the wind and the breaching of the sprays made it no time for speech ; and [[our]2269-us crew]2285-our crew not only toiled excessively but made extremely little way , so that [the Rose]2234-the rose had got [her]2234-the rose anchor and was off again before [we]2269-us had approached [the harbour mouth]2287-the harbour mouth .

[We]2269-us were no sooner in [smooth water]2288-smooth water than [the patroon]2276-the patroon , according to [their]2276-the patroon beastly Hollands custom , stopped [[his]2276-the patroon boat]2277-his boat and required of [us]2269-us [our]2269-us fares . Two guilders was [the man]3029-the man s demand between three and four shillings English money for [each passenger]2292-each passenger . But at this [Catriona]189-catriona began to cry out with a vast deal of agitation . [She]189-catriona had asked of [Captain Sang]365-captain sang , [she]189-catriona said , and the fare was but an English shilling . " Do [you]365-captain sang think [I]189-catriona will have come on board and not ask first ? "[189-catriona] cries [she]189-catriona . [The patroon]2276-the patroon scolded back upon [her]189-catriona in a lingo where the oaths were English and [the rest right Hollands]2294-the rest right hollands ; till at last seeing [her]189-catriona near tears [I]0-i privately slipped in [the rogue]2295-the rogue s hand six shillings , whereupon [he]2295-the rogue was obliging enough to receive from [her]189-catriona the other shilling without more complaint . No doubt [I]0-i was a good deal nettled and ashamed . [I]0-i like to see [folk thrifty]2296-folk thrifty , but not with so much passion ; and [I]0-i daresay it would be rather coldly that [I]0-i asked [her]189-catriona , as [the boat]1266-the boat moved on again for [shore]2284-shore , where it was that [she]189-catriona was trysted with [[her]189-catriona father]760-her father .

" [He]2295-the rogue is to be inquired of at [the house of [one Sprott]315-sandie]4468-the house of one sprott , [an honest Scotch merchant]4469-an honest scotch merchant , "[189-catriona] says [she]189-catriona ; and then with the same breath , " [I]189-catriona am wishing to thank [you]0-i very much [you]0-i are [a brave friend to [me]189-catriona]4470-a brave friend to me . "[189-catriona]

" It will be time enough when [I]0-i get [you]189-catriona to [[your]189-catriona father]3247-your father , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , little thinking that [I]0-i spoke so true . " [I]0-i can tell [him]3247-your father a fine tale of [a loyal daughter]4472-a loyal daughter . "[0-i]

" O , [I]189-catriona do not think [I]189-catriona will be [a loyal girl]4473-a loyal girl , at all events , "[189-catriona] [she]189-catriona cried , with a great deal of painfulness in the expression . " [I]189-catriona do not think [my]189-catriona heart is true . "[189-catriona]

" Yet there are [very few that would have made that leap , and all to obey]4474-very few that would have made that leap , and all to obey [a father]734-a father s orders , "[0-i] [I]0-i observed .

" [I]189-catriona can not have [you]0-i to be thinking of [me]189-catriona so , "[189-catriona] [she]189-catriona cried again . " When [you]0-i had done that same , how would [I]189-catriona stop behind ? And at all events that was not all the reasons . "[189-catriona] [Whereupon]260-whereupon , with a burning face , [she]189-catriona told [me]0-i the plain truth upon [her]189-catriona poverty .

" Good guide [us]4476-us ! "[0-i] cried [I]0-i , " what kind of daft - like proceeding is this , to let [yourself]0-i be launched on [the continent of [Europe]67-europe]4477-the continent of europe with an empty purse [I]0-i count it hardly decent scant decent ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

" [You]0-i forget [James More]181-james , [[my]189-catriona father]417-my father , is [a poor gentleman]4479-a poor gentleman , "[189-catriona] said [she]189-catriona . " [He]181-james is [a hunted exile]4480-a hunted exile . "[189-catriona]

" But [I]0-i think not all [[your]189-catriona friends]2973-your friends are [hunted exiles]4482-hunted exiles , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " And was this fair to [them]2973-your friends that care for [you]189-catriona ? Was it fair to [me]0-i ? was it fair to [Miss Grant]234-miss grant that counselled [you]189-catriona to go , and would be driven fair horn - mad if [she]234-miss grant could hear of it ? Was it even fair to [these Gregory folk that [you]189-catriona were living with]4483-these gregory folk that you were living with , and used [you]189-catriona lovingly ? It s a blessing [you]189-catriona have fallen in [my]0-i hands ! Suppose [[your]189-catriona father]3247-your father hindered by an accident , what would become of [you]189-catriona here , and [you]189-catriona [[your]189-catriona lee]4485-your lee - lone in [a strange place]4486-a strange place ? The thought of the thing frightens [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" [I]2300-i will have lied to all of [them]4483-these gregory folk that you were living with , "[2300-i] [she]2300-i replied . " [I]2300-i will have told [them]4483-these gregory folk that you were living with all that [I]2300-i had plenty . [I]2300-i told [her]2300-i too . [I]2300-i could not be lowering [James]181-james More to [them]4483-these gregory folk that you were living with . "[2300-i]

[I]0-i found out later on that [she]2300-i must have lowered [him]2301-him in the very dust , for the lie was originally [the father]885-the father s , not [the daughter s]2303-the daughter s , and [she]2300-i thus obliged to persevere in it for [the man]3029-the man s reputation . But at the time [I]0-i was ignorant of this , and the mere thought of [her]2300-i destitution and the perils in which see must have fallen , had ruffled [me]0-i almost beyond reason .

" Well , well , well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [you]2300-i will have to learn more sense . "[0-i]

[I]0-i left [her]2300-i mails for the moment in [an inn upon [the shore]1220-the shore]2305-an inn upon the shore , where [I]0-i got a direction for [[Sprott]315-sandie s house]2307-sprott s house in [[my]0-i new French]2308-my new french , and [we]2309-we walked there it was some little way beholding [the place]490-the place with wonder as [we]2309-we went . Indeed , there was much for [Scots folk]2311-scots folk to admire : [canals]2312-canals and trees being intermingled with [the houses]489-the houses ; [the houses]489-the houses , [each within]2315-each within [itself]489-the houses , of a brave red brick , the colour of a rose , with steps and benches of blue marble at the cheek of every door , and [the whole town]4188-the whole town so clean [you]2317-you might have dined upon [the causeway]2952-the causeway . [Sprott]315-sandie was within , upon [his]315-sandie ledgers , in [a low parlour]2319-a low parlour , very neat and clean , and set out with china and pictures , and a globe of the earth in a brass frame . [He]315-sandie was [a big - chafted , ruddy , lusty man]2320-a big - chafted , ruddy , lusty man , with a crooked hard look to [him]315-sandie ; and [he]315-sandie made [us]2309-we not that much civility as offer [us]2309-we a seat .

" Is [James More Macgregor]181-james now in [Helvoet]148-helvoet , [sir]3021-sir ? "[2321-i.] says [I.]2321-i.

" [I]315-sandie ken [nobody by such a name]4488-nobody by such a name , "[315-sandie] says [he]315-sandie , impatient - like .

" Since [you]3021-sir are so particular , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , " [I]0-i will amend [my]0-i question , and ask [you]3021-sir where [we]2309-we are to find in [Helvoet]148-helvoet one [James Drummond]181-james , alias [Macgregor]181-james , alias James More , [late tenant in [Inveronachile]126-inveronachile]4489-late tenant in inveronachile ? "[0-i]

" [Sir]3021-sir , "[315-sandie] says [he]315-sandie , " [he]315-sandie may be in [Hell]151-hell for what [I]315-sandie ken , and for [my]315-sandie part [I]315-sandie wish [he]315-sandie was . "[315-sandie]

" [The young lady]3012-the young lady is [[that gentleman]3316-that gentleman s daughter]4493-that gentleman s daughter , [sir]3021-sir , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " before whom , [I]0-i think [you]3021-sir will agree with [me]0-i , it is not very becoming to discuss [his]315-sandie character . "[0-i]

" [I]315-sandie have nothing to make either with [him]315-sandie , or [her]3012-the young lady , or [you]0-i ! "[315-sandie] cries [he]315-sandie in [his]315-sandie gross voice .

" Under [your]3021-sir favour , [Mr. Sprott]370-mr. sprott , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [this young lady]532-this young lady is come from [Scotland]182-prestongrange seeking [him]315-sandie , and by whatever mistake , was given the name of [[your]3021-sir house]4496-your house for a direction . An error it seems to have been , but [I]0-i think this places both [you]3021-sir and [me]0-i who am but [[her]532-this young lady fellow - traveller]4497-her fellow - traveller by accident under a strong obligation to help [[our]4498-our countrywoman]4499-our countrywoman . "[0-i]

" Will [you]0-i ding [me]315-sandie daft ? "[315-sandie] [he]315-sandie cries . " [I]315-sandie tell [ye]0-i [I]315-sandie ken naething and care less either for [him]315-sandie or [[his]315-sandie breed]4500-his breed . [I]315-sandie tell [ye]0-i [the man]3029-the man owes [me]315-sandie money . "[315-sandie]

" That may very well be , [sir]3021-sir , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , who was now rather more angry than [himself]315-sandie . " At least , [I]0-i owe [you]3021-sir nothing ; [the young lady]3012-the young lady is under [my]0-i protection ; and [I]0-i am neither at all used with these manners , nor in the least content with them . "[0-i]

As [I]0-i said this , and without particularly thinking what [I]0-i did , [I]0-i drew a step or two nearer to [his]315-sandie table ; thus striking , by mere good fortune , on the only argument that could at all affect [the man]3029-the man . The blood left [his]315-sandie lusty countenance .

" For [the Lord]3830-the lord s sake dinna be hasty , [sir]3021-sir ! "[315-sandie] [he]315-sandie cried . " [I]315-sandie am truly wishfu no to be offensive . But [ye]3021-sir ken , [sir]3021-sir , [I]315-sandie m like a wheen guid - natured , honest , canty auld fellows [my]315-sandie bark is waur nor [my]315-sandie bite . To hear [me]315-sandie , [ye]3021-sir micht whiles fancy [I]315-sandie was [a wee thing dour]4507-a wee thing dour ; but na , na ! it s a kind auld fallow at heart , [Sandie Sprott]315-sandie ! And [ye]3021-sir could never imagine the fyke and fash [this man]1744-this man has been to [me]315-sandie . "[315-sandie]

" Very good , [sir]3021-sir , "[2323-i.] said [I.]2323-i. " Then [I]2323-i. will make that much freedom with [your]3021-sir kindness as trouble [you]3021-sir for [your]3021-sir last news of [Mr. Drummond]371-mr. drummond . "[2323-i.]

" [You]3021-sir re welcome , [sir]3021-sir ! "[2324-i] said [he]2324-i . " As for [the young leddy]4511-the young leddy [my]2324-i respects to [her]4511-the young leddy ! , [he]1744-this man ll just have clean forgotten [her]4511-the young leddy . [I]2324-i ken [the man]3029-the man , [ye]3021-sir see ; [I]2324-i have lost siller by [him]3029-the man ere now . [He]3029-the man thinks of naebody but just [himsel]4513-himsel ; [clan]4514-clan , [king]4515-king , or dauchter , if [he]3029-the man can get [his]3029-the man wameful , [he]3029-the man would give [them]4513-himsel a the go - by ! ay , or [[his]3029-the man correspondent]4516-his correspondent either . For there is a sense in whilk [I]2324-i may be nearly almost said to be [[his]3029-the man correspondent]4516-his correspondent . The fact is , [we]4518-we are employed thegether in a business affair , and [I]2324-i think it s like to turn out a dear affair for [Sandie Sprott]315-sandie . [The man]3029-the man s as guid s [[my]2324-i pairtner]4520-my pairtner , and [I]2324-i give [ye]4521-ye [my]2324-i mere word [I]2324-i ken naething by where [he]3029-the man is . [He]3029-the man micht be coming here to [Helvoet]148-helvoet ; [he]3029-the man micht come here the morn , [he]3029-the man michtnae come for a twalmouth ; [I]2324-i would wonder at naething or just at the ae thing , and that s if [he]3029-the man was to pay [me]2324-i [my]2324-i siller . [Ye]4521-ye see what way [I]2324-i stand with it ; and it s clear [I]2324-i m no very likely to meddle up with [the young leddy]4511-the young leddy , as [ye]4521-ye ca [her]4511-the young leddy . [She]4511-the young leddy cannae stop [here]3174-here , that s ae thing certain sure . [Dod]275-dod , [sir]3021-sir , [I]2324-i m [a lone man]4525-a lone man ! If [I]2324-i was to tak [her]4511-the young leddy in , its highly possible [the hellicat]4526-the hellicat would try and gar [me]2324-i marry [her]4511-the young leddy when [he]4526-the hellicat turned up . "[2324-i]

" Enough of this talk , "[2325-i] said [I.]2325-i " [I]2325-i will take [the young leddy]4511-the young leddy among [better friends]4528-better friends . Give [me]2325-i , pen , ink , and paper , and [I]2325-i will leave here for [James]181-james More the address of [[my]2325-i correspondent]1758-my correspondent in [Leyden]74-leyden . [He]181-james can inquire from [me]2325-i where [he]181-james is to seek [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter . "[2325-i]

This word [I]0-i wrote and sealed ; which while [I]0-i was doing , [Sprott]315-sandie of [his]315-sandie own motion made a welcome offer , to charge [himself]315-sandie with [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond s mails , and even send [a porter]424-a porter for [them]2327-them to [the inn]2328-the inn . [I]0-i advanced [him]315-sandie to that effect a dollar or two to be a cover , and [he]315-sandie gave [me]0-i an acknowledgment in writing of the sum .

Whereupon [I]0-i giving [my]0-i arm to [Catriona]189-catriona [we]2329-we left [the house of [this unpalatable rascal]2331-this unpalatable rascal]2330-the house of this unpalatable rascal . [She]189-catriona had said no word throughout , leaving [me]0-i to judge and speak in [her]189-catriona place ; [I]0-i , upon [my]0-i side , had been careful not to embarrass [her]189-catriona by a glance ; and even now , although [my]0-i heart still glowed inside of [me]0-i with shame and anger , [I]0-i made it [my]0-i affair to seem quite easy .

" Now , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " let [us]2329-we get back to [yon same inn]4531-yon same inn where [they]4532-they can speak the French , have a piece of dinner , and inquire for conveyances to [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam . [I]0-i will never be easy till [I]0-i have [you]4533-you safe again in the hands of [Mrs. Gebbie]364-mrs. gebbie . "[0-i]

" [I]189-catriona suppose it will have to be , "[189-catriona] said [Catriona]189-catriona , " though whoever will be pleased , [I]189-catriona do not think it will be [her]189-catriona . And [I]189-catriona will remind [you]4533-you this once again that [I]189-catriona have but one shilling , and three baubees . "[189-catriona]

" And just this once again , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i will remind [you]4533-you it was a blessing that [I]0-i came alongst with [you]4533-you . "[0-i]

" What else would [I]189-catriona be thinking all this time ? "[189-catriona] says [she]189-catriona , and [I]0-i thought weighed a little on [my]0-i arm . " It is [you]4533-you that are [the good friend to [me]189-catriona]4534-the good friend to me . "[189-catriona]

CHAPTER XXIII TRAVELS IN [HOLLAND]75-holland

The rattel - waggon , which is a kind of a long waggon set with benches , carried [us]2332-us in four hours of travel to [the great city of]2333-the great city of [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam . It was long past dark by then , but [the streets]4148-the streets were pretty brightly lighted and thronged with [wild - like , outlandish characters bearded Hebrews]2335-wild - like , outlandish characters bearded hebrews , [black men]2336-black men , and [the hordes of [courtesans]2338-courtesans , most indecently adorned with finery and stopping [seamen]2339-seamen by [their]2339-seamen very sleeves]2337-the hordes of courtesans , most indecently adorned with finery and stopping seamen by their very sleeves ; the clash of talk about [us]2332-us made [our]2332-us heads to whirl ; and what was the most unexpected of all , [we]2332-us appeared to be no more struck with all [these foreigners]2340-these foreigners than [they]2340-these foreigners with [us]2332-us . [I]0-i made the best face [I]0-i could , for the lass s sake and [my]0-i own credit ; but the truth is [I]0-i felt like a lost sheep , and [my]0-i heart beat in [my]0-i bosom with anxiety . Once or twice [I]0-i inquired after [the harbour]4007-the harbour or [the berth of [the ship]3120-the ship Rose]2342-the berth of the ship rose : but either fell on [some who spoke only [Hollands]152-hollands]2344-some who spoke only hollands , or [my]0-i own French failed [me]0-i . Trying [a street]2345-a street at [a venture]2346-a venture , [I]0-i came upon [a lane of [lighted houses]2348-lighted houses]2347-a lane of lighted houses , the doors and windows thronged with [wauf - like painted women]2349-wauf - like painted women ; these jostled and mocked upon [us]2350-we as [we]2350-we passed , and [I]0-i was thankful [we]2350-we had nothing of [their]2344-some who spoke only hollands language . A little after [we]2350-we issued forth upon [an open place along [the harbour]4007-the harbour]2351-an open place along the harbour .

" [We]2350-we shall be doing now , "[0-i] cries [I]0-i , as soon as [I]0-i spied masts . " Let [us]2350-we walk here by [the harbour]4007-the harbour . [We]2350-we are sure to meet [some that has the English]4536-some that has the english , and at the best of it [we]2350-we may light upon [that very ship]4537-that very ship . "[0-i]

[We]2350-we did the next best , as happened ; for , about nine of the evening , whom should [we]2350-we walk into the arms of but [Captain Sang]365-captain sang ? [He]365-captain sang told [us]2350-we [they]2344-some who spoke only hollands had made [their]2344-some who spoke only hollands run in the most incredible brief time , the wind holding strong till [they]2344-some who spoke only hollands reached port ; by which means [[his]365-captain sang passengers]2353-his passengers were all gone already on [their]2353-his passengers further travels . It was impossible to chase after [the Gebbies]373-the gebbies into [the High Germany]141-high germany , and [we]2350-we had [no other acquaintance]2354-no other acquaintance to fall back upon but [Captain Sang]365-captain sang [himself]365-captain sang . It was the more gratifying to find [the man]3029-the man friendly and wishful to assist . [He]365-captain sang made it a small affair to find [some good plain family of [merchants]2357-merchants]2356-some good plain family of merchants , where [Catriona]189-catriona might harbour till [the Rose]2234-the rose was loaden ; declared [he]365-captain sang would then blithely carry [her]189-catriona back to [Leith]49-leith for nothing and see [her]189-catriona safe in the hands of [Mr. Gregory]374-mr. gregory ; and in the meanwhile carried [us]2350-we to a late ordinary for the meal [we]2350-we stood in need of . [He]365-captain sang seemed extremely friendly , as [I]0-i say , but what surprised [me]0-i a good deal , rather boisterous in the bargain ; and the cause of this was soon to appear . For at the ordinary , calling for Rhenish wine and drinking of it deep , [he]365-captain sang soon became unutterably tipsy . In this case , as too common with [all men]1776-all men , but especially with those of [his]365-captain sang rough trade , what little sense or manners [he]365-captain sang possessed deserted [him]365-captain sang ; and [he]365-captain sang behaved [himself]365-captain sang so scandalous to [the young lady]3012-the young lady , jesting most ill - favouredly at the figure [she]3012-the young lady had made on [the ship]3120-the ship s rail , that [I]0-i had no resource but carry [her]3012-the young lady suddenly away .

[She]3012-the young lady came out of the ordinary clinging to [me]0-i close . " Take [me]3012-the young lady away , [David]222-davie , "[3012-the young lady] [she]3012-the young lady said . " [You]222-davie keep [me]3012-the young lady . [I]3012-the young lady am not afraid with [you]222-davie . "[3012-the young lady]

" And have no cause , [[my]0-i little friend]3749-my little friend ! "[0-i] cried [I]0-i , and could have found it in [my]0-i heart to weep .

" Where will [you]222-davie be taking [me]3012-the young lady ? "[3012-the young lady] [she]3012-the young lady said again . " Don t leave [me]3012-the young lady at all events never leave [me]3012-the young lady . "[3012-the young lady]

" Where am [I]0-i taking [you]3012-the young lady to ? "[0-i] says [I]0-i stopping , for [I]0-i had been staving on ahead in mere blindness . " [I]0-i must stop and think . But [I]0-i ll not leave [you]3012-the young lady , [Catriona]189-catriona ; [the Lord]3830-the lord do so to [me]0-i , and more also , if [I]0-i should fail or fash [you]3012-the young lady . "[0-i]

[She]3012-the young lady crept close into [me]0-i by way of a reply .

" Here , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " is the stillest place [we]4540-we have hit on yet in [this busy byke of [a city]500-a city]4541-this busy byke of a city . Let [us]4540-we sit down here under yon tree and consider of [our]4540-we course . "[0-i]

[That tree which [I]0-i am little like to forget]2362-that tree which i am little like to forget stood hard by [the harbour side]2363-the harbour side . It was like a black night , but lights were in [the houses]489-the houses , and nearer hand in [the quiet ships]2365-the quiet ships ; there was a shining of [the city]471-the city on the one hand , and a buzz hung over it of [many thousands walking and talking]2367-many thousands walking and talking ; on the other , it was dark and the water bubbled on the sides . [I]0-i spread [my]0-i cloak upon a builder s stone , and made [her]3012-the young lady sit there ; [she]3012-the young lady would have kept [her]3012-the young lady hold upon [me]0-i , for [she]3012-the young lady still shook with the late affronts ; but [I]0-i wanted to think clear , disengaged [myself]0-i , and paced to and fro before [her]3012-the young lady , in the manner of what [we]2368-we call [a smuggler]2369-a smuggler s walk , belabouring [my]0-i brains for any remedy . By the course of these scattering thoughts [I]0-i was brought suddenly face to face with a remembrance that , in the heat and haste of [our]2368-we departure , [I]0-i had left [Captain Sang]365-captain sang to pay the ordinary . At this [I]0-i began to laugh out loud , for [I]0-i thought [the man]3029-the man well served ; and at the same time , by an instinctive movement , carried [my]0-i hand to the pocket where [my]0-i money was . [I]0-i suppose it was in [the lane where [the women]2372-the women jostled [us]2368-we]2371-the lane where the women jostled us ; but there is only the one thing certain , that [my]0-i purse was gone .

" [You]0-i will have thought of something good , "[3012-the young lady] said [she]3012-the young lady , observing [me]0-i to pause .

At the pinch [we]2368-we were in , [my]0-i mind became suddenly clear as a perspective glass , and [I]0-i saw there was no choice of methods . [I]0-i had not one doit of coin , but in [my]0-i pocket - book [I]0-i had still [my]0-i letter on [the Leyden merchant]2373-the leyden merchant ; and there was now but the one way to get to [Leyden]74-leyden , and that was to walk on [our]2368-we two feet .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i know [you]189-catriona re brave and [I]0-i believe [you]189-catriona re strong do [you]189-catriona think [you]189-catriona could walk thirty miles on [a plain road]4543-a plain road ? "[0-i] [We]2368-we found it , [I]0-i believe , scarce the two - thirds of that , but such was [my]0-i notion of the distance .

" [David]222-davie , "[2374-i] [she]2374-i said , " if [you]222-davie will just keep near , [I]2374-i will go anywhere and do anything . The courage of [my]2374-i heart , it is all broken . Do not be leaving [me]2374-i in [this horrible country]4544-this horrible country by [myself]2374-i , and [I]2374-i will do all else . "[2374-i]

" Can [you]189-catriona start now and march all night ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [I]2374-i will do all that [you]222-davie can ask of [me]2374-i , "[2374-i] [she]2374-i said , " and never ask [you]222-davie why . [I]2374-i have been [a bad ungrateful girl to [you]222-davie]4545-a bad ungrateful girl to you ; and do what [you]222-davie please with [me]2374-i now ! And [I]2374-i think [Miss Barbara Grant]234-miss grant is [the best lady in [the world]3073-the world]4546-the best lady in the world , "[2374-i] [she]2374-i added , " and [I]2374-i do not see what [she]234-miss grant would deny [you]222-davie for at all events . "[2374-i]

This was Greek and [Hebrew]375-hebrew to [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i had other matters to consider , and the first of these was to get clear of [that city]2375-that city on [the Leyden road]2376-the leyden road . It proved a cruel problem ; and it may have been one or two at night ere [we]2377-we had solved it . Once beyond [the houses]489-the houses , there was neither moon nor stars to guide [us]2377-we ; only the whiteness of the way in the midst and a blackness of an alley on both hands . The walking was besides made most extraordinary difficult by a plain black frost that fell suddenly in the small hours and turned [that highway]2379-that highway into one long slide .

" Well , [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " here [we]2377-we are like [[the king]590-the king s sons]4549-the king s sons and [the old wives daughters]4550-the old wives daughters in [[your]189-catriona daft - like Highland]4551-your daft - like highland tales . Soon [we]2377-we ll be going over [the seven Bens]154-the seven bens , [the seven glens]4552-the seven glens and [the seven mountain moors]4553-the seven mountain moors . "[0-i] Which was a common byword or overcome in those tales of [hers]2380-hers that had stuck in [my]0-i memory .

" Ah , "[2380-hers] says [she]2380-hers , " but here are [no glens]4554-no glens or [mountains]4555-mountains ! Though [I]2380-hers will never be denying but what the trees and [some of [the plain places hereabouts]4557-the plain places hereabouts]4556-some of the plain places hereabouts are very pretty . But [[our]2377-we country]3734-our country is the best yet . "[2380-hers]

" [I]0-i wish [we]2377-we could say as much for [[our]2377-we own folk]4559-our own folk , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , recalling [Sprott]315-sandie and [Sang]365-captain sang , and perhaps [James]181-james More [himself]181-james .

" [I]2381-i will never complain of [the country of [[my]2381-i friend]3036-my friend]4560-the country of my friend , "[2381-i] said [she]2381-i , and spoke it out with an accent so particular that [I]0-i seemed to see the look upon [her]2381-i face .

[I]0-i caught in [my]0-i breath sharp and came near falling for [my]0-i pains on the black ice .

" [I]0-i do not know what [you]2381-i think , [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , when [I]0-i was a little recovered , " but this has been the best day yet ! [I]0-i think shame to say it , when [you]2381-i have met in with such misfortunes and disfavours ; but for [me]0-i , it has been the best day yet . "[0-i]

" It was a good day when [you]0-i showed [me]2381-i so much love , "[2381-i] said [she]2381-i .

" And yet [I]0-i think shame to be happy too , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on , " and [you]2381-i here on [the road]971-the road in the black night . "[0-i]

" Where in [the great world]2967-the great world would [I]2381-i be else ? "[2381-i] [she]2381-i cried . " [I]2381-i am thinking [I]2381-i am safest where [I]2381-i am with [you]0-i . "[2381-i]

" [I]0-i am quite forgiven , then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Will [you]0-i not forgive [me]2381-i that time so much as not to take it in [your]0-i mouth again ? "[2381-i] [she]2381-i cried . " There is nothing in this heart to [you]0-i but thanks . But [I]2381-i will be honest too , "[2381-i] [she]2381-i added , with a kind of suddenness , " and [I]2381-i ll never can forgive [that girl]4458-that girl . "[2381-i]

" Is this [Miss Grant]234-miss grant again ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [You]0-i said [yourself]0-i [she]234-miss grant was [the best lady in [the world]3073-the world]4546-the best lady in the world . "[2381-i]

" So [she]234-miss grant will be , indeed ! "[189-catriona] says [Catriona]189-catriona . " But [I]189-catriona will never forgive [her]234-miss grant for all that . [I]189-catriona will never , never forgive [her]234-miss grant , and let [me]189-catriona hear tell of [her]234-miss grant no more . "[189-catriona]

" Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " this beats all that ever came to [my]0-i knowledge ; and [I]0-i wonder that [you]0-i can indulge [yourself]0-i in such bairnly whims . Here is [a young lady that was the best friend in [the world]3073-the world to [the both of [us]4570-us , that learned [us]4570-us how to dress [ourselves]4570-us , and in a great manner how to behave , as [anyone]3224-anyone can see that knew [us]4570-us both before and after]4569-the both of us , that learned us how to dress ourselves , and in a great manner how to behave , as anyone can see that knew us both before and after]4567-a young lady that was the best friend in the world to the both of us , that learned us how to dress ourselves , and in a great manner how to behave , as anyone can see that knew us both before and after . "[0-i]

But [Catriona]189-catriona stopped square in the midst of [the highway]2382-the highway .

" It is this way of it , "[189-catriona] said [she]189-catriona . " Either [you]0-i will go on to speak of [her]4567-a young lady that was the best friend in the world to the both of us , that learned us how to dress ourselves , and in a great manner how to behave , as anyone can see that knew us both before and after , and [I]189-catriona will go back to [yon town]4572-yon town , and let come of it what [God]223-god pleases ! Or else [you]0-i will do [me]189-catriona that politeness to talk of other things . "[189-catriona]

[I]0-i was [the most nonplussed person in [this world]3509-this world]2383-the most nonplussed person in this world ; but [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i that [she]189-catriona depended altogether on [my]0-i help , that [she]189-catriona was of the frail sex and not so much beyond [a child]808-a child , and it was for [me]0-i to be wise for [the pair of [us]1062-the pair of us]1062-the pair of us .

" [[My]0-i dear girl]4573-my dear girl , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i can make neither head nor tails of this ; but God forbid that [I]0-i should do anything to set [you]4573-my dear girl on the jee . As for talking of [Miss Grant]234-miss grant , [I]0-i have no such a mind to it , and [I]0-i believe it was [yourself]4573-my dear girl began it . [My]0-i only design if [I]0-i took [you]4573-my dear girl up at all was for [your]4573-my dear girl own improvement , for [I]0-i hate the very look of injustice . Not that [I]0-i do not wish [you]4573-my dear girl to have a good pride and a nice female delicacy ; [they]4574-they become [you]4573-my dear girl well ; but here [you]4573-my dear girl show [them]4574-they to excess . "[0-i]

" Well , then , have [you]2388-you done ? "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you .

" [I]2388-you have done , "[2388-you] said [I.]2388-you

" A very good thing , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you , and [we]2389-our went on again , but now in silence .

It was an eerie employment to walk in the gross night , beholding only shadows and hearing nought but [our]2389-our own steps . At first , [I]0-i believe [our]2389-our hearts burned against each other with a deal of enmity ; but the darkness and the cold , and the silence , which only the cocks sometimes interrupted , or sometimes the farmyard dogs , had pretty soon brought down [our]2389-our pride to the dust ; and for [my]0-i own particular , [I]0-i would have jumped at any decent opening for speech .

Before the day peeped , came on a warmish rain , and the frost was all wiped away from among [our]2389-our feet . [I]0-i took [my]0-i cloak to [her]2387-you and sought to hap [her]2387-you in the same ; [she]2387-you bade [me]0-i , rather impatiently , to keep it .

" Indeed and [I]0-i will do no such thing , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " Here am [I]0-i , [a great , ugly lad that has seen all kinds of weather]4575-a great , ugly lad that has seen all kinds of weather , and here are [you]2387-you [a tender , pretty maid]4576-a tender , pretty maid ! [[My]0-i dear]3481-my dear , [you]2387-you would not put [me]0-i to a shame ? "[0-i]

Without more words [she]2387-you let [me]0-i cover [her]2387-you ; which as [I]0-i was doing in the darkness , [I]0-i let [my]0-i hand rest a moment on [her]2387-you shoulder , almost like an embrace .

" [You]2387-you must try to be more patient of [[your]2387-you friend]2987-your friend , "[2387-you] said I.

[I]0-i thought [she]2387-you seemed to lean the least thing in [the world]3073-the world against [my]0-i bosom , or perhaps it was but fancy .

" There will be no end to [your]0-i goodness , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you .

And [we]2391-we went on again in silence ; but now all was changed ; and the happiness that was in [my]0-i heart was like a fire in a great chimney .

The rain passed ere day ; it was but a sloppy morning as [we]2391-we came into [the town of [Delft]155-delft]2392-the town of delft . [The red gabled houses]2393-the red gabled houses made a handsome show on either hand of [a canal]2394-a canal ; [the servant lassies]2395-the servant lassies were out slestering and scrubbing at the very stones upon [the public highway]2396-the public highway ; smoke rose from [a hundred kitchens]2397-a hundred kitchens ; and it came in upon [me]0-i strongly it was time to break [our]2391-we fasts .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i believe [you]2387-you have yet a shilling and three baubees ? "[0-i]

" Are [you]0-i wanting it ? "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you , and passed [me]0-i [her]2387-you purse . " [I]2387-you am wishing it was five pounds ! What will [you]0-i want it for ? "[2387-you]

" And what have [we]2391-we been walking for all night , like a pair of waif Egyptians ! "[0-i] says [I.]0-i " Just because [I]0-i was robbed of [my]0-i purse and all [I]0-i possessed in [that unchancy town of]4579-that unchancy town of [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam . [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i of it now , because [I]0-i think the worst is over , but [we]2391-we have still a good tramp before [us]2391-we till [we]2391-we get to where [my]0-i money is , and if [you]0-i would not buy [me]0-i a piece of bread , [I]0-i were like to go fasting . "[0-i]

[She]2387-you looked at [me]0-i with open eyes . By the light of the new day [she]2387-you was all black and pale for weariness , so that [my]0-i heart smote [me]0-i for [her]2387-you . But as for [her]2387-you , [she]2387-you broke out laughing .

" [My]2387-you torture ! are [we]2391-we [beggars]4580-beggars then ! "[2387-you] [she]2387-you cried . " [You]0-i too ? O , [I]2387-you could have wished for this same thing ! And [I]2387-you am glad to buy [your]0-i breakfast to [you]0-i . But it would be pleisand if [I]2387-you would have had to dance to get a meal to [you]0-i ! For [I]2387-you believe [they]4581-they are not very well acquainted with [our]2401-we manner of dancing over here , and might be paying for the curiosity of that sight . "[2387-you]

[I]0-i could have kissed [her]2387-you for that word , not with [a lover]2398-a lover s mind , but in a heat of admiration . For it always warms [a man]519-a man to see [a woman brave]2400-a woman brave .

[We]2401-we got a drink of milk from [a country wife]2402-a country wife but new come to [the town]1876-the town , and in [a baker s]2404-a baker s , a piece of excellent , hot , sweet - smelling bread , which [we]2401-we ate upon [the road]971-the road as [we]2401-we went on . [That road from [Delft]155-delft to [the Hague]2407-the hague]2406-that road from delft to the hague is just five miles of [a fine avenue shaded with trees]2408-a fine avenue shaded with trees , [a canal on the one hand]2409-a canal on the one hand , on [the other excellent pastures of cattle]2410-the other excellent pastures of cattle . It was pleasant here indeed .

" And now , [Davie]222-davie , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you , " what will [you]222-davie do with [me]2387-you at all events ? "[2387-you]

" It is what [we]2401-we have to speak of , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and the sooner yet the better . [I]0-i can come by money in [Leyden]74-leyden ; that will be all well . But the trouble is how to dispose of [you]2387-you until [[your]2387-you father]3247-your father come . [I]0-i thought last night [you]2387-you seemed a little sweir to part from [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" It will be more than seeming then , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you .

" [You]2387-you are [a very young maid]4583-a very young maid , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and [I]0-i am but [a very young callant]4584-a very young callant . This is a great piece of difficulty . What way are [we]2401-we to manage ? Unless indeed , [you]2387-you could pass to be [[my]0-i sister]3358-my sister ? "[0-i]

" And what for no ? "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you , " if [you]0-i would let [me]2387-you ! "[2387-you]

" [I]0-i wish [you]2387-you were so , indeed , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " [I]0-i would be [a fine man]4586-a fine man if [I]0-i had such [a sister]4587-a sister . But the rub is that [you]2387-you are [Catriona Drummond]189-catriona . "[0-i]

" And now [I]2387-you will be [Catriona Balfour]189-catriona , "[2387-you] [she]2387-you said . " And who is to ken ? [They]4588-they are [all strange folk]4589-all strange folk here . "[2387-you]

" If [you]2387-you think that it would do , "[0-i] says [I.]0-i " [I]0-i own it troubles [me]0-i . [I]0-i would like it very ill , if [I]0-i advised [you]2387-you at all wrong . "[0-i]

" [David]222-davie , [I]2387-you have [no friend]4590-no friend here but [you]222-davie , "[2387-you] [she]2387-you said .

" The mere truth is , [I]0-i am too young to be [[your]2387-you friend]2987-your friend , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]0-i am too young to advise [you]2387-you , or [you]2387-you to be advised . [I]0-i see not what else [we]4592-we are to do , and yet [I]0-i ought to warn [you]2387-you . "[0-i]

" [I]2387-you will have no choice left , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you . " [[My]2387-you father]417-my father [James More]181-james has not used [me]2387-you very well , and it is not the first time , [I]2387-you am cast upon [your]2387-you hands like a sack of barley meal , and have nothing else to think of but [your]2387-you pleasure . If [you]2387-you will have [me]2387-you , good and well . If [you]2387-you will not "[2387-you] [she]2387-you turned and touched [her]2387-you hand upon [my]0-i arm " [David]222-davie , [I]2387-you am afraid , "[2387-you] said [she]2387-you .

" No , but [I]0-i ought to warn [you]2387-you , "[0-i] [I]0-i began ; and then bethought [me]0-i [I]0-i was [the bearer of the purse]2411-the bearer of the purse , and it would never do to seem too churlish . " [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " don t misunderstand [me]0-i : [I]0-i am just trying to do [my]0-i duty by [you]2387-you , [girl]4594-girl ! Here am [I]0-i going alone to [this strange city]4595-this strange city , to be [a solitary student there]4596-a solitary student there ; and here is this chance arisen that [you]2387-you might dwell with [me]0-i a bit , and be like [[my]0-i sister]3358-my sister ; [you]2387-you can surely understand this much , [[my]0-i dear]3481-my dear , that [I]0-i would just love to have [you]2387-you ? "[0-i]

" Well , and here [I]2412-she am , "[2412-she] said [she]2412-she . " So that s soon settled . "[2412-she]

[I]0-i know [I]0-i was in duty bounden to have spoke more plain . [I]0-i know this was a great blot on [my]0-i character , for which [I]0-i was lucky that [I]0-i did not pay more dear . But [I]0-i minded how easy [her]2412-she delicacy had been startled with a word of kissing [her]2412-she in [Barbara]234-miss grant s letter ; now that [she]2412-she depended on [me]0-i , how was [I]0-i to be more bold ? Besides , the truth is , [I]0-i could see no other feasible method to dispose of [her]2412-she . And [I]0-i daresay inclination pulled [me]0-i very strong .

A little beyond [the Hague]2407-the hague [she]2412-she fell very lame and made the rest of the distance heavily enough . Twice [she]2412-she must rest by the wayside , which [she]2412-she did with pretty apologies , calling [herself]2412-she a shame to [the Highlands]29-the highlands and the race [she]2412-she came of , and nothing but a hindrance to [myself]0-i . It was [her]2412-she excuse , [she]2412-she said , that [she]2412-she was not much used with walking shod . [I]0-i would have had [her]2412-she strip off [her]2412-she shoes and stockings and go barefoot . But [she]2412-she pointed out to [me]0-i that [the women of [that country]1656-that country]2414-the women of that country , even in [the landward roads]2416-the landward roads , appeared to be all shod .

" [I]2412-she must not be disgracing [[my]2412-she brother]4599-my brother , "[2412-she] said [she]2412-she , and was very merry with it all , although [her]2412-she face told tales of [her]2412-she .

There is [a garden in [that city]2375-that city [we]2419-we were bound to]2417-a garden in that city we were bound to , sanded below with clean sand , the trees meeting overhead , some of [them]2420-them trimmed , [some preached]2421-some preached , and the whole place beautified with [alleys]2422-alleys and arbours . Here [I]0-i left [Catriona]189-catriona , and went forward by [myself]0-i to find [[my]0-i correspondent]1758-my correspondent . [There]636-there [I]0-i drew on [my]0-i credit , and asked to be recommended to [some decent , retired lodging]2425-some decent , retired lodging . [My]0-i baggage being not yet arrived , [I]0-i told [him]1758-my correspondent [I]0-i supposed [I]0-i should require [his]1758-my correspondent caution with [the people of [the house]818-the house]2426-the people of the house ; and explained that , [[my]0-i sister]3358-my sister being come for a while to keep [house]618-house with [me]0-i , [I]0-i should be wanting [two chambers]2430-two chambers . This was all very well ; but the trouble was that [Mr. Balfour]222-davie in [his]222-davie letter of recommendation had condescended on a great deal of particulars , and never a word of [any sister]2431-any sister in the case . [I]0-i could see [[my]0-i Dutchman]2432-my dutchman was extremely suspicious ; and viewing [me]0-i over the rims of a great pair of spectacles [he]2432-my dutchman was a poor , frail body , and reminded [me]0-i of an infirm rabbit [he]2432-my dutchman began to question [me]0-i close .

Here [I]0-i fell in a panic . Suppose [he]2432-my dutchman accept [my]0-i tale thinks [I]0-i , suppose [he]2432-my dutchman invite [[my]0-i sister]3358-my sister to [[his]2432-my dutchman house]1887-his house , and that [I]0-i bring [her]3358-my sister . [I]0-i shall have a fine ravelled pirn to unwind , and may end by disgracing both [the lassie]1576-the lassie and [myself]0-i . Thereupon [I]0-i began hastily to expound to [him]2432-my dutchman [[my]0-i sister]3358-my sister s character . [She]3358-my sister was of a bashful disposition , it appeared , and be extremely fearful of meeting [strangers]2950-strangers that [I]0-i had left [her]3358-my sister at that moment sitting in [a public place]2438-a public place alone . And then , being launched upon the stream of falsehood , [I]0-i must do like all the rest of [the world]3073-the world in the same circumstance , and plunge in deeper than was any service ; adding some altogether needless particulars of [Miss Balfour]377-miss balfour s ill - health and retirement during childhood . In the midst of which [I]0-i awoke to a sense of [my]0-i behaviour , and was turned to one blush .

[The old gentleman]2440-the old gentleman was not so much deceived but what [he]2440-the old gentleman discovered a willingness to be quit of [me]0-i . But [he]2440-the old gentleman was first of all [a man of business]2441-a man of business ; and knowing that [my]0-i money was good enough , however it might be with [my]0-i conduct , [he]2440-the old gentleman was so far obliging as to send [[his]2440-the old gentleman son]2442-his son to be [[my]0-i guide]1777-my guide and caution in the matter of a lodging . This implied [my]0-i presenting of [the young man]2444-the young man to [Catriona]189-catriona . [The poor , pretty child]2445-the poor , pretty child was much recovered with resting , looked and behaved to perfection , and took [my]0-i arm and gave [me]0-i the name of [brother]2446-brother more easily than [I]0-i could answer [her]189-catriona . But there was one misfortune : thinking to help , [she]2445-the poor , pretty child was rather towardly than otherwise to [[my]0-i Dutchman]2432-my dutchman . And [I]0-i could not but reflect that [Miss Balfour]377-miss balfour had rather suddenly outgrown [her]377-miss balfour bashfulness . And there was another thing , the difference of [our]2448-we speech . [I]0-i had the Low Country tongue and dwelled upon [my]0-i words ; [she]2445-the poor , pretty child had a hill voice , spoke with something of an English accent , only far more delightful , and was scarce quite fit to be called [a deacon in the craft of talking English grammar]2449-a deacon in the craft of talking english grammar ; so that , for [a brother]720-a brother and [sister]2451-sister , [we]2448-we made [a most uneven pair]2452-a most uneven pair . But [the young Hollander]2453-the young hollander was a heavy dog , without so much spirit in [his]2453-the young hollander belly as to remark [her]2445-the poor , pretty child prettiness , for which [I]0-i scorned [him]2453-the young hollander . And as soon as [he]2453-the young hollander had found a cover to [our]2448-we heads , [he]2453-the young hollander left [us]2448-we alone , which was the greater service of [the two]2454-the two .

CHAPTER XXIV FULL STORY OF [A COPY OF HEINECCIUS]2455-a copy of heineccius

The place found was in the upper part of [a house backed on [a canal]2394-a canal]2456-a house backed on a canal . [We]2448-we had [two rooms]2458-two rooms , the second entering from the first ; each had a chimney built out into the floor in the Dutch manner ; and being alongside , [each]2188-each had the same prospect from the window of the top of a tree below [us]2448-we in [a little court]2460-a little court , of a piece of [the canal]2461-the canal , and of houses in the [Hollands]152-hollands architecture and a church spire upon the further side . A full set of bells hung in that spire and made delightful music ; and when there was any sun at all , it shone direct in [[our]2448-we two chambers]2462-our two chambers . From [a tavern hard by]2463-a tavern hard by [we]2448-we had good meals sent in .

The first night [we]2448-we were both pretty weary , and [she]2464-her extremely so . There was little talk between [us]2448-we , and [I]0-i packed [her]2464-her off to [her]2464-her bed as soon as [she]2464-her had eaten . The first thing in the morning [I]0-i wrote word to [Sprott]315-sandie to have [her]2464-her mails sent on , together with a line to [Alan]185-alan at [[his]185-alan chief s]2465-his chief s ; and had the same despatched , and [her]2464-her breakfast ready , ere [I]0-i waked [her]2464-her . [I]0-i was a little abashed when [she]2464-her came forth in [her]2464-her one habit , and the mud of the way upon [her]2464-her stockings . By what inquiries [I]0-i had made , it seemed a good few days must pass before [her]2464-her mails could come to hand in [Leyden]74-leyden , and it was plainly needful [she]2464-her must have a shift of things . [She]2464-her was unwilling at first that [I]0-i should go to that expense ; but [I]0-i reminded [her]2464-her [she]2464-her was now [[a rich man]2466-a rich man s sister]2467-a rich man s sister and must appear suitably in the part , and [we]2468-we had not got to [the second merchant s]2469-the second merchant s before [she]2464-her was entirely charmed into the spirit of the thing , and [her]2464-her eyes shining . It pleased [me]0-i to see [her]2464-her so innocent and thorough in this pleasure . What was more extraordinary was the passion into which [I]0-i fell on it [myself]0-i ; being never satisfied that [I]0-i had bought [her]2464-her enough or fine enough , and never weary of beholding [her]2464-her in different attires . Indeed , [I]0-i began to understand some little of [Miss Grant]234-miss grant s immersion in the interest of clothes ; for the truth is , when [you]2470-you have the ground of [a beautiful person to adorn]2471-a beautiful person to adorn , the whole business becomes beautiful . The Dutch chintzes [I]0-i should say were extraordinary cheap and fine ; but [I]0-i would be ashamed to set down what [I]0-i paid for stockings to [her]2464-her . Altogether [I]0-i spent so great a sum upon this pleasuring as [I]0-i may call it that [I]0-i was ashamed for a great while to spend more ; and by way of a set - off , [I]0-i left [[our]2472-our chambers]2473-our chambers pretty bare . If [we]2472-our had beds , if [Catriona]189-catriona was a little braw , and [I]0-i had light to see [her]189-catriona by , [we]2472-our were richly enough lodged for [me]0-i .

By the end of this merchandising [I]0-i was glad to leave [her]2464-her at the door with all [our]2472-our purchases , and go for a long walk alone in which to read [myself]0-i a lecture . Here had [I]0-i taken under [my]0-i roof , and as good as to [my]0-i bosom , [a young lass extremely beautiful]2474-a young lass extremely beautiful , and whose innocence was [her]2474-a young lass extremely beautiful peril . [My]0-i talk with [the old Dutchman]2475-the old dutchman , and the lies to which [I]0-i was constrained , had already given [me]0-i a sense of how [my]0-i conduct must appear to [others]1700-others ; and now , after the strong admiration [I]0-i had just experienced and the immoderacy with which [I]0-i had continued [my]0-i vain purchases , [I]0-i began to think of it [myself]0-i as very hazarded . [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i , if [I]0-i had [a sister]4587-a sister indeed , whether [I]0-i would so expose [her]4587-a sister ; then , judging the case too problematical , [I]0-i varied [my]0-i question into this , whether [I]0-i would so trust [Catriona]189-catriona in the hands of [any other Christian being]2478-any other christian being ; the answer to which made [my]0-i face to burn . The more cause , since [I]0-i had been entrapped and had entrapped [the girl]517-the girl into an undue situation , that [I]0-i should behave in it with scrupulous nicety . [She]517-the girl depended on [me]0-i wholly for [her]517-the girl bread and shelter ; in case [I]0-i should alarm [her]517-the girl delicacy , [she]517-the girl had no retreat . Besides [I]0-i was [[her]517-the girl host]2480-her host and [[her]517-the girl protector]2481-her protector ; and the more irregularly [I]0-i had fallen in these positions , the less excuse for [me]0-i if [I]0-i should profit by the same to forward even the most honest suit ; for with the opportunities that [I]0-i enjoyed , and which [no wise parent]2482-no wise parent would have suffered for a moment , even the most honest suit would be unfair . [I]0-i saw [I]0-i must be extremely hold - off in [my]0-i relations ; and yet not too much so neither ; for if [I]0-i had no right to appear at all in the character of [a suitor]2483-a suitor , [I]0-i must yet appear continually , and if possible agreeably , in that of [host]2484-host . It was plain [I]0-i should require a great deal of tact and conduct , perhaps more than [my]0-i years afforded . But [I]0-i had rushed in where angels might have feared to tread , and there was no way out of that position save by behaving right while [I]0-i was in [it]2485-it . [I]0-i made a set of rules for [my]0-i guidance ; prayed for strength to be enabled to observe them , and as a more human aid to the same end purchased a study - book in law . This being all that [I]0-i could think of , [I]0-i relaxed from these grave considerations ; whereupon [my]0-i mind bubbled at once into an effervescency of pleasing spirits , and it was like one treading on air that [I]0-i turned homeward . As [I]0-i thought that name of [home]658-home , and recalled the image of that figure awaiting [me]0-i between four walls , [my]0-i heart beat upon [my]0-i bosom .

[My]0-i troubles began with [my]0-i return . [She]2487-she ran to greet [me]0-i with an obvious and affecting pleasure . [She]2487-she was clad , besides , entirely in the new clothes that [I]0-i had bought for [her]2487-she ; looked in them beyond expression well ; and must walk about and drop [me]0-i curtseys to display them and to be admired . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i did it with an ill grace , for [I]0-i thought to have choked upon the words .

" Well , "[2487-she] [she]2487-she said , " if [you]0-i will not be caring for [my]2487-she pretty clothes , see what [I]2487-she have done with [[our]4600-our two chambers]2462-our two chambers . "[2487-she] And [she]2487-she showed [me]0-i the place all very finely swept , and the fires glowing in the two chimneys .

[I]0-i was glad of a chance to seem a little more severe than [I]0-i quite felt . " [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i am very much displeased with [you]189-catriona , and [you]189-catriona must never again lay a hand upon [[my]0-i room]4602-my room . [One of [us]4600-our two]4603-one of us two must have the rule while [we]4600-our are here together ; it is most fit it should be [I]0-i who am both [the man]3029-the man and [the elder]4605-the elder ; and [I]0-i give [you]189-catriona that for [my]0-i command . "[0-i]

[She]2487-she dropped [me]0-i one of [her]2487-she curtseys ; which were extraordinary taking . " If [you]0-i will be cross , "[2487-she] said [she]2487-she , " [I]2487-she must be making pretty manners at [you]0-i , [Davie]222-davie . [I]2487-she will be very obedient , as [I]2487-she should be when every stitch upon all there is of [me]2487-she belongs to [you]0-i . But [you]0-i will not be very cross either , because now [I]2487-she have [not anyone else]4606-not anyone else . "[2487-she]

This struck [me]0-i hard , and [I]0-i made haste , in a kind of penitence , to blot out all the good effect of [my]0-i last speech . In this direction progress was more easy , being down hill ; [she]2487-she led [me]0-i forward , smiling ; at the sight of [her]2487-she , in the brightness of the fire and with [her]2487-she pretty becks and looks , [my]0-i heart was altogether melted . [We]2488-our made [our]2488-our meal with infinite mirth and tenderness ; and [the two]2454-the two seemed to be commingled into one , so that [our]2488-our very laughter sounded like a kindness .

In the midst of which [I]0-i awoke to better recollections , made a lame word of excuse , and set [myself]0-i boorishly to [my]0-i studies . It was a substantial , instructive book that [I]0-i had bought , by [the late Dr. Heineccius]378-heineccius , in which [I]0-i was to do a great deal reading these next few days , and often very glad that [I]0-i had [no one]4304-no one to question [me]0-i of what [I]0-i read . Methought [she]2487-she bit [her]2487-she lip at [me]0-i a little , and that cut [me]0-i . Indeed it left [her]2487-she wholly solitary , the more as [she]2487-she was very little of [a reader]1501-a reader , and had never a book . But what was [I]0-i to do ?

So the rest of the evening flowed by almost without speech .

[I]0-i could have beat [myself]0-i . [I]0-i could not lie in [my]0-i bed that night for rage and repentance , but walked to and fro on [my]0-i bare feet till [I]0-i was nearly perished , for the chimney was gone out and the frost keen . The thought of [her]2487-she in [the next room]667-the next room , the thought that [she]2487-she might even hear [me]0-i as [I]0-i walked , the remembrance of [my]0-i churlishness and that [I]0-i must continue to practise the same ungrateful course or be dishonoured , put [me]0-i beside [my]0-i reason . [I]0-i stood like [a man between [Scylla]379-scylla and [Charybdis]380-charybdis]2493-a man between scylla and charybdis : What must [she]2487-she think of [me]0-i ? was [my]0-i one thought that softened [me]0-i continually into weakness . What is to become of [us]2494-us ? the other which steeled [me]0-i again to resolution . This was [my]0-i first night of wakefulness and divided counsels , of which [I]0-i was now to pass many , pacing like [a madman]2495-a madman , sometimes weeping like [a childish boy]2496-a childish boy , sometimes praying [I]0-i fain would hope like [a Christian]2497-a christian .

But prayer is not very difficult , and the hitch comes in practice . In [her]2487-she presence , and above all if [I]0-i allowed any beginning of familiarity , [I]0-i found [I]0-i had very little command of what should follow . But to sit all day in [the same room]2498-the same room with [her]2487-she , and feign to be engaged upon [Heineccius]378-heineccius , surpassed [my]0-i strength . So that [I]0-i fell instead upon the expedient of absenting [myself]0-i so much as [I]0-i was able ; taking out classes and sitting there regularly , often with small attention , the test of which [I]0-i found the other day in a note - book of that period , where [I]0-i had left off to follow an edifying lecture and actually scribbled in [my]0-i book some very ill verses , though the Latinity is rather better than [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i could ever have compassed . The evil of this course was unhappily near as great as its advantage . [I]0-i had the less time of trial , but [I]0-i believe , while the time lasted , [I]0-i was tried the more extremely . For [she]2487-she being so much left to solitude , [she]2487-she came to greet [my]0-i return with an increasing fervour that came nigh to overmaster [me]0-i . These friendly offers [I]0-i must barbarously cast back ; and [my]0-i rejection sometimes wounded [her]2487-she so cruelly that [I]0-i must unbend and seek to make it up to [her]2487-she in kindness . So that [our]2499-our time passed in ups and downs , tiffs and disappointments , upon the which [I]0-i could almost say if it may be said with reverence that [I]0-i was crucified .

The base of [my]0-i trouble was [Catriona]189-catriona s extraordinary innocence , at which [I]0-i was not so much surprised as filled with pity and admiration . [She]189-catriona seemed to have no thought of [our]2499-our position , no sense of [my]0-i struggles ; welcomed any mark of [my]0-i weakness with responsive joy ; and when [I]0-i was drove again to [my]0-i retrenchments , did not always dissemble [her]189-catriona chagrin . There were times when [I]0-i have thought to [myself]0-i , " If [she]189-catriona were over head in love , and set [her]189-catriona cap to catch [me]0-i , [she]189-catriona would scarce behave much otherwise ; "[0-i] and then [I]0-i would fall again into wonder at the simplicity of [woman]2500-woman , from whom [I]0-i felt in these moments that [I]0-i was not worthy to be descended .

There was one point in particular on which [our]2499-our warfare turned , and of all things , this was the question of [her]189-catriona clothes . [My]0-i baggage had soon followed [me]0-i from [Rotterdam]146-rotterdam , and [hers]189-catriona from [Helvoet]148-helvoet . [She]189-catriona had now , as it were , two wardrobes ; and it grew to be understood between [us]2499-our [I]0-i could never tell how that when [she]189-catriona was friendly [she]189-catriona would wear [my]0-i clothes , and when otherwise [her]189-catriona own . It was meant for a buffet , and as it were the renunciation of [her]189-catriona gratitude ; and [I]0-i felt it so in [my]0-i bosom , but was generally more wise than to appear to have observed the circumstance .

Once , indeed , [I]0-i was betrayed into a childishness greater than [her]189-catriona own ; it fell in this way . On [my]0-i return from [classes]2501-classes , thinking upon [her]189-catriona devoutly with a great deal of love and a good deal of annoyance in the bargain , the annoyance began to fade away out of [my]0-i mind ; and spying in a window one of those forced flowers , of which [the Hollanders]2502-the hollanders are so skilled in the artifice , [I]0-i gave way to an impulse and bought it for [Catriona]189-catriona . [I]0-i do not know the name of that flower , but it was of the pink colour , and [I]0-i thought [she]189-catriona would admire the same , and carried it [home]658-home to [her]189-catriona with a wonderful soft heart . [I]0-i had left [her]189-catriona in [my]0-i clothes , and when [I]0-i returned to find [her]189-catriona all changed and a face to match , [I]0-i cast but the one look at [her]189-catriona from head to foot , ground [my]0-i teeth together , flung the window open , and [my]0-i flower into [the court]3404-the court , and then between rage and prudence [myself]0-i out of [that room]758-that room again , of which [I]0-i slammed [she]189-catriona door as [I]0-i went out .

On the steep stair [I]0-i came near falling , and this brought [me]0-i to [myself]0-i , so that [I]0-i began at once to see the folly of [my]0-i conduct . CHAPTER XXV THE RETURN OF [JAMES MORE]181-james

[I]0-i was called on the morrow out of a late and troubled slumber by a knocking on [my]0-i door , ran to open it , and had almost swooned with the contrariety of [my]0-i feelings , mostly painful ; for on the threshold , in a rough wraprascal and an extraordinary big laced hat , there stood [James More]181-james .

[I]0-i ought to have been glad perhaps without admixture , for there was a sense in which [the man]3029-the man came like an answer to prayer . [I]0-i had been saying till [my]0-i head was weary that [Catriona]189-catriona and [I]0-i must separate , and looking till [my]0-i head ached for any possible means of separation . Here were the means come to [me]0-i upon two legs , and joy was the hindmost of [my]0-i thoughts . It is to be considered , however , that even if the weight of the future were lifted off [me]0-i by [the man]3029-the man s arrival , the present heaved up the more black and menacing ; so that , as [I]0-i first stood before [him]3029-the man in [my]0-i shirt and breeches , [I]0-i believe [I]0-i took a leaping step backward like [a person shot]2554-a person shot .

So saying [he]3029-the man passed [me]0-i by , and [I]0-i must own [the tall old rogue]2555-the tall old rogue appeared at that moment extraordinary dignified . [He]3029-the man had now , for the first time , the view of [[my]0-i chamber]2556-my chamber , which [I]0-i scanned [I]0-i may say with [his]3029-the man eyes . A bit of morning sun glinted in by the window pane , and showed it off ; [my]0-i bed , [my]0-i mails , and washing dish , with some disorder of [my]0-i clothes , and the unlighted chimney , made the only plenishing ; no mistake but [it]2556-my chamber looked bare and cold , and the most unsuitable , beggarly place conceivable to harbour [a young lady]2557-a young lady . At the same time came in on [my]0-i mind the recollection of the clothes that [I]0-i had bought for [her]2557-a young lady ; and [I]0-i thought this contrast of poverty and prodigality bore an ill appearance .

[He]3029-the man looked all about [the chamber]736-the chamber for a seat , and finding nothing else to [his]3029-the man purpose except [my]0-i bed , took a place upon the side of [it]736-the chamber ; where , after [I]0-i had closed the door , [I]0-i could not very well avoid joining [him]3029-the man . For however this extraordinary interview might end , it must pass if possible without waking [Catriona]189-catriona ; and the one thing needful was that [we]2559-we should sit close and talk low . But [I]0-i can scarce picture what a pair [we]2559-we made ; [he]3029-the man in [his]3029-the man great coat which the coldness of [[my]0-i chamber]2556-my chamber made extremely suitable ; [I]0-i shivering in [my]0-i shirt and breeks ; [he]3029-the man with very much the air of [a judge]2561-a judge ; and [I]0-i whatever [I]0-i looked with very much the feelings of [a man who has heard the last trumpet]2562-a man who has heard the last trumpet .

" Well ? "[3029-the man] says [he]3029-the man .

And " Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i began , but found [myself]0-i unable to go further .

" [You]0-i tell [me]3029-the man [she]4627-she is here ? "[3029-the man] said [he]3029-the man again , but now with a spice of impatience that seemed to brace [me]0-i up .

" [She]4627-she is in [this house]4628-this house , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and [I]0-i knew the circumstance would be called unusual . But [you]0-i are to consider how very unusual the whole business was from the beginning . Here is [a young lady]2557-a young lady landed on [the coast of [Europe]67-europe]4630-the coast of europe with two shillings and a penny halfpenny . [She]4627-she is directed to [yon man Sprott in [Helvoet]148-helvoet]4631-yon man sprott in helvoet . [I]0-i hear [you]0-i call [him]3029-the man [[your]0-i agent]4632-your agent . [He]2567-i seemed to soothe [me]0-i with a hand in the air . " There , there , "[2567-i] said [he]2567-i . " [You]0-i go too fast , [you]0-i go too fast , [Mr. Balfour]222-davie . "[0-i]

[I]2567-i have ate too often at a dyke - side , drank of [the ditch]4668-the ditch , and had no roof but the rain . "[2567-i]

" [I]0-i should be telling [you]2567-i , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that [our]4669-our breakfasts are sent customarily in about this time of morning . "[2567-i]

" [I]0-i shall make it [my]0-i business to see [you]2567-i are supplied , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i
