By this time , [I]0-i can hardly say that [I]0-i was minding [him]2567-i at all , beyond an odd thought of the kind of father - in - law that [he]2567-i was like to prove ; and all [my]0-i cares centred about [the lass [[his]2567-i daughter]2999-his daughter , to whom [I]0-i determined to convey some warning of [[her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor visitor]2574-her visitor]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor . "[0-i]

With that [I]0-i went forth upon [my]0-i errand , having by two words extraordinarily damaged [my]0-i affairs .

CHAPTER XXVI THE THREESOME

Whether or not [I]0-i was to be so much blamed , or rather perhaps pitied , [I]0-i must leave [others]1700-others to judge . [My]0-i shrewdness of which [I]0-i have a good deal , too seems not so great with [the ladies]738-the ladies . No doubt , at the moment when [I]0-i awaked [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor , [I]0-i was thinking a good deal of the effect upon [James More]181-james ; and similarly when [I]0-i returned and [we]2577-we were all sat down to breakfast , [I]0-i continued to behave to [the young lady]3012-the young lady with deference and distance ; as [I]0-i still think to have been most wise . [[Her]3012-the young lady father]760-her father had cast doubts upon the innocence of [my]0-i friendship ; and these , it was [my]0-i first business to allay . But there is a kind of an excuse for [Catriona]189-catriona also . [We]2577-we had shared in a scene of some tenderness and passion , and given and received caresses : [I]0-i had thrust [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor from [me]0-i with violence ; [I]0-i had called aloud upon [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor in the night from the [one room]2580-one room to the other ; [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor had passed hours of wakefulness and weeping ; and it is not to be supposed [I]0-i had been absent from [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor pillow thoughts . Upon the back of this , to be awaked , with unaccustomed formality , under the name of [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond , and to be thenceforth used with a great deal of distance and respect , led [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor entirely in error on [my]0-i private sentiments ; and [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor was indeed so incredibly abused as to imagine [me]0-i repentant and trying to draw off !

The trouble betwixt [us]2577-we seems to have been this : that whereas [I]0-i since [I]0-i had first set eyes on [his]2581-his great hat thought singly of [James More]181-james , [his]2581-his return and suspicions , [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor made so little of these that [I]0-i may say [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor scarce remarked them , and all [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor troubles and doings regarded what had passed between [us]2577-we in the night before . This is partly to be explained by the innocence and boldness of [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor character ; and partly because [James More]181-james , having sped so ill in [his]181-james interview with [me]0-i , or had [his]181-james mouth closed by [my]0-i invitation , said no word to [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor upon the subject . At the breakfast , accordingly , it soon appeared [we]2577-we were at cross purposes . [I]0-i had looked to find [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor in clothes of [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor own : [I]0-i found [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor as if [[her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor father]760-her father were forgotten wearing some of the best that [I]0-i had bought for [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor , and which [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor knew or thought that [I]0-i admired [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor in . [I]0-i had looked to find [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor imitate [my]0-i affectation of distance , and be most precise and formal ; instead [I]0-i found [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor flushed and wild - like , with eyes extraordinary bright , and a painful and varying expression , calling [me]0-i by name with a sort of appeal of tenderness , and referring and deferring to [my]0-i thoughts and wishes like [an anxious or a suspected wife]2583-an anxious or a suspected wife .

But this was not for long . As [I]0-i behold [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor so regardless of [her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor own interests , which [I]0-i had jeopardised and was now endeavouring to recover , [I]0-i redoubled [my]0-i own coldness in the manner of a lesson to [the girl]517-the girl . The more [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor came forward , the farther [I]0-i drew back ; the more [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor betrayed the closeness of [our]2585-our intimacy , the more pointedly civil [I]0-i became , until even [[her]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor father]760-her father if [he]760-her father had not been so engrossed with eating might have observed the opposition . In the midst of which , of a sudden , [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor became wholly changed , and [I]0-i told [myself]0-i , with a good deal of relief , that [she]2572-the lass his daughter , to whom i determined to convey some warning of her visitor had took the hint at last .

All day [I]0-i was at [my]0-i classes or in quest of [[my]0-i new lodging]585-my new lodging ; and though the hour of [our]2585-our customary walk hung miserably on [my]0-i hands , [I]0-i can not say but [I]0-i was happy on the whole to find [my]0-i way cleared , [the girl]517-the girl again in proper keeping , [the father]885-the father satisfied or at least acquiescent , and [myself]0-i free to prosecute [my]0-i love with honour . At supper , as at all [our]2585-our meals , it was [James More]181-james that did the talking . No doubt but [he]181-james talked well if [anyone]3224-anyone could have believed [him]181-james . But [I]0-i will speak of [him]181-james presently more at large . The meal at an end , [he]181-james rose , got [his]181-james great coat , and looking as [I]0-i thought at [me]0-i , observed [he]181-james had affairs abroad . [I]0-i took this for a hint that [I]0-i was to be going also , and got up ; whereupon [the girl]517-the girl , who had scarce given [me]0-i greeting at [my]0-i entrance , turned [her]517-the girl eyes upon [me]0-i wide open with a look that bade [me]0-i stay . [I]0-i stood between [them]2592-them like a fish out of water , turning from one to the other ; [neither]2593-neither seemed to observe [me]0-i , [she]517-the girl gazing on the floor , [he]181-james buttoning [his]181-james coat : which vastly swelled [my]0-i embarrassment . This appearance of indifference argued , upon [her]517-the girl side , a good deal of anger very near to burst out . Upon [his]181-james , [I]0-i thought it horribly alarming ; [I]0-i made sure there was a tempest brewing there ; and considering that to be [the chief peril]2594-the chief peril , turned towards [him]181-james and put [myself]0-i so to speak in [the man]3029-the man s hands .

" Can [I]0-i do anything for [you]181-james , [Mr. Drummond]371-mr. drummond ? "[0-i] says [I.]0-i

[He]181-james stifled a yawn , which again [I]0-i thought to be duplicity . " Why , [Mr. David]222-davie , "[181-james] said [he]181-james , " since [you]222-davie are so obliging as to propose it , [you]222-davie might show [me]181-james the way to [a certain tavern]4678-a certain tavern "[181-james] of which [he]181-james gave the name " where [I]181-james hope to fall in with [some old companions in arms]4679-some old companions in arms . "[181-james]

There was no more to say , and [I]0-i got [my]0-i hat and cloak to bear [him]181-james company .

" And as for [you]2999-his daughter , "[181-james] say [he]181-james to [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter , " [you]2999-his daughter had best go to [your]2999-his daughter bed . [I]181-james shall be late [home]658-home , and Early to bed and early to rise , [gars bonny lasses]4681-gars bonny lasses have bright eyes . "[181-james]

Whereupon [he]181-james kissed [her]2999-his daughter with a good deal of tenderness , and ushered [me]0-i before [him]181-james from the door . This was so done [I]0-i thought on purpose that it was scarce possible there should be any parting salutation ; but [I]0-i observed [she]2999-his daughter did not look at [me]0-i , and set it down to terror of [James More]181-james .

It was some distance to [that tavern]2597-that tavern . [He]181-james talked all the way of matters which did not interest [me]0-i the smallest , and at the door dismissed [me]0-i with empty manners . Thence [I]0-i walked to [[my]0-i new lodging]585-my new lodging , where [I]0-i had not so much as a chimney to hold [me]0-i warm , and no society but [my]0-i own thoughts . These were still bright enough ; [I]0-i did not so much as dream that [Catriona]189-catriona was turned against [me]0-i ; [I]0-i thought [we]2599-we were like [folk pledged]2600-folk pledged ; [I]0-i thought [we]2599-we had been too near and spoke too warmly to be severed , least of all by what were only steps in a most needful policy . And [the chief of]2601-the chief of [my]0-i concern was only the kind of father - in - law that [I]0-i was getting , which was not at all the kind [I]0-i would have chosen : and the matter of how soon [I]0-i ought to speak to [him]2602-him , which was a delicate point on several sides . In the first place , when [I]0-i thought how young [I]0-i was [I]0-i blushed all over , and could almost have found it in [my]0-i heart to have desisted ; only that if once [I]0-i let [them]2603-them go from [Leyden]74-leyden without explanation , [I]0-i might lose [her]74-leyden altogether . And in the second place , there was [our]2599-we very irregular situation to be kept in view , and the rather scant measure of satisfaction [I]0-i had given [James More]181-james that morning . [I]0-i concluded , on the whole , that delay would not hurt anything , yet [I]0-i would not delay too long neither ; and got to [my]0-i cold bed with a full heart .

The next day , as [James More]181-james seemed a little on the complaining hand in the matter of [[my]0-i chamber]2556-my chamber , [I]0-i offered to have in more furniture ; and coming in the afternoon , with [porters bringing chairs and tables]2605-porters bringing chairs and tables , found [the girl]517-the girl once more left to [herself]517-the girl . [She]517-the girl greeted [me]0-i on [my]0-i admission civilly , but withdrew at once to [[her]517-the girl own room]2607-her own room , of which [she]517-the girl shut the door . [I]0-i made [my]0-i disposition , and paid and dismissed [the men]3722-the men so that [she]517-the girl might hear [them]3722-the men go , when [I]0-i supposed [she]517-the girl would at once come forth again to speak to [me]0-i . [I]0-i waited yet awhile , then knocked upon [her]517-the girl door .

" [Catriona]189-catriona ! "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

The door was opened so quickly , even before [I]0-i had the word out , that [I]0-i thought [she]517-the girl must have stood behind [it]2609-it listening . [She]517-the girl remained there in the interval quite still ; but [she]517-the girl had a look that [I]0-i can not put a name on , as of one in a bitter trouble .

" Are [we]4682-we not to have [our]4682-we walk to - day either ? "[517-the girl] so [I]0-i faltered .

" [I]517-the girl am thanking [you]0-i , "[517-the girl] said [she]517-the girl . " [I]517-the girl will not be caring much to walk , now that [[my]517-the girl father]417-my father is come [home]658-home . "[517-the girl]

" But [I]0-i think [he]417-my father has gone out [himself]417-my father and left [you]517-the girl here alone , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" And do [you]0-i think that was very kindly said ? "[517-the girl] [she]517-the girl asked .

" It was not unkindly meant , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " What ails [you]517-the girl , [Catriona]189-catriona ? What have [I]0-i done to [you]517-the girl that [you]517-the girl should turn from [me]0-i like this ? "[0-i]

" [I]517-the girl do not turn from [you]0-i at all , "[517-the girl] [she]517-the girl said , speaking very carefully . " [I]517-the girl will ever be grateful to [[my]517-the girl friend]3036-my friend that was good to [me]517-the girl ; [I]517-the girl will ever be [[his]3036-my friend friend]4686-his friend in all that [I]517-the girl am able . But now that [[my]517-the girl father]417-my father James More is come again , there is a difference to be made , and [I]517-the girl think there are some things said and done that would be better to be forgotten . But [I]517-the girl will ever be [[your]517-the girl friend]2987-your friend in all that [I]517-the girl am able , and if that is not all that . . . . if it is not so much . . . . Not that [you]517-the girl will be caring ! But [I]517-the girl would not have [you]517-the girl think of [me]517-the girl too hard . It was true what [you]517-the girl said to [me]517-the girl , that [I]517-the girl was too young to be advised , and [I]517-the girl am hoping [you]517-the girl will remember [I]517-the girl was just [a child]808-a child . [I]517-the girl would not like to lose [your]517-the girl friendship , at all events . "[517-the girl]

[She]2610-her began this very pale ; but before [she]2610-her was done , the blood was in [her]2610-her face like scarlet , so that not [her]2610-her words only , but [her]2610-her face and the trembling of [her]2610-her very hands , besought [me]0-i to be gentle . [I]0-i saw , for the first time , how very wrong [I]0-i had done to place [the child]2611-the child in that position , where [she]2611-the child had been entrapped into a moment s weakness , and now stood before [me]0-i like [a person shamed]2612-a person shamed .

" [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and stuck , and made the same beginning once again , " [I]0-i wish [you]193-miss drummond could see into [my]0-i heart , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " [You]193-miss drummond would read there that [my]0-i respect is undiminished . If that were possible , [I]0-i should say it was increased . This is but the result of the mistake [we]4690-we made ; and had to come ; and the less said of it now the better . Of all of [our]4690-we life here , [I]0-i promise [you]193-miss drummond it shall never pass [my]0-i lips ; [I]0-i would like to promise [you]193-miss drummond too that [I]0-i would never think of it , but it s a memory that will be always dear to [me]0-i . And as for [a friend]461-a friend , [you]193-miss drummond have one here that would die for [you]193-miss drummond . "[0-i]

" [I]2613-her am thanking [you]0-i , "[2613-her] said [she]2613-her .

[We]2614-we stood awhile silent , and [my]0-i sorrow for [myself]0-i began to get the upper hand ; for here were all [my]0-i dreams come to a sad tumble , and [my]0-i love lost , and [myself]0-i alone again in [the world]3073-the world as at the beginning .

" Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [we]2614-we shall be [friends]444-friends always , that s a certain thing . But this is a kind of farewell , too : it s a kind of a farewell after all ; [I]0-i shall always ken [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond , but this is a farewell to [[my]0-i Catriona]4693-my catriona . "[0-i]

[I]0-i looked at [her]2613-her ; [I]0-i could hardly say [I]0-i saw [her]2613-her , but [she]2613-her seemed to grow great and brighten in [my]0-i eyes ; and with that [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must have lost [my]0-i head , for [I]0-i called out [her]2613-her name again and made a step at [her]2613-her with [my]0-i hands reached forth .

[She]2613-her shrank back like [a person struck]2616-a person struck , [her]2613-her face flamed ; but the blood sprang no faster up into [her]2613-her cheeks , than what it flowed back upon [my]0-i own heart , at sight of it , with penitence and concern . [I]0-i found no words to excuse [myself]0-i , but bowed before [her]2613-her very deep , and went [my]0-i ways out of [the house]818-the house with death in [my]0-i bosom .

[I]0-i think it was about five days that followed without any change . [I]0-i saw [her]2613-her scarce ever but at meals , and then of course in the company of [James More]181-james . If [we]2618-we were alone even for a moment , [I]0-i made it [my]0-i devoir to behave the more distantly and to multiply respectful attentions , having always in [my]0-i mind s eye that picture of [the girl]517-the girl shrinking and flaming in a blush , and in [my]0-i heart more pity for [her]2613-her than [I]0-i could depict in words . [I]0-i was sorry enough for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i need not dwell on that , having fallen all [my]0-i length and more than all [my]0-i height in a few seconds ; but , indeed , [I]0-i was near as sorry for [the girl]517-the girl , and sorry enough to be scarce angry with [her]2613-her save by fits and starts . [Her]2613-her plea was good ; [she]2613-her had been placed in an unfair position ; if [she]2613-her had deceived [herself]2613-her and [me]0-i , it was no more than was to have been looked for .

And for another thing [she]2613-her was now very much alone . [[Her]2613-her father]760-her father , when [he]760-her father was by , was rather [a caressing parent]2622-a caressing parent ; but [he]760-her father was very easy led away by [his]760-her father affairs and pleasures , neglected [her]2613-her without compunction or remark , spent [his]760-her father nights in [taverns]2623-taverns when [he]760-her father had the money , which was more often than [I]0-i could at all account for ; and even in the course of these few days , failed once to come to a meal , which [Catriona]189-catriona and [I]0-i were at last compelled to partake of without [him]760-her father . It was the evening meal , and [I]0-i left immediately that [I]0-i had eaten , observing [I]0-i supposed [she]2613-her would prefer to be alone ; to which [she]2613-her agreed and strange as it may seem [I]0-i quite believed [her]2613-her . Indeed , [I]0-i thought [myself]0-i but an eyesore to [the girl]517-the girl , and a reminder of a moment s weakness that [she]2613-her now abhorred to think of . So [she]2613-her must sit alone in [that room where [she]2613-her and [I]0-i had been so merry , and in the blink of that chimney whose light had shone upon [our]2626-our many difficult and tender moments]2625-that room where she and i had been so merry , and in the blink of that chimney whose light had shone upon our many difficult and tender moments . There [she]2613-her must sit alone , and think of [herself]2613-her as of [a maid who had most unmaidenly proffered [her]2627-a maid who had most unmaidenly proffered her affections and had the same rejected affections and had the same rejected]2627-a maid who had most unmaidenly proffered her affections and had the same rejected . And in the meanwhile [I]0-i would be alone [some other place]2628-some other place , and reading [myself]0-i whenever [I]0-i was tempted to be angry lessons upon human frailty and female delicacy . And altogether [I]0-i suppose there were [never two poor fools]2629-never two poor fools made [themselves]2629-never two poor fools more unhappy in a greater misconception .

As for [James]181-james , [he]181-james paid not so much heed to [us]2626-our , or to anything in nature but [his]181-james pocket , and [his]181-james belly , and [his]181-james own prating talk . Before twelve hours were gone [he]181-james had raised a small loan of [me]0-i ; before thirty , [he]181-james had asked for a second and been refused . Money and refusal [he]181-james took with the same kind of high good nature . Indeed , [he]181-james had an outside air of magnanimity that was very well fitted to impose upon [a daughter]2630-a daughter ; and the light in which [he]181-james was constantly presented in [his]181-james talk , and [the man]3029-the man s fine presence and great ways went together pretty harmoniously . So that [a man that had no business with [him]181-james , and either very little penetration or a furious deal of prejudice]2632-a man that had no business with him , and either very little penetration or a furious deal of prejudice , might almost have been taken in . To [me]0-i , after [my]0-i first two interviews , [he]181-james was as plain as print ; [I]0-i saw [him]181-james to be perfectly selfish , with a perfect innocency in the same ; and [I]0-i would hearken to [his]181-james swaggering talk of arms , and " [an old soldier]4667-an old soldier , "[181-james] and " [a poor Highland gentleman]4695-a poor highland gentleman , "[181-james] and " the strength of [my]0-i country and [[my]0-i friends]3075-my friends "[0-i] as [I]0-i might to the babbling of a parrot .

The odd thing was that [I]0-i fancy [he]181-james believed some part of it [himself]181-james , or did at times ; [I]0-i think [he]181-james was so false all through that [he]181-james scarce knew when [he]181-james was lying ; and for one thing , [his]181-james moments of dejection must have been wholly genuine . There were times when [he]181-james would be the most silent , affectionate , clinging creature possible , holding [Catriona]189-catriona s hand like [a big baby]2633-a big baby , and begging of [me]0-i not to leave if [I]0-i had any love to [him]181-james ; of which , indeed , [I]0-i had none , but all the more to [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter . [He]181-james would press and indeed beseech [us]2635-our to entertain [him]181-james with [our]2635-our talk , a thing very difficult in the state of [our]2635-our relations ; and again break forth in pitiable regrets for [[his]181-james own land]2636-his own land and [friends]444-friends , or into Gaelic singing .

" This is one of the melancholy airs of [[my]181-james native land]4697-my native land , "[181-james] [he]181-james would say . " [You]4698-you may think it strange to see [a soldier]3320-a soldier weep , and indeed it is to make [a near friend of [you]4698-you]4700-a near friend of you , "[181-james] says [he]181-james . " But the notes of this singing are in [my]181-james blood , and the words come out of [my]181-james heart . And when [I]181-james mind upon [[my]181-james red mountains]4701-my red mountains and the wild birds calling there , and the brave streams of water running down , [I]181-james would scarce think shame to weep before [[my]181-james enemies]3321-my enemies . "[181-james] Then [he]181-james would sing again , and translate to [me]0-i pieces of the song , with a great deal of boggling and much expressed contempt against the English language . " It says here , "[181-james] [he]181-james would say , " that the sun is gone down , and the battle is at an end , and [the brave chiefs]4703-the brave chiefs are defeated . And it tells here how the stars see [them]4703-the brave chiefs fleeing into [strange countries]4704-strange countries or lying dead on [the red mountain]4705-the red mountain ; and [they]4703-the brave chiefs will never more shout the call of battle or wash [their]4703-the brave chiefs feet in [the streams of [the valley]1086-the valley]4706-the streams of the valley . But if [you]4708-you had only some of this language , [you]4708-you would weep also because the words of it are beyond all expression , and it is mere mockery to tell [you]4708-you it in English . "[181-james]

Well , [I]0-i thought there was a good deal of mockery in the business , one way and another ; and yet , there was some feeling too , for which [I]0-i hated [him]181-james , [I]0-i think , the worst of all . And it used to cut [me]0-i to the quick to see [Catriona]189-catriona so much concerned for [the old rogue]2638-the old rogue , and weeping [herself]189-catriona to see [him]181-james weep , when [I]0-i was sure one half of [his]181-james distress flowed from [his]181-james last night s drinking in [some tavern]2639-some tavern . There were times when [I]0-i was tempted to lend [him]181-james a round sum , and see the last of [him]181-james for good ; but this would have been to see the last of [Catriona]189-catriona as well , for which [I]0-i was scarcely so prepared ; and besides , it went against [my]0-i conscience to squander [my]0-i good money on [one who was so little of [a husband]2641-a husband]2640-one who was so little of a husband .

CHAPTER XXVII A TWOSOME

[I]0-i believe it was about the fifth day , and [I]0-i know at least that [James]181-james was in one of [his]181-james fits of gloom , when [I]0-i received three letters . The first was from [Alan]185-alan , offering to visit [me]0-i in [Leyden]74-leyden ; the other two were out of [Scotland]182-prestongrange and prompted by the same affair , which was the death of [[my]0-i uncle]3436-my uncle and [my]0-i own complete accession to [my]0-i rights . [Rankeillor]176-rankeillor s was , of course , wholly in the business view ; [Miss Grant]234-miss grant s was like [herself]234-miss grant , a little more witty than wise , full of blame to [me]0-i for not having written though how was [I]0-i to write with such intelligence ? and of rallying talk about [Catriona]189-catriona , which it cut [me]0-i to the quick to read in [her]189-catriona very presence .

For it was of course in [[my]0-i own rooms]2643-my own rooms that [I]0-i found them , when [I]0-i came to dinner , so that [I]0-i was surprised out of [my]0-i news in the very first moment of reading it . This made a welcome diversion for [all three of [us]2644-all three of us]2644-all three of us , nor could any have foreseen the ill consequences that ensued . It was accident that brought the three letters the same day , and that gave them into [my]0-i hand in [the same room]2498-the same room with [James More]181-james ; and of all the events that flowed from that accident , and which [I]0-i might have prevented if [I]0-i had held [my]0-i tongue , the truth is that they were preordained before [Agricola]383-agricola came into [Scotland]182-prestongrange or [Abraham]384-abraham set out upon [his]384-abraham travels .

The first that [I]0-i opened was naturally [Alan]185-alan s ; and what more natural than that [I]0-i should comment on [his]185-alan design to visit [me]0-i ? but [I]0-i observed [James]181-james to sit up with an air of immediate attention .

" Is that not [Alan Breck]185-alan that was suspected of the Appin accident ? "[181-james] [he]181-james inquired .

[I]0-i told [him]181-james , " Ay , "[0-i] it was the same ; and [he]181-james withheld [me]0-i some time from [my]0-i other letters , asking of [our]2646-our acquaintance , of [Alan]185-alan s manner of life in [France]50-france , of which [I]0-i knew very little , and further of [his]185-alan visit as now proposed .

" All [we]2646-our forfeited [folk]441-folk hang a little together , "[181-james] [he]181-james explained , " and besides [I]181-james know [the gentleman]4710-the gentleman : and though [his]4710-the gentleman descent is not the thing , and indeed [he]4710-the gentleman has no true right to use the name of [Stewart]185-alan , [he]4710-the gentleman was very much admired in the day of [Drummossie]229-drummossie . [He]4710-the gentleman did there like [a soldier]3320-a soldier ; if [some that need not be named]4712-some that need not be named had done as well , [the upshot]4713-the upshot need not have been so melancholy to remember . There were two that did [their]2647-their best that day , and it makes a bond between the pair of [us]4714-us , "[181-james] says [he]181-james .

[I]0-i could scarce refrain from shooting out [my]0-i tongue at [him]181-james , and could almost have wished that [Alan]185-alan had been there to have inquired a little further into that mention of [his]185-alan birth . Though , [they]2647-their tell [me]0-i , the same was indeed not wholly regular .

Meanwhile , [I]0-i had opened [Miss Grant]234-miss grant s , and could not withhold an exclamation .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , forgetting , the first time since [[her]234-miss grant father]760-her father was arrived , to address [her]234-miss grant by a handle , " [I]0-i am come into [[my]0-i kingdom]4715-my kingdom fairly , [I]0-i am [the laird of [Shaws]222-davie]3435-the laird of shaws indeed [[my]0-i uncle]3436-my uncle is dead at last . "[0-i]

[She]234-miss grant clapped [her]234-miss grant hands together leaping from [her]234-miss grant seat . The next moment it must have come over [both of [us]1095-both of us]1095-both of us at once what little cause of joy was left to either , and [we]1095-both of us stood opposite , staring on [each other]2951-each other sadly .

But [James]181-james showed [himself]181-james [a ready hypocrite]2651-a ready hypocrite . " [[My]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter , "[181-james] says [he]181-james , " is this how [[my]181-james cousin]3098-my cousin learned [you]4622-my daughter to behave ? [Mr. David]222-davie has lost [a new friend]4720-a new friend , and [we]1095-both of us should first condole with [him]4720-a new friend on [his]4720-a new friend bereavement . "[181-james]

" [Troth]266-troth , [sir]3021-sir , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , turning to [him]181-james in a kind of anger , " [I]0-i can make no such great faces . [His]4720-a new friend death is as blithe news as ever [I]0-i got . "[0-i]

" It s a good soldier s philosophy , "[181-james] says [James]181-james . " Tis the way of flesh , [we]1095-both of us must all go , all go . And if [the gentleman]4710-the gentleman was so far from [your]4622-my daughter favour , why , very well ! But [we]1095-both of us may at least congratulate [you]4622-my daughter on [your]4622-my daughter accession to [[your]4622-my daughter estates]4723-your estates . "[181-james]

" Nor can [I]0-i say that either , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , with the same heat . " It is [a good estate]4724-a good estate ; what matters that to [a lone man that has enough already]4725-a lone man that has enough already ? [I]0-i had a good revenue before in [my]0-i frugality ; and but for [the man]3029-the man s death which gratifies [me]0-i , shame to [me]0-i that must confess it ! [I]0-i see not how [anyone]3224-anyone is to be bettered by this change . "[0-i]

" Come , come , "[181-james] said [he]181-james , " [you]4622-my daughter are more affected than [you]4622-my daughter let on , or [you]4622-my daughter would never make [yourself]4622-my daughter out so lonely . Here are three letters ; that means three that wish [you]4622-my daughter well ; and [I]181-james could name two more , here in [this very chamber]4728-this very chamber . [I]181-james have known [you]4622-my daughter not so very long , but [Catriona]189-catriona , when [we]4729-we are alone , is never done with the singing of [your]4622-my daughter praises . "[181-james]

[She]2652-she looked up at [him]181-james , a little wild at that ; and [he]181-james slid off at once into another matter , the extent of [my]0-i estate , which during the most of the dinner time [he]181-james continued to dwell upon with interest . But it was to no purpose [he]181-james dissembled ; [he]181-james had touched the matter with too gross a hand : and [I]0-i knew what to expect . Dinner was scarce ate when [he]181-james plainly discovered [his]181-james designs . [He]181-james reminded [Catriona]189-catriona of an errand , and bid [her]2652-she attend to it . " [I]181-james do not see [you]189-catriona should be [one beyond the hour]4730-one beyond the hour , "[181-james] [he]181-james added , " and [friend [David]222-davie]4731-friend david will be good enough to bear [me]181-james company till [you]189-catriona return . "[181-james] [She]189-catriona made haste to obey [him]181-james without words . [I]0-i do not know if [she]189-catriona understood , [I]0-i believe not ; but [I]0-i was completely satisfied , and sat strengthening [my]0-i mind for what should follow .

The door had scarce closed behind [her]189-catriona departure , when [the man]3029-the man leaned back in [his]3029-the man chair and addressed [me]0-i with a good affectation of easiness . Only the one thing betrayed [him]3029-the man , and that was [his]3029-the man face ; which suddenly shone all over with fine points of sweat .

" [I]181-james am rather glad to have a word alone with [you]189-catriona , "[181-james] says [he]181-james , " because in [our]4732-our first interview there were some expressions [you]189-catriona misapprehended and [I]181-james have long meant to set [you]189-catriona right upon . [[My]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter stands beyond doubt . So do [you]189-catriona , and [I]181-james would make that good with [my]181-james sword against [all gainsayers]4734-all gainsayers . But , [[my]181-james dear]3481-my dear [David]222-davie , [this world]3509-this world is a censorious place as who should know it better than [myself]181-james , who have lived ever since the days of [[my]181-james late departed father]4737-my late departed father , [God]223-god sain [him]4737-my late departed father ! in a perfect spate of calumnies ? [We]4738-we have to face to that ; [you]189-catriona and [me]181-james have to consider of that ; [we]4738-we have to consider of that . "[181-james] And [he]2654-i wagged [his]2654-i head like [a minister in a pulpit]2655-a minister in a pulpit .

" To what effect , [Mr. Drummond]371-mr. drummond ? "[2656-i.] said [I.]2656-i. " [I]2656-i. would be obliged to [you]2654-i if [you]2654-i would approach [your]2654-i point . "[2656-i.]

" Ay , ay , "[2654-i] said [he]2654-i , laughing , " like [your]189-catriona character , indeed ! and what [I]2654-i most admire in it . But the point , [[my]2654-i worthy fellow]4739-my worthy fellow , is sometimes in a kittle bit . "[2654-i] [He]2654-i filled a glass of wine . " Though between [you]189-catriona and [me]2654-i , that are [such fast friends]4740-such fast friends , it need not bother [us]4738-we long . The point , [I]2654-i need scarcely tell [you]189-catriona , is [[my]2654-i daughter]4622-my daughter . And the first thing is that [I]2654-i have no thought in [my]2654-i mind of blaming [you]189-catriona . In the unfortunate circumstances , what could [you]189-catriona do else ? Deed , and [I]2654-i can not tell . "[2654-i]

" [I]0-i thank [you]2654-i for that , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , pretty close upon [my]0-i guard .

" [I]2654-i have besides studied [your]189-catriona character , "[2654-i] [he]2654-i went on ; " [your]189-catriona talents are fair ; [you]189-catriona seem to have a moderate competence , which does no harm ; and one thing with another , [I]2654-i am very happy to have to announce to [you]189-catriona that [I]2654-i have decided on the latter of the two ways open . "[2654-i]

" [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i am dull , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " What ways are these ? "[2654-i]

CHAPTER XXVIII IN WHICH [I]0-i AM LEFT ALONE

[I]0-i opened the door to [Catriona]189-catriona and stopped [her]189-catriona on the threshold .

" [[Your]189-catriona father]3247-your father wishes [us]2668-we to take [our]2668-we walk , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

[She]189-catriona looked to [James More]181-james , who nodded , and at that , like [a trained soldier]2671-a trained soldier , [she]189-catriona turned to go with [me]0-i .

[We]2668-we took one of [our]2668-we old ways , where [we]2668-we had gone often together , and been more happy than [I]0-i can tell of in the past . [I]0-i came a half a step behind , so that [I]0-i could watch [her]189-catriona unobserved . The knocking of [her]189-catriona little shoes upon the way sounded extraordinary pretty and sad ; and [I]0-i thought it a strange moment that [I]0-i should be so near both ends of it at once , and walk in the midst between two destinies , and could not tell whether [I]0-i was hearing these steps for the last time , or whether the sound of them was to go in and out with [me]0-i till death should part [us]2668-we .

[She]189-catriona avoided even to look at [me]0-i , only walked before [her]189-catriona , like [one who had a guess of what was coming]2672-one who had a guess of what was coming . [I]0-i saw [I]0-i must speak soon before [my]0-i courage was run out , but where to begin [I]0-i knew not . In this painful situation , when [the girl]517-the girl was as good as forced into [my]0-i arms and had already besought [my]0-i forbearance , any excess of pressure must have seemed indecent ; yet to avoid it wholly would have a very cold - like appearance . Between these extremes [I]0-i stood helpless , and could have bit [my]0-i fingers ; so that , when at last [I]0-i managed to speak at all , it may be said [I]0-i spoke at random .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i am in a very painful situation ; or rather , so [we]4778-we are both ; and [I]0-i would be a good deal obliged to [you]189-catriona if [you]189-catriona would promise to let [me]0-i speak through first of all , and not to interrupt [me]0-i till [I]0-i have done . "[0-i]

[She]517-the girl promised [me]0-i that simply .

" Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " this that [I]0-i have got to say is very difficult , and [I]0-i know very well [I]0-i have no right to be saying it . After what passed between the two of [us]4778-we last Friday , [I]0-i have no manner of right . [We]4778-we have got so ravelled up and all by [my]0-i fault that [I]0-i know very well the least [I]0-i could do is just to hold [my]0-i tongue , which was what [I]0-i intended fully , and there was nothing further from [my]0-i thoughts than to have troubled [you]189-catriona again . But , [[my]0-i dear]3481-my dear , it has become merely necessary , and no way by it . [You]189-catriona see , [this estate of [mine]0-i]4780-this estate of mine has fallen in , which makes of [me]0-i rather a better match ; and the the business would not have quite the same ridiculous - like appearance that it would before . Besides which , it s supposed that [our]4778-we affairs have got so much ravelled up as [I]0-i was saying that it would be better to let [them]4781-them be the way they are . In [my]0-i view , this part of the thing is vastly exagerate , and if [I]0-i were [you]189-catriona [I]0-i would not wear two thoughts on it . Only it s right [I]0-i should mention the same , because there s no doubt it has some influence on [James]181-james More . Then [I]0-i think [we]4778-we were none so unhappy when [we]4778-we dwelt together in [this town]4782-this town before . [I]0-i think [we]4778-we did pretty well together . If [you]2674-you would look back , [[my]0-i dear]3481-my dear "[0-i]

[Me]2679-she and [mine]2679-she , "[2679-she] [she]2679-she gave a kind of a wretched cry at the word " [me]2679-she and [mine]2679-she are not fit to speak to [you]222-davie . " [I]2680-i will keep the kisses [I]2680-i have got from [you]2679-she already , "[2680-i] cried [I.]2680-i " [I]2680-i will keep the ones [I]2680-i wanted and that were something worth ; [I]2680-i will not be kissed in penitence . "[2680-i]

" What can [you]0-i be thinking of [this miserable girl]4817-this miserable girl ? "[2679-she] says [she]2679-she .

" What [I]0-i am trying to tell [you]2679-she all this while ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that [you]2679-she had best leave [me]0-i alone , whom [you]2679-she can make no more unhappy if [you]2679-she tried , and turn [your]2679-she attention to [James More]181-james , [[your]2679-she father]3247-your father , with whom [you]2679-she are like to have a queer pirn to wind . "[0-i]

" O , that [I]2679-she must be going out into [the world]3073-the world alone with [such a man]4820-such a man ! "[2679-she] [she]2679-she cried , and seemed to catch [herself]2679-she in with a great effort . " But trouble [yourself]0-i no more for that , "[2679-she] said [she]2679-she . " [He]4820-such a man does not know what kind of nature is in [my]2679-she heart . [He]4820-such a man will pay [me]2679-she dear for this day of it ; dear , [dear]3748-dear , will [he]4820-such a man pay . "[2679-she]

[She]2679-she turned , and began to go [home]658-home and [I]0-i to accompany [her]2679-she . At which [she]2679-she stopped .

" [I]2679-she will be going alone , "[2679-she] [she]2679-she said . " It is alone [I]2679-she must be seeing [him]4820-such a man . "[2679-she]

Some little time [I]0-i raged about [the streets]4148-the streets , and told [myself]0-i [I]0-i was [the worst used lad in [Christendom]160-christendom]2683-the worst used lad in christendom . Anger choked [me]0-i ; it was all very well for [me]0-i to breathe deep ; it seemed there was not air enough about [Leyden]74-leyden to supply [me]0-i , and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would have burst like [a man at the bottom of the sea]2684-a man at the bottom of the sea . [I]0-i stopped and laughed at [myself]0-i at [a street corner]2685-a street corner a minute together , laughing out loud , so that [a passenger]2686-a passenger looked at [me]0-i , which brought [me]0-i to [myself]0-i .

" Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " [I]0-i have been a gull and [a ninny]4822-a ninny and [a soft Tommy]4823-a soft tommy long enough . Time it was done . Here is a good lesson to have nothing to do with that accursed sex , that was the ruin of [the man]3029-the man in the beginning and will be so to the end . [God]223-god knows [I]0-i was happy enough before ever [I]0-i saw [her]4825-her ; [God]223-god knows [I]0-i can be happy enough again when [I]0-i have seen the last of [her]4825-her . "[0-i]

That seemed to [me]0-i the chief affair : to see [them]2687-them go . [I]0-i dwelled upon the idea fiercely ; and presently slipped on , in a kind of malevolence , to consider how very poorly [they]2687-them were likely to fare when [Davie Balfour]222-davie was no longer by to be [their]2687-them milk - cow ; at which , to [my]0-i very own great surprise , the disposition of [my]0-i mind turned bottom up . [I]0-i was still angry ; [I]0-i still hated [her]2688-her ; and yet [I]0-i thought [I]0-i owed it to [myself]0-i that [she]2688-her should suffer nothing .

This carried [me]0-i [home]658-home again at once , where [I]0-i found the mails drawn out and ready fastened by the door , and [the father]885-the father and [daughter]2119-daughter with every mark upon [them]2687-them of a recent disagreement . [Catriona]189-catriona was like [a wooden doll]2692-a wooden doll ; [James More]181-james breathed hard , [his]181-james face was dotted with white spots , and [his]181-james nose upon one side . As soon as [I]0-i came in , [the girl]517-the girl looked at [him]181-james with a steady , clear , dark look that might have been followed by a blow . It was a hint that was more contemptuous than a command , and [I]0-i was surprised to see [James]181-james More accept it . It was plain [he]181-james had had [a master]2694-a master talking - to ; and [I]0-i could see there must be more of the devil in [the girl]517-the girl than [I]0-i had guessed , and more good humour about [the man]3029-the man than [I]0-i had given [him]3029-the man the credit of .

[He]181-james began , at least , calling [me]0-i [Mr. Balfour]222-davie , and plainly speaking from a lesson ; but [he]181-james got not very far , for at the first pompous swell of [his]181-james voice , [Catriona]189-catriona cut in .

" [I]189-catriona will tell [you]0-i what [James More]181-james is meaning , "[189-catriona] said [she]189-catriona . " [He]181-james means [we]4826-we have come to [you]0-i , [beggar - folk]4827-beggar - folk , and have not behaved to [you]0-i very well , and [we]4826-we are ashamed of [our]4826-we ingratitude and ill - behaviour . Now [we]4826-we are wanting to go away and be forgotten ; and [[my]189-catriona father]417-my father will have guided [his]417-my father gear so ill , that [we]4826-we can not even do that unless [you]0-i will give [us]4826-we some more alms . For that is what [we]4826-we are , at an events , [beggar - folk]4827-beggar - folk and [sorners]4830-sorners . "[189-catriona]

" By [your]2697-you leave , [Miss Drummond]193-miss drummond , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i must speak to [[your]2697-you father]3247-your father by [myself]0-i . "[0-i]

[She]2697-you went into [[her]2697-you own room]2607-her own room and shut the door , without a word or a look .

" [You]0-i must excuse [her]2697-you , [Mr. Balfour]222-davie , "[181-james] says [James More]181-james . " [She]2697-you has no delicacy . "[181-james]

" [I]0-i am not here to discuss that with [you]2697-you , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " but to be quit of [you]2697-you . And to that end [I]0-i must talk of [your]2697-you position . Now , [Mr. Drummond]371-mr. drummond , [I]0-i have kept the run of [your]2697-you affairs more closely than [you]2697-you bargained for . " [I]2699-you bid [you]0-i beware . [I]2699-you will stand no more baiting , "[2699-you] [he]2699-you broke out . " [I]2699-you am sick of [her]4651-your daughter and [you]0-i . " [[My]2699-you dear friend]4837-my dear friend , "[2699-you] [he]2699-you cried , " [I]2699-you know [I]2699-you might have relied upon the generosity of [your]0-i character . "[2699-you]

" [Man]3015-man ! will [you]2699-you let [me]0-i speak ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " The fact is that [I]0-i can not win to find out if [you]2699-you are rich or poor . But it is [my]0-i idea that [your]2699-you means , as they are mysterious in [their]4839-their source , so they are something insufficient in amount ; and [I]0-i do not choose [[your]2699-you daughter]4651-your daughter to be lacking . If [I]0-i durst speak to [herself]4651-your daughter , [you]2699-you may be certain [I]0-i would never dream of trusting it to [you]2699-you ; because [I]0-i know [you]2699-you like the back of [my]0-i hand , and all [your]2699-you blustering talk is that much wind to [me]0-i . However , [I]0-i believe in [your]2699-you way [you]2699-you do still care something for [[your]2699-you daughter]4651-your daughter after all ; and [I]0-i must just be doing with that ground of confidence , such as it is . "[0-i]

[Whereupon]260-whereupon , [I]0-i arranged with [him]2700-he that [he]2700-he was to communicate with [me]0-i , as to [his]2700-he whereabouts and [Catriona]189-catriona s welfare , in consideration of which [I]0-i was to serve [him]2700-he a small stipend .

[He]2700-he heard the business out with a great deal of eagerness ; and when it was done , " [[My]2700-he dear fellow]4842-my dear fellow , [[my]2700-he dear son]4843-my dear son , "[2700-he] [he]2700-he cried out , " this is more like [yourself]4842-my dear fellow than any of it yet ! [I]2700-he will serve [you]4842-my dear fellow with [a soldier]3320-a soldier s faithfulness "[2700-he]

" Let [me]0-i hear no more of it ! "[0-i] says [I.]0-i " [You]2700-he have got [me]0-i to that pitch that the bare name of [soldier]4845-soldier rises on [my]0-i stomach . [Our]4846-our traffic is settled ; [I]0-i am now going forth and will return in one half - hour , when [I]0-i expect to find [[my]0-i chambers]4847-my chambers purged of [you]2700-he . "[0-i]

[I]0-i gave [them]2701-them good measure of time ; it was [my]0-i one fear that [I]0-i might see [Catriona]189-catriona again , because tears and weakness were ready in [my]0-i heart , and [I]0-i cherished [my]0-i anger like a piece of dignity . Perhaps an hour went by ; the sun had gone down , a little wisp of a new moon was following it across a scarlet sunset ; already there were stars in [the east]611-the east , and in [[my]0-i chambers]4847-my chambers , when at last [I]0-i entered [them]4847-my chambers , the night lay blue . [I]0-i lit a taper and reviewed [the rooms]2704-the rooms ; in the first there remained nothing so much as to awake a memory of [those who were gone]2705-those who were gone ; but in the second , in a corner of the floor , [I]0-i spied a little heap that brought [my]0-i heart into [my]0-i mouth . [She]189-catriona had left behind at [her]189-catriona departure all that [she]189-catriona had ever had of [me]0-i . It was the blow that [I]0-i felt sorest , perhaps because it was the last ; and [I]0-i fell upon that pile of clothing and behaved [myself]0-i more foolish than [I]0-i care to tell of .

Late in the night , in a strict frost , and [my]0-i teeth chattering , [I]0-i came again by some portion of [my]0-i manhood and considered with [myself]0-i . The sight of these poor frocks and ribbons , and [her]189-catriona shifts , and the clocked stockings , was not to be endured ; and if [I]0-i were to recover any constancy of mind , [I]0-i saw [I]0-i must be rid of them ere the morning . It was [my]0-i first thought to have made a fire and burned them ; but [my]0-i disposition has always been opposed to wastery , for one thing ; and for another , to have burned these things that [she]189-catriona had worn so close upon [her]189-catriona body seemed in the nature of a cruelty . There was a corner cupboard in [that chamber]2706-that chamber ; there [I]0-i determined to bestow them . The which [I]0-i did and made it a long business , folding them with very little skill indeed but the more care ; and sometimes dropping them with [my]0-i tears . All the heart was gone out of [me]0-i , [I]0-i was weary as though [I]0-i had run miles , and sore like one beaten ; when , as [I]0-i was folding a kerchief that [she]189-catriona wore often at [her]189-catriona neck , [I]0-i observed there was a corner neatly cut from it . It was a kerchief of a very pretty hue , on which [I]0-i had frequently remarked ; and once that [she]189-catriona had it on , [I]0-i remembered telling [her]189-catriona by way of a banter that [she]189-catriona wore [my]0-i colours . There came a glow of hope and like a tide of sweetness in [my]0-i bosom ; and the next moment [I]0-i was plunged back in a fresh despair . For there was the corner crumpled in a knot and cast down by itself in another part of the floor .

But when [I]0-i argued with [myself]0-i , [I]0-i grew more hopeful . [She]189-catriona had cut that corner off in some childish freak that was manifestly tender ; that [she]189-catriona had cast it away again was little to be wondered at ; and [I]0-i was inclined to dwell more upon the first than upon the second , and to be more pleased that [she]189-catriona had ever conceived the idea of that keepsake , than concerned because [she]189-catriona had flung it from [her]189-catriona in an hour of natural resentment .

CHAPTER XXIX [WE]2707-our MEET IN [DUNKIRK]161-dunkirk

Altogether , then , [I]0-i was scare so miserable the next days but what [I]0-i had many hopeful and happy snatches ; threw [myself]0-i with a good deal of constancy upon [my]0-i studies ; and made out to endure the time till [Alan]185-alan should arrive , or [I]0-i might hear word of [Catriona]189-catriona by the means of [James]181-james More . [I]0-i had altogether three letters in the time of [our]2707-our separation . One was to announce [their]2708-their arrival in [the town of [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk]2709-the town of dunkirk in [France]50-france , from which place [James]181-james shortly after started alone upon [a private mission]2710-a private mission . This was to [England]162-england and to see [Lord Holderness]385-lord holderness ; and it has always been a bitter thought that [my]0-i good money helped to pay the charges of the same . But [he]181-james has need of a long spoon who soups with [the de il]2711-the de il , or [James More]181-james either . During this absence , the time was to fall due for another letter ; and as the letter was the condition of [his]181-james stipend , [he]181-james had been so careful as to prepare it beforehand and leave it with [Catriona]189-catriona to be despatched . The fact of [our]2707-our correspondence aroused [her]189-catriona suspicions , and [he]181-james was no sooner gone than [she]189-catriona had burst the seal . What [I]0-i received began accordingly in the writing of [James More]181-james :

" [[My]181-james dear]3481-my dear Sir , [Your]3481-my dear esteemed favour came to hand duly , and [I]181-james have to acknowledge the inclosure according to agreement . It shall be all faithfully expended on [[my]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter , who is well , and desires to be remembered to [[her]4622-my daughter dear friend]4850-her dear friend . [I]181-james find [her]4622-my daughter in rather a melancholy disposition , but trust in the mercy of [God]223-god to see [her]4622-my daughter re - established . [Our]2707-our manner of life is very much alone , but [we]2707-our solace [ourselves]2707-our with the melancholy tunes of [[our]2707-our native mountains]4851-our native mountains , and by walking up [the margin of [the sea]1224-the sea that lies next to [Scotland]182-prestongrange]4852-the margin of the sea that lies next to scotland . It was better days with [me]181-james when [I]181-james lay with five wounds upon [my]181-james body on [the field of]4854-the field of [Gladsmuir]80-gladsmuir . [I]181-james have found employment here in [the haras of [a French nobleman]4856-a french nobleman]4855-the haras of a french nobleman , where [my]181-james experience is valued . But , [[my]181-james dear [Sir]3021-sir]3394-my dear sir , the wages are so exceedingly unsuitable that [I]181-james would be ashamed to mention them , which makes [your]3021-sir remittances the more necessary to [[my]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter s comfort , though [I]181-james daresay the sight of [old friends]4320-old friends would be still better .[181-james]

" [[My]2713-your affectionate , obedient servant dear]3481-my dear Sir , "[2713-your affectionate , obedient servant] [[Your]2712-your affectionate , obedient servant]2713-your affectionate , obedient servant , " [James Macgregor Drummond]181-james . "[2713-your affectionate , obedient servant]

Below it began again in the hand of [Catriona]189-catriona :

" Do not be believing [him]2713-your affectionate , obedient servant , it is all lies together , C. M. D. "[189-catriona]

Not only did [she]189-catriona add this postscript , but [I]0-i think [she]189-catriona must have come near suppressing the letter ; for it came long after date , and was closely followed by the third . In the time betwixt [them]2714-them , [Alan]185-alan had arrived , and made another life to [me]0-i with [his]185-alan merry conversation ; [I]0-i had been presented to [[his]185-alan cousin of [the Scots - Dutch]2716-the scots - dutch]2715-his cousin of the scots - dutch , [a man that drank more than [I]0-i could have thought possible and was not otherwise of interest]2717-a man that drank more than i could have thought possible and was not otherwise of interest ; [I]0-i had been entertained to many jovial dinners and given some [myself]0-i , all with no great change upon [my]0-i sorrow ; and [we]2718-we two by which [I]0-i mean [Alan]185-alan and [myself]0-i , and not at all [the cousin]2719-the cousin had discussed a good deal the nature of [my]0-i relations with [James More]181-james and [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter . [I]0-i was naturally diffident to give particulars ; and this disposition was not anyway lessened by the nature of [Alan]185-alan s commentary upon those [I]0-i gave .

" [I]185-alan cannae make heed nor tail of it , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan would say , " but it sticks in [my]185-alan mind [ye]0-i ve made a gowk of [yourself]0-i . The way that [you]0-i tell it , the thing s fair impossible . [Ye]0-i must have made a terrible hash of the business , [David]222-davie . "[185-alan]

" There are whiles that [I]0-i am of the same mind , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" The strange thing is that [ye]0-i seem to have a kind of fancy for [her]523-a lassie too ! "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan .

" The biggest kind , [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and [I]0-i think [I]0-i ll take it to [[my]0-i grave]4864-my grave with [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Well , [ye]0-i beat [me]185-alan , whatever ! "[185-alan] [he]185-alan would conclude .

[I]0-i showed [him]185-alan the letter with [Catriona]189-catriona s postscript . " And here again ! "[185-alan] [he]185-alan cried . " Impossible to deny a kind of decency to [this Catriona]4865-this catriona , and sense [forby]311-forby ! " [Ye]185-alan see , [Alan]185-alan , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " it goes against the grain with [me]0-i to leave [the maid]534-the maid in such poor hands . "[0-i]

" [Ye]0-i couldnae weel find poorer , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan admitted . " But what are [ye]0-i to do with it ? It s this way about [a man]519-a man and [a woman]2044-a woman , [ye]0-i see , [Davie]222-davie : [The weemenfolk]4872-the weemenfolk have got no kind of reason to [them]4872-the weemenfolk . Either [they]4872-the weemenfolk like [the man]3029-the man , and then a goes fine ; or else [they]4872-the weemenfolk just detest [him]3029-the man , and [ye]0-i may spare [your]0-i breath [ye]0-i can do naething . There s just the two sets of [them]4872-the weemenfolk [them]4872-the weemenfolk that would sell [their]4872-the weemenfolk coats for [ye]0-i , and [them]4872-the weemenfolk that never look [the road [ye]0-i re on]4874-the road ye re on . That s a that there is to [women]3411-women ; and [you]0-i seem to be such a gomeral that [ye]0-i cannae tell [the tane frae the tither]4876-the tane frae the tither . "[185-alan]

" Well , and [I]2721-i m afraid that s true for [me]2721-i , "[2721-i] said [I.]2721-i

" And yet there s naething easier ! "[185-alan] cried [Alan]185-alan . " [I]185-alan could easy learn [ye]0-i the science of the thing ; but [ye]0-i seem to [me]185-alan to be born blind , and there s where [the deefficulty]4877-the deefficulty comes in . "[185-alan]

" And can [you]185-alan no help [me]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , " [you]185-alan that are so clever at the trade ? "[0-i]

" [Ye]0-i see , [David]222-davie , [I]185-alan wasnae [here]3174-here , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . But it sticks in [my]185-alan mind that [ye]0-i ll have made some kind of bauchle ; and if [I]185-alan was [you]0-i [I]185-alan would have a try at [her]2999-his daughter again . "[185-alan]

" Would [ye]185-alan so , [man Alan]3936-man alan ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [I]185-alan would e en t , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan .

The third letter came to [my]0-i hand while [we]2722-we were deep in some such talk : and it will be seen how pat it fell to the occasion . [James]181-james professed to be in some concern upon [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter s health , which [I]0-i believe was never better ; abounded in kind expressions to [myself]0-i ; and finally proposed that [I]0-i should visit [them]2724-them at [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk .

" [You]0-i will now be enjoying the society of [[my]181-james old comrade]4882-my old comrade [Mr. Stewart]337-mr. stewart , "[181-james] [he]181-james wrote . " Why not accompany [him]337-mr. stewart so far in [his]337-mr. stewart return to [France]50-france ? [I]181-james have something very particular for [Mr. Stewart]337-mr. stewart s ear ; and , at any rate , [I]181-james would be pleased to meet in with [an old fellow - soldier]4883-an old fellow - soldier and one so mettle as [himself]337-mr. stewart . As for [you]0-i , [[my]181-james dear sir]3394-my dear sir , [[my]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter and [I]181-james would be proud to receive [[our]4886-our benefactor]4887-our benefactor , whom [we]4886-our regard as [a brother]720-a brother and [a son]3432-a son . [The French nobleman]4890-the french nobleman has proved [a person of the most filthy avarice of character]4891-a person of the most filthy avarice of character , and [I]181-james have been necessitate to leave [the haras]4892-the haras . [You]0-i will find [us]4886-our in consequence a little poorly lodged in [the auberge of [a man Bazin on [the dunes]4895-the dunes]4894-a man bazin on the dunes]4893-the auberge of a man bazin on the dunes ; but the situation is caller , and [I]181-james make no doubt but [we]4886-our might spend some very pleasant days , when [Mr. Stewart]337-mr. stewart and [I]181-james could recall [our]4886-our services , and [you]0-i and [[my]181-james daughter]4622-my daughter divert [yourselves]4886-our in a manner more befitting [your]0-i age . [I]181-james beg at least that [Mr. Stewart]337-mr. stewart would come [here]3174-here ; [my]181-james business with [him]337-mr. stewart opens a very wide door . "[181-james]

" What does [the man]3029-the man want with [me]185-alan ? "[185-alan] cried [Alan]185-alan , when [he]185-alan had read . " What [he]3029-the man wants with [you]2725-you is clear enough it s siller . But what can [he]3029-the man want with [Alan Breck]185-alan ? "[185-alan]

" O , it ll be just an excuse , "[2725-you] said [I.]2725-you " [He]3029-the man is still after this marriage , which [I]2725-you wish from [my]2725-you heart that [we]4899-we could bring about . And [he]3029-the man asks [you]2725-you because [he]3029-the man thinks [I]2725-you would be less likely to come wanting [you]2725-you . "[2725-you]

" Well , [I]185-alan wish that [I]185-alan kent , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan . " [Him]3029-the man and [me]185-alan were never onyways pack ; [we]4899-we used to girn at ither like a pair of pipers . Something for [my]185-alan ear , quo [he]3029-the man ! [I]185-alan ll maybe have something for [his]3029-the man hinder - end , before [we]4899-we re through with it . [Dod]275-dod , [I]185-alan m thinking it would be a kind of divertisement to gang and see what [he]3029-the man ll be after ! Forby that [I]185-alan could see [[your]275-dod lassie]4900-your lassie then . What say [ye]275-dod , [Davie]222-davie ? Will [ye]275-dod ride with [Alan]185-alan ? "[185-alan]

[You]2726-you may be sure [I]0-i was not backward , and [Alan]185-alan s furlough running towards an end , [we]2727-we set forth presently upon this joint adventure .

It was near dark of a January day when [we]2727-we rode at last into [the town of]2728-the town of [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk . [We]2727-we left [our]2727-we horses at the post , and found a guide to [Bazin s Inn]163-bazin s inn , which lay beyond the walls . Night was quite fallen , so that [we]2727-we were the last to leave [that fortress]2729-that fortress , and heard the doors of [it]2729-that fortress close behind [us]2727-we as [we]2727-we passed [the bridge]2730-the bridge . On the other side there lay [a lighted suburb]2731-a lighted suburb , which [we]2727-we thridded for a while , then turned into [a dark lane]2732-a dark lane , and presently found [ourselves]2727-we wading in the night among deep sand where [we]2727-we could hear a bullering of [the sea]1224-the sea . [We]2727-we travelled in this fashion for some while , following [our]2727-we conductor mostly by the sound of [his]2734-his voice ; and [I]0-i had begun to think [he]2734-his was perhaps misleading [us]2727-we , when [we]2727-we came to the top of a small brae , and there appeared out of the darkness a dim light in a window .

" Voila l auberge a [Bazin]387-bazin , "[2735-the guide] says [the guide]2735-the guide .

[Alan]185-alan smacked [his]185-alan lips . " An unco lonely bit , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , and [I]0-i thought by [his]185-alan tone [he]185-alan was not wholly pleased .

A little after , and [we]2727-we stood in [the lower storey of [that house]2737-that house]2736-the lower storey of that house , which was all in [the one apartment]2738-the one apartment , with a stairs leading to [the chambers]2739-the chambers at the side , benches and tables by the wall , the cooking fire at the one end of [it]2736-the lower storey of that house , and shelves of bottles and the cellar - trap at the other . Here [Bazin]387-bazin , who was [an ill - looking , big man]2740-an ill - looking , big man , told [us]2727-we [the Scottish gentleman]2741-the scottish gentleman was gone abroad [he]387-bazin knew not where , but [the young lady]3012-the young lady was above , and [he]387-bazin would call [her]3012-the young lady down to [us]2727-we .

[I]0-i took from [my]0-i breast that kerchief wanting the corner , and knotted it about [my]0-i throat . [I]0-i could hear [my]0-i heart go ; and [Alan]185-alan patting [me]0-i on the shoulder with some of [his]185-alan laughable expressions , [I]0-i could scarce refrain from a sharp word . But the time was not long to wait . [I]0-i heard [her]3012-the young lady step pass overhead , and saw [her]3012-the young lady on the stair . This [she]3012-the young lady descended very quietly , and greeted [me]0-i with a pale face and a certain seeming of earnestness , or uneasiness , in [her]3012-the young lady manner that extremely dashed [me]0-i .

" [[My]3012-the young lady father]417-my father , [James More]181-james , will be [here]3174-here soon . [He]417-my father will be very pleased to see [you]0-i , "[3012-the young lady] [she]3012-the young lady said . And then of a sudden [her]3012-the young lady face flamed , [her]3012-the young lady eyes lightened , the speech stopped upon [her]3012-the young lady lips ; and [I]0-i made sure [she]3012-the young lady had observed [the kerchief]2743-the kerchief . It was only for a breath that [she]3012-the young lady was discomposed ; but methought it was with a new animation that [she]3012-the young lady turned to welcome [Alan]185-alan . " And [you]0-i will be [[his]185-alan friend]4686-his friend , [Alan Breck]185-alan ? "[3012-the young lady] [she]3012-the young lady cried . " Many is the dozen times [I]3012-the young lady will have heard [him]185-alan tell of [you]0-i ; and [I]3012-the young lady love [you]0-i already for all [your]0-i bravery and goodness . "[3012-the young lady]

" Well , well , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan , holding [her]3012-the young lady hand in [his]185-alan and viewing [her]3012-the young lady , " and so this is [the young lady]3012-the young lady at the last of it ! [David]222-davie , [ye]0-i re [an awful poor hand of a description]4905-an awful poor hand of a description . "[185-alan]

[I]0-i do not know that ever [I]0-i heard [him]185-alan speak so straight to [people]463-people s hearts ; the sound of [his]185-alan voice was like song .

" What ? will [he]185-alan have been describing [me]3012-the young lady ? "[3012-the young lady] [she]3012-the young lady cried .

" Little else of it since [I]185-alan ever came out of [France]50-france ! "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , " forby a bit of a speciment one night in [Scotland]182-prestongrange in a shaw of wood by [Silvermills]1-silvermills . But cheer up , [[my]185-alan dear]3481-my dear ! [ye]0-i re bonnier than what [he]185-alan said . And now there s one thing sure ; [you]0-i and [me]185-alan are to be [a pair of friends]4907-a pair of friends . [I]185-alan m [a kind of a henchman to [Davie]222-davie [here]3174-here]4908-a kind of a henchman to davie here ; [I]185-alan m like a tyke at [his]185-alan heels ; and whatever [he]185-alan cares for , [I]185-alan ve got to care for too and by [the holy airn]4910-the holy airn ! [they]4911-they ve got to care for [me]185-alan ! So now [you]0-i can see what way [you]0-i stand with [Alan Breck]185-alan , and [ye]0-i ll find [ye]0-i ll hardly lose on the transaction . [He]185-alan s no very bonnie , [[my]185-alan dear]3481-my dear , but [he]185-alan s leal to [them]4911-they [he]185-alan loves . "[185-alan]

" [I]2745-i thank [you]0-i from [my]2745-i heart for [your]0-i good words , "[2745-i] said [she]2745-i . " [I]2745-i have that honour for [a brave , honest man]4913-a brave , honest man that [I]2745-i can not find any to be answering with . "[2745-i]

Using [travellers]2746-travellers freedom , [we]2747-we spared to wait for [James More]181-james , and sat down to meat , [we]2747-we threesome . [Alan]185-alan had [Catriona]189-catriona sit by [him]185-alan and wait upon [his]185-alan wants : [he]185-alan made [her]189-catriona drink first out of [his]185-alan glass , [he]185-alan surrounded [her]189-catriona with continual kind gallantries , and yet never gave [me]0-i the most small occasion to be jealous ; and [he]185-alan kept the talk so much in [his]185-alan own hand , and that in so merry a note , that neither [she]189-catriona nor [I]0-i remembered to be embarrassed . If any had seen [us]2747-we [there]636-there , it must have been supposed that [Alan]185-alan was [the old friend]2749-the old friend and [I]0-i [the stranger]2750-the stranger . Indeed , [I]0-i had often cause to love and to admire [the man]3029-the man , but [I]0-i never loved or admired [him]3029-the man better than that night ; and [I]0-i could not help remarking to [myself]0-i what [I]0-i was sometimes rather in danger of forgetting that [he]3029-the man had not only much experience of life , but in [his]3029-the man own way a great deal of natural ability besides . As for [Catriona]189-catriona , [she]189-catriona seemed quite carried away ; [her]189-catriona laugh was like a peal of bells , [her]189-catriona face gay as a May morning ; and [I]0-i own , although [I]0-i was well pleased , yet [I]0-i was a little sad also , and thought [myself]0-i a dull , stockish character in comparison of [[my]0-i friend]3036-my friend , and very unfit to come into [a young maid]1142-a young maid s life , and perhaps ding down [her]189-catriona gaiety .

But if that was like to be [my]0-i part , [I]0-i found that at least [I]0-i was not alone in it ; for , [James]181-james More returning suddenly , [the girl]517-the girl was changed into a piece of stone . Through the rest of that evening , until [she]517-the girl made an excuse and slipped to bed , [I]0-i kept an eye upon [her]517-the girl without cease ; and [I]0-i can bear testimony that [she]517-the girl never smiled , scarce spoke , and looked mostly on the board in front of [her]517-the girl . So that [I]0-i really marvelled to see so much devotion as it used to be changed into the very sickness of hate .

Of [James]181-james More it is unnecessary to say much ; [you]2755-you know [the man]3029-the man already , what there was to know of [him]3029-the man ; and [I]0-i am weary of writing out [his]3029-the man lies . Enough that [he]3029-the man drank a great deal , and told [us]2757-we very little that was to any possible purpose . As for the business with [Alan]185-alan , that was to be reserved for the morrow and [his]185-alan private hearing .

It was the more easy to be put off , because [Alan]185-alan and [I]0-i were pretty weary with four day s ride , and sat not very late after [Catriona]189-catriona .

[We]2757-we were soon alone in [a chamber where [we]2757-we were to make - shift with a single bed]2758-a chamber where we were to make - shift with a single bed . [Alan]185-alan looked on [me]0-i with a queer smile .

" [[Ye]0-i muckle ass]4914-ye muckle ass ! "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

" What do [ye]0-i mean by that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

" Mean ? What do [I]185-alan mean ! It s extraordinar , [David man]3796-david man , "[185-alan] say [he]185-alan , " that [you]0-i should be so mortal stupit . "[185-alan]

Again [I]0-i begged [him]185-alan to speak out .

" Well , it s this of it , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan . " [I]185-alan told [ye]0-i there were [the two kinds of women [them]4916-the two kinds of women them that would sell their shifts for ye , and the others . just you try for yoursel , my bonny man that would sell [their]4916-the two kinds of women them that would sell their shifts for ye , and the others . just you try for yoursel , my bonny man shifts for [ye]0-i , and [the others]511-the others . But what s that neepkin at [[your]0-i craig]4919-your craig ? "[185-alan]
