" [I]185-alan thocht it was something thereabout , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan .

Nor would [he]185-alan say another word though [I]0-i besieged [him]185-alan long with importunities .

CHAPTER XXX THE LETTER FROM [THE SHIP

Daylight]2759-the ship daylight showed [us]2760-us how solitary [the inn]2328-the inn stood . [It]2328-the inn was plainly hard upon [the sea]1224-the sea , yet out of all view of [it]2328-the inn , and beset on every side with [scabbit hills of sand]2763-scabbit hills of sand . There was , indeed , only one thing in the nature of a prospect , where there stood out over a brae the two sails of [a windmill]2764-a windmill , like an ass s ears , but with the ass quite hidden . It was strange after the wind rose , for at first it was dead calm to see the turning and following of each other of these great sails behind [the hillock]2765-the hillock . Scarce [any road]2766-any road came by there ; but a number of footways travelled among the bents in all directions up to [Mr. Bazin]387-bazin s door . The truth is , [he]387-bazin was [a man of many trades]2767-a man of many trades , not any one of [them]2768-them honest , and the position of [[his]387-bazin inn]2769-his inn was the best of [his]387-bazin livelihood . [Smugglers]2770-smugglers frequented [it]2328-the inn ; [political agents]2771-political agents and [forfeited persons bound across [the water]3088-the water]2772-forfeited persons bound across the water came there to await [their]2772-forfeited persons bound across the water passages ; and [I]0-i daresay there was worse behind , for [a whole family]2774-a whole family might have been butchered in [that house]2737-that house and [nobody]3489-nobody the wiser .

[I]0-i slept little and ill . Long ere it was day , [I]0-i had slipped from beside [my]0-i bedfellow , and was warming [myself]0-i at the fire or walking to and fro before the door . Dawn broke mighty sullen ; but a little after , sprang up a wind out of the west , which burst the clouds , let through the sun , and set the mill to the turning . There was something of spring in the sunshine , or else it was in [my]0-i heart ; and the appearing of the great sails one after another from behind [the hill]3368-the hill , diverted [me]0-i extremely . At times [I]0-i could hear a creak of the machinery ; and by half - past eight of the day , and [I]0-i thought [this dreary , desert place]2778-this dreary , desert place was like [a paradise]2779-a paradise .

For all which , as the day drew on and [nobody]3489-nobody came near , [I]0-i began to be aware of an uneasiness that [I]0-i could scarce explain . It seemed there was trouble afoot ; the sails of [the windmill]2781-the windmill , as [they]2772-forfeited persons bound across the water came up and went down over [the hill]3368-the hill , were like [persons spying]2783-persons spying ; and outside of all fancy , it was surely [a strange neighbourhood]2784-a strange neighbourhood and [house]618-house for [a young lady to be brought to dwell in]2786-a young lady to be brought to dwell in .

At breakfast , which [we]2787-we took late , it was manifest that [James More]181-james was in some danger or perplexity ; manifest that [Alan]185-alan was alive to the same , and watched [him]181-james close ; and this appearance of duplicity upon the one side , and vigilance upon the other , held [me]0-i on live coals . The meal was no sooner over than [James]181-james seemed to come began to make apologies . [He]181-james had an appointment of a private nature in [the town]1876-the town it was with [the French nobleman]4890-the french nobleman , [he]181-james told [me]0-i , and [we]2787-we would please excuse [him]181-james till about noon . Meanwhile [he]181-james carried [[his]181-james daughter]2999-his daughter aside to the far end of [the room]693-the room , where [he]181-james seemed to speak rather earnestly and [she]2999-his daughter to listen with much inclination .

" [I]185-alan am caring less and less about [this man]1744-this man [James]181-james , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan . " There s something no right with [the man James]4921-the man james , and [I]185-alan shouldnae wonder but what [Alan Breck]185-alan would give an eye to [him]4921-the man james this day . [I]185-alan would like fine to see [yon French nobleman]4922-yon french nobleman , [Davie]222-davie ; and [I]185-alan daresay [you]222-davie could find an employ to [yoursel]222-davie , and that would be to speir at the lassie for some news o [your]222-davie affair . Just tell it to [her]2999-his daughter plainly tell [her]2999-his daughter [ye]222-davie re [a muckle ass at the off - set]4923-a muckle ass at the off - set ; and then , if [I]185-alan were [you]222-davie , and [ye]222-davie could do it naitural , [I]185-alan would just mint to [her]2999-his daughter [I]185-alan was in some kind of a danger ; [a weemenfolk]4924-a weemenfolk likes that . "[185-alan]

" [I]0-i cannae lee , [Alan]185-alan , [I]0-i cannae do it naitural , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , mocking [him]2792-i .

" [The more fool]4925-the more fool [you]0-i ! "[2792-i] says [he]2792-i . " Then [ye]222-davie ll can tell [her]2999-his daughter that [I]2792-i recommended it ; that ll set [her]2999-his daughter to the laughing ; and [I]2792-i wouldnae wonder but what that was the next best . But see to [the pair of [them]4926-the pair of them]4926-the pair of them ! If [I]2792-i didnae feel just sure of [the lassie]1576-the lassie , and that [she]2999-his daughter was awful pleased and chief with [Alan]185-alan , [I]2792-i would think there was some kind of hocus - pocus about [you]2792-i . "[2792-i]

" And is [she]2999-his daughter so pleased with [ye]2792-i , then , [Alan]185-alan ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [She]2999-his daughter thinks a heap of [me]2792-i , "[2792-i] says [he]2792-i . " And [I]2792-i m no like [you]0-i : [I]2792-i m one that can tell . That [she]2999-his daughter does [she]2999-his daughter thinks a heap of [Alan]185-alan . And troth ! [I]2792-i m thinking a good deal of [him]185-alan mysel ; and with [your]0-i permission , [Shaws]222-davie , [I]2792-i ll be getting a wee yont amang [the bents]3942-the bents , so that [I]2792-i can see what way [James]181-james goes . "[2792-i]

One after another went , till [I]0-i was left alone beside the breakfast table ; [James]181-james to [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk , [Alan]185-alan dogging [him]2792-i , [Catriona]189-catriona up the stairs to [[her]189-catriona own chamber]2793-her own chamber . [I]0-i could very well understand how [she]189-catriona should avoid to be alone with [me]0-i ; yet was none the better pleased with it for that , and bent [my]0-i mind to entrap [her]189-catriona to an interview before [the men]3722-the men returned . Upon the whole , the best appeared to [me]0-i to do like [Alan]185-alan . If [I]0-i was out of view among [the sandhills]1244-the sandhills , the fine morning would decoy [her]189-catriona forth ; and once [I]0-i had [her]189-catriona in the open , [I]0-i could please [myself]0-i .

No sooner said than done ; nor was [I]0-i long under the bield of [a hillock]2796-a hillock before [she]189-catriona appeared at [the inn]2328-the inn door , looked here and there , and seeing [nobody]3489-nobody set out by a path that led directly seaward , and by which [I]0-i followed [her]189-catriona . [I]0-i was in no haste to make [my]0-i presence known ; the further [she]189-catriona went [I]0-i made sure of the longer hearing to [my]0-i suit ; and the ground being all sandy it was easy to follow [her]189-catriona unheard . [The path]1088-the path rose and came at last to the head of a knowe . Thence [I]0-i had a picture for the first time of what [a desolate wilderness that inn]2800-a desolate wilderness that inn stood hidden in ; where was [no man to be seen]2801-no man to be seen , nor [any house of [man]3015-man]2802-any house of man , except just [Bazin s]387-bazin and [the windmill]2781-the windmill . Only a little further on , [the sea]1224-the sea appeared and two or [three ships]2806-three ships upon [it]1224-the sea , pretty as a drawing . One of these was extremely close in to be so great [a vessel]2807-a vessel ; and [I]0-i was aware of a shock of new suspicion , when [I]0-i recognised [the trim of [the Seahorse]100-the seahorse]2808-the trim of the seahorse . What should [an English ship]2809-an english ship be doing so near in to [France]50-france ? Why was [Alan]185-alan brought into [[her]189-catriona neighbourhood]2810-her neighbourhood , and that in a place so far from any hope of rescue ? and was it by accident , or by design , that [the daughter of James More]628-the daughter of james more should walk that day to [the seaside]3907-the seaside ?

Presently [I]0-i came forth behind [her]189-catriona in the front of [the sandhills]1244-the sandhills and above [the beach]1247-the beach . It was here long and solitary ; with [a man]519-a man - o -war s boat drawn up about the middle of the prospect , and [an officer in charge and pacing the sands like one who waited]2816-an officer in charge and pacing the sands like one who waited . [I]0-i sat down where the rough grass a good deal covered [me]0-i , and looked for what should follow . [Catriona]189-catriona went straight to [the boat]1266-the boat ; [the officer]3639-the officer met [her]189-catriona with civilities ; [they]2819-they had ten words together ; [I]0-i saw a letter changing hands ; and there was [Catriona]189-catriona returning . At the same time , as if this were all [her]189-catriona business on [the Continent]2820-the continent , [the boat]1266-the boat shoved off and was headed for [the Seahorse]100-the seahorse . But [I]0-i observed [the officer]3639-the officer to remain behind and disappear among the bents .

[I]0-i liked the business little ; and the more [I]0-i considered of it , liked it less . Was it [Alan]185-alan [the officer]3639-the officer was seeking ? or [Catriona]189-catriona ? [She]189-catriona drew near with [her]189-catriona head down , looking constantly on [the sand]2824-the sand , and made so tender a picture that [I]0-i could not bear to doubt [her]189-catriona innocence . The next , [she]189-catriona raised [her]189-catriona face and recognised [me]0-i ; seemed to hesitate , and then came on again , but more slowly , and [I]0-i thought with a changed colour . And at that thought , all else that was upon [my]0-i bosom fears , suspicions , the care of [[my]0-i friend]3036-my friend s life was clean swallowed up ; and [I]0-i rose to [my]0-i feet and stood waiting [her]189-catriona in a drunkenness of hope .

[I]0-i gave [her]189-catriona " good morning "[0-i] as [she]189-catriona came up , which [she]189-catriona returned with a good deal of composure .

" Will [you]189-catriona forgive [my]0-i having followed [you]189-catriona ? "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" [I]189-catriona know [you]0-i are always meaning kindly , "[189-catriona] [she]189-catriona replied ; and then , with a little outburst , " but why will [you]0-i be sending money to [that man]3537-that man ! It must not be . "[189-catriona]

" [I]0-i never sent it for [him]3537-that man , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " but for [you]189-catriona , as [you]189-catriona know well . "[0-i]

" And [you]0-i have no right to be sending it to [either one of [us]4931-us]4930-either one of us , "[189-catriona] [she]189-catriona said . " [David]222-davie , it is not right . "[189-catriona]

[I]0-i have never seen the place that looked so pretty as those bents by [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk ; and the windmill sails , as they bobbed over [the knowe]2834-the knowe , were like a tune of music .

At the first sound of the bare steel [I]0-i instinctively leaped back from the collision . " [[My]185-alan dear]3481-my dear , [I]185-alan have done with [him]760-her father , "[185-alan] said [Alan]185-alan , and went , and sat on a table , with [his]185-alan arms crossed and the sword naked in [his]185-alan hand .

[I]517-the girl am [a daughter of [Alpin]272-alpin]4995-a daughter of alpin ! [Shame of [the sons of [Alpin]272-alpin]4276-the sons of alpin]4996-shame of the sons of alpin , begone ! "[517-the girl]

It was said with so much passion as awoke [me]0-i from the horror of [my]0-i own bloodied sword . [The two]2454-the two stood facing , [she]517-the girl with the red stain on [her]517-the girl kerchief , [he]185-alan white as a rag . [I]0-i knew [him]185-alan well enough [I]0-i knew it must have pierced [him]185-alan in the quick place of [his]185-alan soul ; but [he]185-alan betook [himself]185-alan to a bravado air .

" Why , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan , sheathing [his]185-alan sword , though still with a bright eye on [Alan]185-alan , " if this brawl is over [I]185-alan will but get [my]185-alan portmanteau "[185-alan]

" There goes no pockmantie out of [this place]1462-this place except with [me]185-alan , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan .

" [Sir]3021-sir ! "[181-james] cries [James]181-james .

" [James]181-james More , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan , " [this lady daughter of [yours]181-james]5000-this lady daughter of yours is to marry [[my]185-alan friend]3036-my friend [Davie]222-davie , upon the which account [I]185-alan let [you]181-james pack with a hale carcase . But take [you]181-james [my]185-alan advice of it and get that carcase out of harm s way or ower late . Little as [you]181-james suppose it , there are leemits to [my]185-alan temper . "[185-alan]

" Be damned , [sir]3021-sir , but [my]181-james money s there ! "[181-james] said [James]181-james .

" [I]185-alan m vexed about that , too , "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan , with [his]185-alan funny face , " but now , [ye]181-james see , it s mines . "[185-alan] And then with more gravity , " Be [you]181-james advised , [James]181-james More , [you]181-james leave [this house]4628-this house . "[185-alan]

[James]181-james seemed to cast about for a moment in [his]181-james mind ; but it s to be thought [he]181-james had enough of [Alan]185-alan s swordsmanship , for [he]181-james suddenly put off [his]181-james hat to [us]2875-us and with a face like one of [the damned]2876-the damned bade [us]2875-us farewell in a series . With which [he]181-james was gone .

At the same time a spell was lifted from [me]0-i .

" [Catriona]189-catriona , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " it was [me]0-i it was [my]0-i sword . O , are [you]189-catriona much hurt ? "[0-i]

" [I]2877-i know it , [Davie]222-davie , [I]2877-i am loving [you]222-davie for the pain of it ; it was done defending [that bad man]5004-that bad man , [[my]2877-i father]417-my father . See ! "[2877-i] [she]2877-i said , and showed [me]0-i a bleeding scratch , " see , [you]222-davie have made [a man]519-a man of [me]2877-i now . [I]2877-i will carry a wound like [an old soldier]4667-an old soldier . "[2877-i]

[Joy]393-joy that [she]2877-i should be so little hurt , and the love of [her]2877-i brave nature , supported [me]0-i . [I]0-i embraced [her]2877-i , [I]0-i kissed the wound .

" And am [I]185-alan to be out of the kissing , [me]185-alan that never lost a chance ? "[185-alan] says [Alan]185-alan ; and putting [me]0-i aside and taking [Catriona]189-catriona by either shoulder , " [[My]185-alan dear]3481-my dear , "[185-alan] [he]185-alan said , " [you]3481-my dear re [a true daughter of [Alpin]272-alpin]5009-a true daughter of alpin . By all accounts , [he]272-alpin was [a very fine man]5010-a very fine man , and [he]272-alpin may weel be proud of [you]3481-my dear . If ever [I]185-alan was to get married , it s the marrow of [you]3481-my dear [I]185-alan would be seeking for [a mother to [[my]185-alan sons]5012-my sons]5011-a mother to my sons . And [I]185-alan bear s [a king]2948-a king s name and speak the truth . "[185-alan]

[He]185-alan said it with a serious heat of admiration that was honey to [the girl]517-the girl , and through [her]517-the girl , to [me]0-i . It seemed to wipe [us]2879-us clean of all [James More]181-james s disgraces . And the next moment [he]185-alan was just [himself]185-alan again .

" And now by [your]3481-my dear leave , [[my]185-alan dawties]5014-my dawties , "[185-alan] said [he]185-alan , " this is a very bonny ; but [Alan Breck]185-alan ll be a wee thing nearer to the gallows than [he]185-alan s caring for ; and [Dod]275-dod ! [I]185-alan think this is [a grand place]5015-a grand place to be leaving . "[185-alan]

The word recalled [us]2879-us to some wisdom . [Alan]185-alan ran [upstairs]4608-upstairs and returned with [our]2879-us saddle - bags and [James]181-james More s portmanteau ; [I]0-i picked up [Catriona]189-catriona s bundle where [she]189-catriona had dropped it on the stair ; and [we]2879-us were setting forth out of [that dangerous house]2881-that dangerous house , when [Bazin]387-bazin stopped the way with cries and gesticulations . [He]387-bazin had whipped under a table when the swords were drawn , but now [he]387-bazin was as bold as a lion . There was [his]387-bazin bill to be settled , there was a chair broken , [Alan]185-alan had sat among [his]185-alan dinner things , [James More]181-james had fled .

" Here , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " pay [yourself]387-bazin , "[0-i] and flung [him]387-bazin down some Lewie d ors ; for [I]0-i thought it was no time to be accounting .

[He]387-bazin sprang upon that money , and [we]2879-us passed [him]387-bazin by , and ran forth into the open . Upon three sides of [the house]818-the house were [seamen hasting and closing in]2883-seamen hasting and closing in ; a little nearer to [us]2879-us [James More]181-james waved [his]181-james hat as if to hurry [them]2883-seamen hasting and closing in ; and right behind [him]181-james , like [some foolish person]2884-some foolish person holding up [his]181-james hands , were the sails of [the windmill]2781-the windmill turning .

[Alan]185-alan gave but one glance , and laid [himself]185-alan down to run . [He]387-bazin carried a great weight in [James]181-james More s portmanteau ; but [I]0-i think [he]387-bazin would as soon have lost [his]387-bazin life as cast away that booty which was [his]387-bazin revenge ; and [he]387-bazin ran so that [I]0-i was distressed to follow [him]387-bazin , and marvelled and exulted to see [the girl]517-the girl bounding at [my]0-i side .

As soon as [we]2887-we appeared , [they]2883-seamen hasting and closing in cast off all disguise upon the other side ; and [the seamen]2888-the seamen pursued [us]2887-we with shouts and view - hullohs . [We]2887-we had a start of some two hundred yards , and [they]2883-seamen hasting and closing in were but bandy - legged tarpaulins after all , that could not hope to better [us]2887-we at such an exercise . [I]0-i suppose [they]2883-seamen hasting and closing in were armed , but did not care to use [their]2883-seamen hasting and closing in pistols on French ground . And as soon as [I]0-i perceived that [we]2887-we not only held [our]2887-we advantage but drew a little away , [I]0-i began to feel quite easy of the issue . For all which , it was a hot , brisk bit of work , so long as it lasted ; [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk was still far off ; and when [we]2887-we popped over [a knowe]2889-a knowe , and found [a company of [the garrison]1593-the garrison]2890-a company of the garrison marching on [the other side]3264-the other side on some manouvre , [I]0-i could very well understand the word that [Alan]185-alan had .

[He]185-alan stopped running at once ; and mopping at [his]185-alan brow , " [They]5016-they re [a real bonny folk]5017-a real bonny folk , the French nation , "[185-alan] says [he]185-alan .

CONCLUSION

No sooner were [we]2887-we safe within [the walls of [Dunkirk]161-dunkirk]2893-the walls of dunkirk than [we]2887-we held a very necessary council - of - war on [our]2887-we position . [We]2887-we had taken [a daughter]2630-a daughter from [[her]2630-a daughter father]760-her father at the sword s point ; [any judge]2896-any judge would give [her]2630-a daughter back to [him]760-her father at once , and by all likelihood clap [me]0-i and [Alan]185-alan into [jail]2897-jail ; and though [we]2887-we had an argument upon [our]2887-we side in [Captain Palliser]300-captain palliser s letter , neither [Catriona]189-catriona nor [I]0-i were very keen to be using it in public . Upon all accounts it seemed the most prudent to carry [the girl]517-the girl to [Paris]167-paris to the hands of [[her]517-the girl own chieftain]2899-her own chieftain , [Macgregor of [Bohaldie]394-bohaldie , who would be very willing to help [[his]2899-her own chieftain kinswoman]2901-his kinswoman , on the one hand , and not at all anxious to dishonour [James]181-james upon other]2900-macgregor of bohaldie , who would be very willing to help his kinswoman , on the one hand , and not at all anxious to dishonour james upon other .

[We]2887-we made but a slow journey of it up , for [Catriona]189-catriona was not so good at the riding as the running , and had scarce sat in the saddle since the Forty - five . But [we]2887-we made it out at last , reached [Paris]167-paris early of a Sabbath morning , and made all speed , under [Alan]185-alan s guidance , to find [Bohaldie]394-bohaldie . [He]394-bohaldie was finely lodged , and lived in a good style , having a pension on the Scots Fund , as well as private means ; greeted [Catriona]189-catriona like one of [[his]394-bohaldie own house]2902-his own house , and seemed altogether very civil and discreet , but not particularly open . [We]2887-we asked of the news of [James More]181-james . " [Poor James]395-james ! "[394-bohaldie] said [he]394-bohaldie , and shook [his]394-bohaldie head and smiled , so that [I]0-i thought [he]394-bohaldie knew further than [he]394-bohaldie meant to tell . Then [we]2887-we showed [him]394-bohaldie [Palliser]300-captain palliser s letter , and [he]394-bohaldie drew a long face at that .

" [Poor [James]395-james]5018-poor james ! "[394-bohaldie] said [he]394-bohaldie again . " Well , there are [worse folk]5019-worse folk than [James]395-james More , too . But this is dreadful bad . Tut , tut , [he]394-bohaldie must have forgot [himself]394-bohaldie entirely ! This is a most undesirable letter . But , for all that , [gentlemen]3557-gentlemen , [I]394-bohaldie can not see what [we]2887-we would want to make it public for . It s an ill bird that fouls [his]394-bohaldie own nest , and [we]2887-we are [all Scots folk]5021-all scots folk and [all Hieland]5022-all hieland . "[394-bohaldie]

Upon this [we]2887-we all agreed , save perhaps [Alan]185-alan ; and still more upon the question of [our]2887-we marriage , which [Bohaldie]394-bohaldie took in [his]394-bohaldie own hands , as though there had been [no such person]2903-no such person as [James More]395-james , and gave [Catriona]189-catriona away with very pretty manners and agreeable compliments in French . It was not till all was over , and [our]2887-we healths drunk , that [he]394-bohaldie told [us]2887-we [James]395-james was in [that city]2375-that city , whither [he]395-james had preceded [us]2887-we some days , and where [he]395-james now lay sick , and like to die . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i saw by [[my]0-i wife]2905-my wife s face what way [her]2905-my wife inclination pointed .

" And let [us]2887-we go see [him]395-james , then , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" If it is [your]0-i pleasure , "[189-catriona] said [Catriona]189-catriona . These were early days .

[He]394-bohaldie was lodged in [the same quarter of [the city]471-the city]2906-the same quarter of the city with [[his]394-bohaldie chief]2908-his chief , in [a great house upon a corner]2909-a great house upon a corner ; and [we]2887-we were guided up to the garret where [he]394-bohaldie lay by the sound of Highland piping . It seemed [he]394-bohaldie had just borrowed a set of them from [Bohaldie]394-bohaldie to amuse [his]394-bohaldie sickness ; though [he]394-bohaldie was no such hand as was [[his]394-bohaldie brother]2976-his brother [Rob]262-robin , [he]394-bohaldie made good music of the kind ; and it was strange to observe [the French folk crowding on the stairs]2911-the french folk crowding on the stairs , and some of [them]2911-the french folk crowding on the stairs laughing . [He]394-bohaldie lay propped in a pallet . The first look of [him]394-bohaldie [I]0-i saw [he]394-bohaldie was upon [his]394-bohaldie last business ; and , doubtless , this was a strange place for [him]394-bohaldie to die in . But even now [I]0-i find [I]0-i can scarce dwell upon [his]394-bohaldie end with patience . Doubtless , [Bohaldie]394-bohaldie had prepared [him]394-bohaldie ; [he]394-bohaldie seemed to know [we]2912-we were married , complimented [us]2912-we on the event , and gave [us]2912-we a benediction like [a patriarch]2913-a patriarch .

" [I]394-bohaldie have been never understood , "[394-bohaldie] said [he]394-bohaldie . " [I]394-bohaldie forgive [you]2912-we both without an afterthought ; "[394-bohaldie] after which [he]394-bohaldie spoke for all [the world]3073-the world in [his]394-bohaldie old manner , was so obliging as to play [us]2912-we a tune or two upon [his]394-bohaldie pipes , and borrowed a small sum before [I]0-i left .

[I]0-i could not trace even a hint of shame in any part of [his]394-bohaldie behaviour ; but [he]394-bohaldie was great upon forgiveness ; it seemed always fresh to [him]394-bohaldie . [I]0-i think [he]394-bohaldie forgave [me]0-i every time [we]2912-we met ; and when after some four days [he]394-bohaldie passed away in a kind of odour of affectionate sanctity , [I]0-i could have torn [my]0-i hair out for exasperation . [I]0-i had [him]394-bohaldie buried ; but what to put upon [his]394-bohaldie tomb was quite beyond [me]0-i , till at last [I]0-i considered the date would look best alone .

[I]0-i thought it wiser to resign all thoughts of [Leyden]74-leyden , where [we]2912-we had appeared once as [brother and sister]2915-brother and sister , and it would certainly look strange to return in a new character . [Scotland]182-prestongrange would be doing for [us]2912-we ; and thither , after [I]0-i had recovered that which [I]0-i had left behind , [we]2912-we sailed in [a Low Country ship]2916-a low country ship .

And now , [Miss Barbara Balfour]377-miss balfour to set [the ladies]738-the ladies first , and [[Mr. Alan Balfour]396-mr. alan balfour younger of [Shaws]222-davie]2918-mr. alan balfour younger of shaws , here is the story brought fairly to an end . [A great many of [the folk that took a part in it]2920-the folk that took a part in it]2919-a great many of the folk that took a part in it , [you]2921-you will find if [you]2921-you think well that [you]2921-you have seen and spoken with . [Alison Hastie]203-alison hastie in [Limekilns]135-limekilns was [the lass that rocked [your]2921-you cradle]2922-the lass that rocked your cradle when [you]2921-you were too small to know of it , and walked abroad with [you]2921-you in the policy when [you]2921-you were bigger . [That very fine great lady that is [Miss Barbara]377-miss balfour]2923-that very fine great lady that is miss barbara s name - [mamma]2924-mamma is no other than [the same [Miss Grant]234-miss grant that made so much a fool of [David Balfour]222-davie in [the house of [the Lord Advocate]182-prestongrange]2926-the house of the lord advocate]2925-the same miss grant that made so much a fool of david balfour in the house of the lord advocate . And [I]0-i wonder whether [you]2921-you remember [a little , lean , lively gentleman in a scratch - wig and a wraprascal]2927-a little , lean , lively gentleman in a scratch - wig and a wraprascal , that came to [Shaws]222-davie very late of a dark night , and whom [you]2921-you were awakened out of [your]2921-you beds and brought down to [the dining - hall]2928-the dining - hall to be presented to , by the name of [Mr. Jamieson]397-mr. jamieson ? Or has [Alan]396-mr. alan balfour forgotten what [he]396-mr. alan balfour did at [Mr. Jamieson]397-mr. jamieson s request a most disloyal act for which , by the letter of the law , [he]396-mr. alan balfour might be hanged no less than drinking [the king]590-the king s health across the water ? These were strange doings in [a good Whig house]2930-a good whig house ! But [Mr. Jamieson]397-mr. jamieson is [a man]519-a man privileged , and might set fire to [[my]0-i corn - barn]2932-my corn - barn ; and the name [they]2933-they know [him]397-mr. jamieson by now in [France]50-france is [the Chevalier Stewart]398-the chevalier stewart .

As for [Davie]222-davie and [Catriona]189-catriona , [I]0-i shall watch [you]2921-you pretty close in the next days , and see if [you]2921-you are so bold as to be laughing at [papa]3356-papa and [mamma]2924-mamma . It is true [we]2936-we were not so wise as [we]2936-we might have been , and made a great deal of sorrow out of nothing ; but [you]2921-you will find as [you]2921-you grow up that even [the artful Miss Barbara]234-miss grant , and even [the valiant Mr. Alan]396-mr. alan balfour , will be not so very much wiser than [[their]2937-their parents]2938-their parents . For the life of [man]3015-man upon [this world of]2940-this world of [ours]2936-we is a funny business . [They]2941-they talk of [the angels]2942-the angels weeping ; but [I]0-i think [they]2941-they must more often be holding [their]2941-they sides as [they]2941-they look on ; and there was one thing [I]0-i determined to do when [I]0-i began this long story , and that was to tell out everything as it befell .
